subject: ARCH
title: Historic Preservation Practicum (3)
desc: Applies course work in historic preservation to hands-on activities under the direction of practicing professionals and University faculty. Historic preservation certificate students only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: TRMD
title: Principles of Medical Parasitology (2)
desc: Epidemiology, pathogenesis, immunobiology and diagnostic aspects of human parasitic infections; principles of host-pathogen interactions; public health aspects of parasitic infections. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: MICR 351 with a grade of B or higher or equivalent. (Spring only)
metadata: Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: LSJD
title: SJD Dissertation (V)
desc: Research and writing of SJD dissertation under supervision of dissertation advisor. Repeatable four times, up to 60 credits. LAW students only. Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory only.
metadata: Law-Doctor of Juridical Science (LSJD) William S. Richardson School of Law

subject: HON
title: Directed Reading/Research (V)
desc: Directed reading and/or research. Repeatable 3 times or up to 12 credits.
metadata: Honors (HON) Office of Academic Excellence

subject: AMST
title: Food, Culture, and Empire (3)
desc: Examines the cultural, historical, and political processes that have informed our understandings and practices involving food. We will analyze food and foodways in the U.S. and Hawai‘i. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. Pre: at least one course in WGSS or ES; or consent by instructor. (Cross-listed as ES 450 and WGSS 450)
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: LAW
title: Introduction to Space Law & Policy (V)
desc: Acquaints students with the fundamental principles of space law and policy, including the pre- and post-Sputnik history of space exploration. LAW majors only. Pre: LWPA 585 with a minimum grade of C-.
metadata: Law (LAW) William S. Richardson School of Law

subject: ASAN
title: Advanced Research and Writing in Asian Studies (3)
desc: Provides a structured overview of research and writing process, focused on Asia. Topics include research questions, abstracts, literature reviews, arguments, conceptualization, incorporating evidence, research ethics, and style. Students are required to produce a research paper. Pre: 600 or consent.
metadata: Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: IS
title: (Alpha) Sophomore Seminar (3)
desc: Special inquiry-based study of multi-disciplinary topics in particular historical, cultural, geographical, environmental, or other contexts. Emphasis on primary sources and/or fieldwork and extensive instruction in writing. (B) biological science; (H) humanities; (P) physical science; (R) arts; (S) social science; (T) literature. Repeatable one time. A-F only. (Cross-listed as HON 291)  DB  for (B);  DH  for (H);  DP  for (P);  DA  for (R);  DS  for (S);  DL  for (T)
metadata: DA DB DH DL DP DS Interdisciplinary Studies (IS) Office of Academic Excellence

subject: ME
title: (Alpha) Mentored Projects (1)
desc: Investigation of advanced problems, making use of faculty expertise for specific domains of work. (B) Design Project I; (C) Design Project II; (D) Research and Experiment Design. Junior or senior standing only. ME majors only. A-F only. Pre: instructor consent. Co-requisite: 481 for (B); 482 for (C); 483 for (D).
metadata: College of Engineering Mechanical Engineering (ME)

subject: TPSS
title: Internship Experience (3)
desc: Internship field experience for TPSS majors. TPSS majors only. A-F only. Pre: 200/SUST 211 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources Tropical Plant and Soil Sciences (TPSS)

subject: EPET
title: Introduction to Human Spaceflight (4)
desc: Effects of spaceflight conditions on human physiology and psychology. Astronaut selection, training, crew composition. Ethics of space exploration. Politics & sociology of public and private human space flight. Selection of capstone project. Significant written communication. A-F only. Pre: EPET/ME 201 and PHYS 272. (Fall only)
metadata: Earth and Planetary Exploration Technology (EPET) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: EPET
title: Human Spaceflight Mission Elements (4)
desc: Engineering aspects of spacecraft design, subsystems, science payload, systems engineering, project management, and budgets for human spaceflight missions. Design of environmental control and life support systems. Capstone project design. Significant oral and written communication. A-F only. Pre: 321. (Spring only)
metadata: Earth and Planetary Exploration Technology (EPET) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ACC
title: (Alpha) Accounting Capstone (2)
desc: Integration of numerous elements of the accounting program. Current accounting issues discussed. Lectures, discussions, case analysis. (B) managerial-tax-ethics; emphasis on instruction in writing; (C) financial-auditing-accounting information systems. ACC majors only. A-F only. Pre: 401 (or concurrent) and 418 (or concurrent) for (B); 418 (or concurrent) for (C).
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: QHS
title: Cultural Competence in Biomedical Research I (3)
desc: Introductory lecture-seminar on the conduct of multidisciplinary research from a culturally competent perspective. A-F only.
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Quantitative Health Sciences (QHS)

subject: ME
title: Research and Experiment Design (3)
desc: Introduction to research and experimentation via pursuit and reporting of an open-ended design project. Ethical issues in research and experimentation. Engineering, Biological Engineering, and Ocean & Resources Engineering majors only. Senior standing or higher. A-F only. (Fall only)
metadata: College of Engineering Mechanical Engineering (ME)

subject: CEE
title: Applied Mathematics for Engineers (3)
desc: Application of advanced mathematics to engineering phenomena; linear algebra, Eigen systems; partial differentiation and multiple integrals; vector/tensor analysis; Fourier series/transforms and Laplace transform; ordinary/partial differential equations; probability and statistics. CE, ME, ORE, and ECE majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. (Alt. years: fall)
metadata: Civil, Environmental and Construction Engineering (CEE) College of Engineering

subject: SUST
title: Internship for Sustainability and Social Justice (3)
desc: Internship in public, private, or non-profit organizations providing opportunity for practical experience in addressing sustainability issues. Repeatable one time. Sophomore standing or higher, or consent. A-F only. Consent of instructor. (Cross-listed as SOC 394)
metadata: Institute for Sustainability & Resilience Sustainability (SUST)

subject: SOC
title: Internship for Sustainability and Social Justice (3)
desc: Internship in public, private, or non-profit organizations providing opportunity for practical experience in addressing sustainability issues. Repeatable one time. Sophomore standing or higher, or consent. A-F only. Consent of instructor. (Cross-listed as SUST 394)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Sociology (SOC)

subject: JOUR
title: Governing, Policy, and Political Journalism (3)
desc: Survey of the institutions of democratic governance and the role of journalism in covering and analyzing public policy. A-F only. (Cross-listed as PACE 301)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Journalism (JOUR)

subject: IP
title: (Alpha) Southeast Asian Travelogue: People, Places, and Practices (3)
desc: A virtual guided tour of Southeast Asia that explores its multiculture diversity through its people, places, and practices. (P) Philippines; (V) Vietnam. Sophomore standing or consent. A-F only.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Indo-Pacific Languages (IP) Indo-Pacific Languages and Literatures

subject: ICS
title: Software Techniques for Computer Visual Effects (3)
desc: Principles, techniques, and history of visual effects and underlying software techniques for computer visual effects. Project-based course involving the merging of computer generated imagery with live action footage. A-F only. Pre: 487.
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Information and Computer Sciences (ICS)

subject: ICS
title: Topics in Computer Graphics (3)
desc: Review of selected graphics literature, with a software development project based on a topic of interest. A-F only. Pre: 481.
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Information and Computer Sciences (ICS)

subject: ICS
title: Digital Content Creation II (4)
desc: Software development within a commercial 3D application with a focus on scripting and plugin development for procedural modeling, animation, and shading. A-F only. Pre: 487.
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Information and Computer Sciences (ICS)

subject: ICS
title: Digital Content Creation I (4)
desc: Principles, techniques, and history of 3D computer graphics. Modeling and animation techniques will be covered, as well as basic lighting and rendering. A-F only. Pre: 481.
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Information and Computer Sciences (ICS)

subject: PH
title: Public Health Student Success in the College Experience (2)
desc: Required for entering PH majors to gain strategies for a successful college experience while studying public health. Students will examine academic and career goals and implement strategies to achieve them. PH majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Public Health Sciences (PH) Thompson School of Social Work & Public Health

subject: HWST
title: ‘A‘a Ka Hula: Introduction to Hula (3)
desc: Introductory-level, performance-based Hula (Dance) exploring Kanaka Maoli identity and world view through ancestral knowledge as presented in Mele (Song, Poetry) and Moʻolelo (History and Literatures). A-F only. Pre: 107, and HAW 100 or HAW 101.
metadata: DA Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian Studies (HWST)

subject: GEO
title: Seminar: Geographies of Migration (3)
desc: Topics vary; may include immigration, borders, refugees, asylum, climate change, and displacement. Repeatable one time. A-F only.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: EDCS
title: Autoethnography in Education (3)
desc: Exploration and application of autoethnography as a self-reflexive research method that utilizes the retelling of lived experience and emotion to examine historical, critical, and social topics. Graduate students only.
metadata: College of Education Curriculum Studies (EDCS)

subject: ASAN
title: Career Pathways in Asian Studies (3)
desc: Explore the range of careers related to Asian Studies and develop skills and materials to build your academic success into a meaningful career. Students create a job search portfolio they can share with prospective employers.
metadata: Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: SPED
title: Special Education Law and Compliance (3)
desc: Analysis of legislation, litigation, and administrative rulings in special education, with an emphasis on teaching expository writing and developing legally sound policies/procedures that ensure educationally meaningful and legally correct education for students with disabilities. BEd in SPED majors only. A-F only. (Summer only)
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: CEE
title: Negotiation (3)
desc: Theory and practice of negotiation. Exploration of appropriate strategies, tactics, and communication techniques. Study of dyadic multi-party, cross-cultural, and assisted negotiations. (Cross-listed as MGT 660)
metadata: Civil, Environmental and Construction Engineering (CEE) College of Engineering

subject: MGT
title: High Growth Entrepreneurship (V)
desc: An interdisciplinary (JD-MBA) course examining legal, business, and technology issues related to building high growth companies. Student teams develop company feasibility reports and skills necessary to advise or build high growth businesses. Recommended: 531. Law, MBA, and ME students only. (Once a year) (Cross-listed as LAW 560 and ME 680)
metadata: Management and Industrial Relations Shidler College of Business

subject: MBIO
title: Place-Based Pedagogy for Course-Based Undergraduate Research Experiences (1)
desc: Introduces students to place-based science education with an emphasis on Hawaiʻi marine science classrooms. Includes discussions on inclusive teaching methods, CUREs, and effective instruction in laboratory and field environments. A-F only. Instructor approval required. Co-requisite: 795. (Summer only)
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Marine Biology (MBIO) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ES
title: Raciolinguistics (3)
desc: Theory and applications of critical race studies, ethnic studies, and linguistic anthropology as they pertain to the science of language, language behavior, language attitudes, and language in the public sphere. (Cross-listed as LING 418)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Ethnic Studies (ES)

subject: LING
title: Raciolinguistics (3)
desc: Theory and applications of critical race studies, ethnic studies, and linguistic anthropology as they pertain to the science of language, language behavior, language attitudes, and language in the public sphere. (Cross-listed as ES 451)
metadata: DS College of Arts, Languages & Letters Linguistics (LING)

subject: HWST
title: Kū Ka Pūnohu: Intermediate Oli (3)
desc: Intermediate-level, performance-based Oli (Chant) course exploring Kanaka Maoli identity and world view through ancestral knowledge as presented in Mele (Song, Poetry) and Moʻolelo (History and Literatures). A-F only. Pre: 214, and HAW 201 (or concurrent).
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian Studies (HWST)

subject: HWST
title: Ke Haʻa Lā: Intermediate Hula
desc: Intermediate-level, performance-based Hula (Dance) course exploring Kanaka Maoli identity and world view through ancestral knowledge as presented in Mele (Song, Poetry) and Moʻolelo (History and Literatures). Pre: 212, and HAW 201 (or concurrent), or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian Studies (HWST)

subject: HWST
title: Kūnihi Ka Mauna: Introduction to Oli (3)
desc: (2 1-hr Lec, 1 2-hr Lab/practice) Introductory-level, performance-based Oli (Chant) exploring Kanaka Maoli identity and world view through ancestral knowledge as presented in Mele (Song, Poetry) and Moʻolelo (History and Literatures). Pre: 107, and HAW 100 or HAW 101.
metadata: DA Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian Studies (HWST)

subject: BIOM
title: Clinical Research Review (1)
desc: Research elective for medical students. MD students only. CR/NC only. Pre: MDED 554 or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: Biomedical Sciences (BIOM) John A. Burns School of Medicine

subject: HWST
title: Indigenous Futurisms: Hawaiʻi, Polynesia, and Beyond (3)
desc: Seminar on Indigenous Futurisms as developed in Hawaiʻi, Polynesia, and other Indigenous contexts, and expressed through art, literature, film, music, and scholarship.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian Studies (HWST)

subject: JPN
title: Japanese Language Abroad Electives (V)
desc: Students will directly enroll in Japanese language courses at J.F. Oberlin University or Konan University. Repeatable two times for different topics, up to nine credits. A-F only. Pre: instructor consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters East Asian Languages and Literatures (EALL) Japanese (JPN)

subject: PACE
title: ‘Ike Kūpuna: Introduction to Indigenous Frameworks for Peace Building (3)
desc: Survey of the concepts and major theories of indigenous epistemology that can create social change. Pre: any 100- or 200-level DS course.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Peace Studies (PACE)

subject: MBIO
title: Internship in College Teaching (Marine Science) (V)
desc: Introduction to college-level science teaching; masters or doctoral students serve as apprentices to professors; responsibilities include supervised teaching, planning and evaluation. Repeatable unlimited times. CR/NC only. Pre: instructor approval. (Summer only)
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Marine Biology (MBIO) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: LING
title: Topics in Linguistics (3)
desc: Variable topics in special areas of Linguistics, depending on instructor interest. Repeatable two times. Pre: 320.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Linguistics (LING)

subject: JPN
title: Linquistic Analysis of Manga & Anime (3)
desc: Study of basic linguistic concepts and phenomena through manga and anime (and other Japanese fiction). Class activities will consist of lecture, discussion, and analysis of linguistic data. Pre: 202, 205, 217, or consent.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters East Asian Languages and Literatures (EALL) Japanese (JPN)

subject: WGSS
title: Intersectional Feminist Geographies (3)
desc: Explores space and place from intersectional feminist perspectives including Indigenous, Black, island, post-colonial and queer geographies. Focuses on contemporary case studies in gender and sexuality. Sophomore standing or higher. A-F only. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as GEO 343)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Women, Gender, & Sexuality Studies (WGSS)

subject: GEO
title: Intersectional Feminist Geographies (3)
desc: Explores space and place from intersectional feminist perspectives including Indigenous, Black, island, post-colonial and queer geographies. Focuses on contemporary case studies in gender and sexuality. A-F only. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as WGSS 343)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: ASTR
title: Stars and Planets Lunch and Talks (SPLAT) Seminar (1)
desc: Seminar for graduate students and researchers discussing the latest results on solar, stellar, and exoplanet research. Repeatable one time. ASTR majors only. Graduate students only. CR/NC only.
metadata: Astronomy (ASTR) College of Natural Sciences

subject: NAVL
title: United States Pacific Fleet Internship (6)
desc: Leadership development, teamwork, and activities designed for NROTC students. Learn how to write a federal resume, be a Federal Employee, and learn the skills needed to complete and present their U.S. Pacific Fleet capstone project. CR/NC only. Pre: 100L, 101, 102, 201, 202, 303, 304, or 402. (Summer only)
metadata: Naval Science and Leadership (NAVL) ROTC

subject: CALL
title: Exploring Expression: Foundations in Arts, Languages & Letters (1)
desc: First-year seminar for majors in the College of Arts, Languages & Letters that includes emphasis on the introduction to studies in a liberal arts curriculum and emphasizes the importance of writing in this discipline. CALL majors only, or consent. Freshmen only. A-F only. (Fall only)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters College of Arts, Languages & Letters (CALL)

subject: CHN
title: Media Analysis in Chinese (3)
desc: Use authentic materials, including texts, videos, and postings from social media with Advanced and Superior level discourse and content to build Superior Chinese proficiency and social media literacy, and understand society and contemporary issues. Pre: 402, or 404, or 405, or instructor consent.
metadata: Chinese (CHN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters East Asian Languages and Literatures (EALL)

subject: ASAN
title: East Asian Popular Cultures (3)
desc: East Asian popular culture, with a focus on Korea and Japan, as well as the Chinese language sphere. Analyzes social forces shaping pop culture industries, artists, and productions in the region from a global perspective. A-F only. (Cross-listed as SOC 259)
metadata: DS Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: SOC
title: East Asian Popular Cultures (3)
desc: East Asian popular culture, with a focus on Korea and Japan, as well as the Chinese language sphere. Analyzes social forces shaping pop culture industries, artists, and productions in the region from a global perspective. A-F only. (Cross-listed as ASAN 259)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Sociology (SOC)

subject: HAW
title: Mo‘olelo Pōkole (3)
desc: Development of reading comprehension, pronunciation, vocabulary, and Hawaiian cultural knowledge through reading of Hawaiian language short stories. Short stories are from primary and secondary sources written by a variety of authors across different time periods. Pre: 202 or consent.
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: LAW
title: Native Health Ethics, Law, and Policy (3)
desc: Review theories and laws concerning health care ethics, policy, and practice using Indigenous case studies. Topics include Indigenous health systems, advocacy, and the intersecting issues of self-determination, ethics, agenda setting, and the policy cycle. A-F only. (Once a year) (Cross-listed as PH 673)
metadata: Law (LAW) William S. Richardson School of Law

subject: CINE
title: Movement Study for Animation (3)
desc: Creating the illusion of life and expressive movement through the principles of 2D animation: timing, spacing, physics, staging, anatomy, attitude, and acting. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 216.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Visual Development for Animation (3)
desc: Visual design and development for animated characters and environments. Students will create concept art, character, and prop designs; movements styles; backgrounds; and layouts for animation pre-production. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 216.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: MUS
title: Musical Meaning: How Music Shapes Identity (3)
desc: The role of music from Africa, Asia, and Hawai‘i in shaping and expressing culture in the U.S. Freshmen or sophomore standing only. A-F only. (Spring only)
metadata: FGB College of Arts, Languages & Letters Music (MUS)

subject: ASAN
title: Transpacific Youth Pop Culture: From K-pop to Tiktok (3)
desc: Examines ties between East Asian and Asian American digital media, including comics, movies, TV shows, music, and video games, to examine the dreams, fears, and aspirations of young Asians and Asian Americans. A-F only (Summer only)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: SLS
title: Language by the Numbers (3)
desc: Understanding quantitative information and analyses related to language and language learning/multilingualism. Topics include data description and visualization, basic statistics, and evaluating quantitative analyses. A-F only.
metadata: FQ College of Arts, Languages & Letters Second Language Studies (SLS)

subject: CINE
title: Visual Development for Animation (3)
desc: Visual design and development for animated characters and environments. Students will create concept art, character and prop designs, movement styles, backgrounds, and layouts for animation pre-production. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 216.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: SPAN
title: Spanish Translation Studies (3)
desc: Study of social, cultural, and pragmatic issues in Spanish Translation Studies. Graduate students only. Pre: consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Languages and Literatures of Europe and the Americas (LLEA) Spanish (SPAN)

subject: HIST
title: Global History of Food (3)
desc: Exploration of food and eating from historical, cultural, economic, and geopolitical perspectives. Includes both historical and contemporary issues.
metadata: FGB College of Arts, Languages & Letters History (HIST)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to Stage, Screen, and New Media Writing (3)
desc: Introduction to college level writing and information literacy for and about the stage (theatre, dance, performance), the screen (film, television), and new media (digital platforms, social media). A-F only. (Cross-listed as DNCE 100)
metadata: FW College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA) Theatre and Dance

subject: DNCE
title: Introduction to Stage, Screen, and New Media Writing (3)
desc: Introduction to college level writing and information literacy for and about the stage (theatre, dance, performance), the screen (film, television), and new media (digital platforms, social media). A-F only. (Cross-listed as THEA 100)
metadata: FW College of Arts, Languages & Letters Dance (DNCE) Theatre and Dance

subject: ASAN
title: Introduction to Research and Writing in Asian Studies (3)
desc: Introduction to research and writing in Asian Studies provides a structured overview of the research and writing process from an interdisciplinary perspective, focused on Asia. A-F only. (Fall only)
metadata: FW Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: GERI
title: Directed Reading and Research (V)
desc: One-on-one independent study for students interested in geriatrics and/or palliative medicine. Students will work with a faculty mentor to define an area of interest and meet regularly for guidance and feedback. Repeatable unlimited times. CR/NC only.
metadata: Geriatric Medicine (GERI) John A. Burns School of Medicine

subject: SOCS
title: Advanced Digital Media for Social, Cultural, and Community Engagement (3)
desc: Advanced digital media techniques for creating high-quality video content that promotes social, cultural, and community engagement. Focus on writing and oral skills with emphasis on visual storytelling and distribution on broadcast and social media platforms. A-F only. Junior standing or higher. Pre: 370 or instructor approval. (Fall only)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Social Sciences (SOCS)

subject: SOCS
title: Intermediate Digital Media Design and Production for the Social Sciences (3)
desc: Focus on theoretical and practical methods for media design and production of high-quality creative digital content. Emphasis on social media strategies and oral communication skills to attract mass online audiences. A-F only. Junior standing or higher. Pre: 270 or instructor approval. (Spring only)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Social Sciences (SOCS)

subject: CEE
title: Senior Design Project & Professional Ethics (3)
desc: Design problem involving several areas of civil engineering and requiring a team approach for a solution. Oral communication skills are assessed through multiple presentations to an industry. Engineering ethics, ethical decision making and deliberation. A-F only. CEE or CNST majors only. Senior standing only. Pre: 220, 250, and 305. (Fall only)
metadata: Civil, Environmental and Construction Engineering (CEE) College of Engineering

subject: ENG
title: Film History (3)
desc: Introduction to the history of film as art, industry, and socio-cultural representation from the invention of the moving picture to 1965. Pre: one ENG DL course or consent.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters English (ENG)

subject: ENG
title: Film, Literature, and Adaptation (3)
desc: Comparative analysis of literary texts and their screen adaptations. Pre: one ENG DL course or consent.
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters English (ENG)

subject: ELI
title: Intermediate Academic Literacy (3)
desc: Introduction to the academic English-language literacy demands required at the university. Extensive practice in academic reading, writing, and vocabulary development. Designed as a bridge to advanced-level ELI courses in reading and writing. CR/NC only.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters English Language Institute (ELI)

subject: SUST
title: Environmental Issues (3)
desc: Global environmental problems in historical perspective; physical, biological, sociocultural views. Pre: one of BIOL 101, BIOL 123, or GEO 101; or consent. (Cross-listed as BIOL 310)
metadata: DB Institute for Sustainability & Resilience Sustainability (SUST)

subject: DNCE
title: Advanced Topics in Performance in Hawai‘i (3)
desc: Analysis of Hawai‘i’s indigenous performance traditions, the contemporary multicultural landscape of theatre in Ko Hawai‘i Pae ‘āina, and the representation of Kanaka Maoli and settler voices on Hawai‘i’s stages. Repeatable one time. Graduate students only. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as THEA 668)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Dance (DNCE) Theatre and Dance

subject: DNCE
title: Performance Theory (3)
desc: Introduction to key texts and concepts of performance studies. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as THEA 615)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Dance (DNCE) Theatre and Dance

subject: PUBA
title: Public Policy and Advocacy (3)
desc: Designed to deepen students’ ability to understand and influence the policy process in Hawai‘i and the U.S. Topics include theories of the policy process, and advocacy strategies, legal constraints, and coalition building. PUBA majors only or approval of instructor. A-F only.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Public Administration (PUBA)

subject: OCN
title: Aquatic Chemistry (3)
desc: Chemical reactions support lie and stabilize Earth’s climate. We explore marine and fresh waters through chemical dquilibrium and reaction kinetics. Topics include mineral stability, ocean acidification, complexation/bioavailability, pollution, and quantitative approximation of natural systems. Pre: 623 (or concurrent), or consent. (Alt. years: spring)
metadata: Oceanography (OCN) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: COM
title: Media Effects (3)
desc: Critical examination of major media effects theories and topic areas. Must be enrolled in one of the following majors: COM, CIS majors only. A-F only. Pre: 611 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Communication (COM)

subject: BIOL
title: Current Topics in Biomedical Research Seminar (1)
desc: Overview of contemporary laboratory- and  population-based studies of disease. Discussion of career pathways in human health sciences. Public health and epidemiology of cancer. A-F only. Pre: 171 (or concurrent). (Fall only)
metadata: Biology (BIOL) School of Life Sciences

subject: COMG
title: Science Communication (3)
desc: Introduction to principles for communicating science information effectively to a variety of audiences including the general public, policy makers, and profession peers. Application of these principles to create written and oral science communication products. Restricted to students with 60 or more credits. A-F only.
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Communicology (COMG)

subject: ICS
title: Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (3)
desc: Covers the latest developments in human-centered artificial intelligence, including ethics, bias, explainability, privacy, fairness, and usability. Involves discussion, writing assignments, and a final project. A-F only.
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Information and Computer Sciences (ICS)

subject: SUST
title: Climate, Air Quality, & Policy (3)
desc: Examination of air quality problems from scientific and policy perspectives. Includes case studies that explore economic, political, technical, and legal aspects of pollution control. Pre: junior standing or higher, or consent. (Cross-listed as GEO 404)
metadata: DS Institute for Sustainability & Resilience Sustainability (SUST)

subject: COM
title: Public Diplomacy and Communication (3)
desc: Analysis of the emerging trends in international relations from communication and public relations perspectives. Focuses on factors, characteristics, and processes. COM majors only. A-F only. Pre: 611 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Communication (COM)

subject: COM
title: Environmental Storytelling Through an Indigenous Lens (3)
desc: Through media arts storytelling techniques, will focus on reframing perspectives and creativity from an Indigenous lens to communicate environmental-centric stories geared toward improving our communities’ quality of life. COM majors only or consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Communication (COM)

subject: ERTH
title: Coastal Geochemistry (3)
desc: Covers aqueous geochemistry at the land-ocean interface, including the distribution of major and minor ions, trace metals, organic chemicals, and nutrients. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 200 or 201, CHEM 162, and MATH 241 or MATH 251A; or consent. (Alt. years: spring)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: NREM
title: Soil Plant Nutrient Relations (4)
desc: (2 Lec, 2 3-hr Lab) Soil-plant interactions, emphasis on characteristics of tropical soils and plants influencing nutrient uptake by plants. Diagnostic methods to identify nutrient deficiencies and element toxicity. Pre: 450 (with a minimum grade of C-) or consent. (Cross-listed as TPSS 650)
metadata: College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources Natural Resources and Environmental Management (NREM)

subject: SUST
title: The Natural Environment Lab (1)
desc: A survey of field and laboratory methods commonly used by physical geographers. Pre: GEO 101 (or concurrent). (Cross-listed as GEO 101L)
metadata: DY Institute for Sustainability & Resilience Sustainability (SUST)

subject: CEE
title: CAD/BIM/3D Visualization (3)
desc: Computer-aided drafting (CAD) tools using AutoCAD and Revit. AutoCAD interface, titleblocks, model/paper space, viewports, texts and annotation, dimensioning. Basics of BIM, toolbox, modeling techniques, annotating, dimensioning. CAD drafting to real-world engineering applications. Repeatable one time. Restricted to CEE majors. Sophomore standing or higher.
metadata: Civil, Environmental and Construction Engineering (CEE) College of Engineering

subject: CEE
title: Surveying/Geodesy/Geomatics (3)
desc: Plane surveying for cadastral, engineering, and construction applications including taping, leveling, traverses, bearings and azimuths, areas and volumes, EDM. Geodesy, map projections, satellite geodesy (GPS), geodetic surveying and photogrammetry. Field lab in notes and procedures. Repeatable one time. Restricted to CEE majors. Sophomore standing or higher. Pre: MATH 252A or 242.
metadata: Civil, Environmental and Construction Engineering (CEE) College of Engineering

subject: CINE
title: Costumes I: Beginning Costume Design (3)
desc: Basic principles and approaches to costume design for theatre and dance. Visual communication methods, creative process, historical research, and organizational practices. Repeatable one time. Pre: 240, or consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 356 and THEA 356)
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Scenic I: Beginning Scenic Design (3)
desc: Workshop introducing the basic principles and approaches of scenic design for theatre and dance, with emphasis on the creative process. Pre: a course in THEA or DNCE, production experience, or consent. (Consent required for production experience option) (Cross-listed as DNCE 353 and THEA 353)
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ICS
title: Software Quality and Maintenance (3)
desc: Introduction to software quality concepts and the major activities involved in software maintenance. A-F only.
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Information and Computer Sciences (ICS)

subject: DNCE
title: Introduction to Oceanic Dance (V)
desc: Beginning techniques of Oceanic dance. Repeatable three times, up to 12 credits
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Dance (DNCE) Theatre and Dance

subject: DNCE
title: Introduction to Balinese Dance (V)
desc: Beginning techniques of Balinese dance. Repeatable three times, up to 12 credits.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Dance (DNCE) Theatre and Dance

subject: CEE
title: Machine Learning in Civil and Environmental Engineering and Earth Science (3)
desc: Statistical machine learning and deep learning methods. Script languages for data-driven model training, validation and test. Analysis with linear algebra and statistics. Applications to engineering and earth science problems. Pre: consent; knowledge of Python Programming desirable. (Alt. years: fall)
metadata: Civil, Environmental and Construction Engineering (CEE) College of Engineering

subject: GES
title: Advanced Environmental Data Science (3)
desc: Advanced applications of environmental data science: combine data with Bayesian inference, make predictions using artificial neural networks, and analyze data in space and time using the Python language with biological and geophysical datasets. GES majors only A-F only. Pre: 302 and 371 and MATH 242. (Fall only)
metadata: Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Environmental Data Science (3)
desc: Provides an introduction to environmental data science by applying python-based programming techniques to Earth science datasets. GES majors only. A-F only. Pre: MATH 242, and ICS 110P or ICS 110C or ERTH 250. (Spring only)
metadata: Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: PH
title: Systematic Literature Review in Public Health (3)
desc: Imparts skills in conducting a systematic review of the literature. Students provided critiques by instructor and classmates on their written and presented work. Intended for doctoral students to complete their qualifying paper. Repeatable one time. PH majors only; doctoral students only. A-F only. Pre: consent or PhD in PH or EPID only.
metadata: Public Health Sciences (PH) Thompson School of Social Work & Public Health

subject: ASTR
title: Modern Extragalactic Astronomy (3)
desc: Use of astronomical surveys to map large-scale distribution of galaxies. Internal structure & dynamics of galaxies. Evolution of galaxy populations over cosmic time. Theoretical understanding of galaxy formation in context of modern Big Bang cosmology. Pre: 210 or 242; and 300 (or concurrent); and PHYS 152 or PHYS 274. Recommended: 280. (Alt. years: spring)
metadata: DP Astronomy (ASTR) College of Natural Sciences

subject: NURS
title: Clinical: Psychiatric-Mental Health Advanced Practice Nursing Across the Lifespan III (V)
desc: Repeatable one time, up to six credits. Complements NURS 688; prepares DNP students to become psychiatric-mental health nurse practitioners; and incorporates the accrual of 135 clinical hours. Repeatable one time or up to six credits. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Theory: Psychiatric-Mental Health Advanced Practice Nursing Across the Lifespan III (3)
desc: The final of three courses focused on preparing students in the Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) Program to become psychiatric-mental health nurse practitioners (PMHNPs). NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Family and Group Psychotherapy for Psychiatric-Mental Health Nurse Practitioners (3)
desc: Major approaches in family and group psychotherapy are examined in this course. The role of the PMHNP and issues in providing care across the lifespan, among diverse populations, in traditional and non-traditional settings are addressed. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Clinical: Psychiatric-Mental Health Advanced Practice Nursing Across the Lifespan II (V)
desc: Repeatable one time, up to six credits. Complements NURS 686; prepares DNP students to become psychiatric-mental health nurse practitioners; and incorporates the accrual of 135 clinical hours. Repeatable one time or up to six credits. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Theory: Psychiatric-Mental Health Advanced Practice Nursing Across the Lifespan II (3)
desc: The second of three courses focused on preparing students in the Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) Program to become psychiatric-mental health nurse practitioners (PMHNPs). NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Individual Psychotherapy for Psychiatric-Mental Health Nurse Practitioners (3)
desc: Major modalities of individual psychotherapy, such as psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral, brief solution-focused, and multicultural approaches will be examined. Critical dialogue about race, gender, culture, sexuality and socioeconomic status will be applied to case studies and reenactments. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Clinical: Psychiatric-Mental Health Advanced Practice Nursing Across the Lifespan I (V)
desc: Repeatable one time, up to six credits. Complements NURS 684; prepares DNP students to become psychiatric-mental health nurse practitioners; and incorporates the accrual of 135 clinical hours. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Theory: Psychiatric-Mental Health Advanced Practice Nursing Across the Lifespan I (3)
desc: First of three courses focused on preparing students in the Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) Program to become psychiatric-mental health nurse practitioners (PMHNPs). NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Psychobiology of Mental Health Disorders (3)
desc: Focuses on the psychological and biological factors that influence mental health and illness among diverse groups of individuals across the lifespan. Relevant biopsychosocial theories and research findings are applied. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Advanced Psychopharmacology Across the Lifespan (3)
desc: Examines the legal, ethical and therapeutic role of the psychiatric-mental health nurse practitioner (PMHNP) in prescribing psychotropic medications for diverse groups of individuals across the lifespan. Diverse biopsychosocial perspectives will be considered. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: EALL
title: Writing East Asia (3)
desc: An introduction to writing analytically and cross-culturally about East Asia (China, Japan, Korea) and various aspects of East Asian culture. (Fall only)
metadata: FW College of Arts, Languages & Letters East Asian Languages and Literatures (EALL)

subject: OCN
title: Global Environmental Change (3)
desc: Global environmental change problems such as carbon dioxide and the greenhouse effect, acid rain, chlorofluorocarbons and the ozone layer, global deforestation and the effect on climate, etc. Pre: 200, OCN 201, ERTH 101, ERTH 103, or ERTH 170; or consent. (Cross-listed as ATMO 310)
metadata: DP Oceanography (OCN) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: BIOL
title: Natural History of Hawaiian Islands (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 1-hr Lab) Geography, geology, climatology, biotic environment of Pacific Basin and Hawaiian Islands; endemism and evolution in terrestrial and marine biota. Pre: one semester of biological sciences at college level. (Cross-listed as SUST 450)
metadata: DB Biology (BIOL) College of Natural Sciences School of Life Sciences

subject: CINE
title: Screening Asian Americans (3)
desc: Survey of Asian and Asian American representations in American film and television from the silent era to the present, with an emphasis on Orientalism and multiculturalism, as well as performance and spectatorship. SCA majors: A-F only. Pre: junior standing or consent. (Cross-listed as AMST 352)
metadata: DH ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: SOCS
title: Introduction to Digital Media for the Social Sciences (3)
desc: Incorporates hands on instruction for creating informational media content, to include learning how to use camera and sound equipment, learning how to edit and create graphics, and learning presentation techniques. Sophomore standing or higher. A-F only.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Social Sciences (SOCS)

subject: SUST
title: Climate Change (3)
desc:
Introduction to the science of climate change focusing on Earth’s past, present and future, specifically, the causes, consequences, and record of past changes; future projections, 
mitigation, and adaptation. Appropriate for both science and non-science majors. Pre: ERTH 101 or ERTH 103 or ERTH 104 or ERTH 106 or ERTH 111 or ERTH 130 or ATMO 101 or GES 102, or consent. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as ERTH 201)
metadata: DP Institute for Sustainability & Resilience Sustainability (SUST)

subject: REL
title: Viking Religion (3)
desc:
Introduction to the Scandinavian religions in the Viking Age, their depiction 
in popular culture, and reconstruction in the form of new religious movements.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Religion (REL)

subject: CLAS
title: Topics in Ancient Greek Thought (3)
desc: Explore a central aspect of ancient Greek philosophy and literature. This may be a theme, such as tragedy or emotions; a thinker, such as Aristotle; or a since monumental text, such as Plato’s Republic. Pre: one PHIL 200-level course, or consent. (Cross-listed as PHIL 332)
metadata: DH Classics (CLAS) College of Arts, Languages & Letters Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: PHIL
title: Topics in Ancient Greek Thought (3)
desc: Explore a central aspect of ancient Greek philosophy and literature. This may be a theme, such as tragedy or emotions; a thinker, such as Aristotle; or a since monumental text, such as Plato’s Republic. Pre: one PHIL 200-level course, or consent. (Cross-listed as CLAS 332)
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Philosophy (PHIL)

subject: IS
title: One Health Practicum (3)
desc: Provide certificate students with real-world experience and opportunity to integrate and apply classroom learning in a professional environment. Intended for students who prefer to pursue a supervised, practical experience rather than a research-based project. A-F only. Pre: PH 441. (Cross-listed as TRMD 485)
metadata: Interdisciplinary Studies (IS) Office of Academic Excellence

subject: TRMD
title: One Health Practicum (3)
desc: Provide certificate students with real-world experience and opportunity to integrate and apply classroom learning in a professional environment. Intended for students who prefer to pursue a supervised, practical experience rather than a research-based project. A-F only. Pre: PH 441. (Cross-listed as IS 485)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: IS
title: One Health Seminar (2)
desc: Weekly presentations and discussions on current events and research in the field of One Health. Presentation topics may include research progress, literature reviews, or research proposals. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only. Pre: PH 441. (Spring only) (Cross-listed as TRMD 490)
metadata: Interdisciplinary Studies (IS) Office of Academic Excellence

subject: TRMD
title: One Health Seminar (2)
desc: Weekly presentations and discussions on current events and research in the field of One Health. Presentation topics may include research progress, literature reviews, or research proposals. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only. Pre: PH 441. (Spring only) (Cross-listed as IS 490)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: IS
title: One Health Journal Club (1)
desc: Students gain critical reading skills in the presentation and discussion of published literature on One Health-related topics. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only. Pre: PH 441. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as TRMD 395)
metadata: Interdisciplinary Studies (IS) Office of Academic Excellence

subject: TRMD
title: One Health Journal Club (1)
desc: Students gain critical reading skills in the presentation and discussion of published literature on One Health-related topics. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only. Pre: PH 441. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as IS 395)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: GES
title: GES Thesis Proposal (1)
desc: Supports GES majors in producing a thesis proposal that outlines and describes the timeline, required resources, etc. of the degree-required project. CR/NC only. GES majors only. Sophomore standing or higher.
metadata: Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: PACE
title: Media Ethics (3)
desc: Ethics and social responsibility for media professionals. Application of ethical theories and principles to case studies and research projects through writing assignments. JOUR majors only. Pre: one DS course. (Cross-listed as JOUR 460)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Peace Studies (PACE)

subject: NURS
title: Best Practices & Innovation in Teaching and Learning in Nursing Education (3)
desc: Current best practices and innovative teaching and learning strategies in nursing education. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Curriculum Evaluation & Accreditation in Nursing Education (3)
desc: Current trends of planning for evaluation and critical analysis and application of curriculum evaluation in nursing curriculum. NURS majors only. A-F only. Pre: 474 with a minimum grade of B-.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: LAW
title: Refugees, Asylum & Forced Migration (V)
desc: Based on international agreements, implemented through domestic federal statutory law, and administered by Executive Branch agencies who are subject to judicial review, creating a rich context for legal learning. LAW majors only. (Alt. years)
metadata: Law (LAW) William S. Richardson School of Law

subject: LAW
title: Advanced Immigration Law & Policy (V)
desc: Current immigration policy developments as a window into the way law, both legislated and case-law driven, interacts with policy objectives to produce desirable as well as unanticipated outcomes. LAW majors only. (Alt years)
metadata: Law (LAW) William S. Richardson School of Law

subject: LAW
title: Advanced Legal Analysis (V)
desc: Designed to help students enhance their legal writing and analysis skills as law students, bar examinees, and legal professionals. LAW majors only.
metadata: Law (LAW) William S. Richardson School of Law

subject: LAW
title: E-Discovery (V)
desc: Surveys the relevant law, theory, and practice governing the review and production of electronically stored information, focusing on the rules of civil procedure, the rules of evidence, and case law. LAW majors only. Pre: 516 and 517 with a minimum grade of C-.
metadata: Law (LAW) William S. Richardson School of Law

subject: LAW
title: Beyond Guilt Hawai‘i (V)
desc: Will serve the community by offering free legal services to those with unjust sentences, train law students in the area of criminal justice, and bring together social service organizations and providers who can help those freed by the clinic to successfully re-enter society. LAW students only.
metadata: Law (LAW) William S. Richardson School of Law

subject: ANSC
title: Advanced Topics in Animal Sciences (V)
desc: Advanced topics in animal sciences, from basic to applied research, including current issues and critical analysis of current research literature. Repeatable two times, up to nine credits. ANSC majors only. Graduate students only.
metadata: Animal Sciences (ANSC) College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources Human Nutrition, Food, and Animal Sciences

subject: NHH
title: Directed Reading/Research in Native Hawaiian Health (V)
desc: Instruction of medical students in the social determinants of health, issues of health equity, specifically in Native Hawaiians, Pacific Islanders and/or disadvantaged people and teach them how these issues can be addressed through research. Repeatable unlimited times. CR/NC only.
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Native Hawaiian Health (NHH)

subject: OCN
title: Global Environmental Change Laboratory (2)
desc: (2-hr Lab) Laboratory to supplement GES 311. Quantitative aspects of global environmental change will be addressed through problem-solving and computer modeling. GES majors only. A-F only. Pre: GES 311, MATH 242, PHYS 170/170L, and CHEM 161/161L; or consent. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as GES 319L)
metadata: DY Oceanography (OCN) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Origin of the Solar System (3)
desc: Exploration of the origin and evolution of our solar system. Understanding the composition of the universe and its constituents (planets, asteroids, stars, comets, and meteorites). A-F only. Pre: 101 or 103 or 104 or 106 or 130 and CHEM 161 and PHYS 170. (Alt. years: spring)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Plate Tectonics and Geodynamics (3)
desc: Mechanics of lithosphere deformation related to plate convergence, rifting and strike-slip faulting, and the evolution of mountain belts. Use of theory and skillbuilding techniques to measure, describe, analyze, and interpret structures on Earth. A-F only. Pre: 200 or 201; and 250; and MATH 241 or MATH 251A; and PHYS 170. (Fall only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ENG
title: Introduction to Literature: Rhetoric and Literature (3)
desc: Study of significant works of literature and rhetoric through a rhetorical analytical lens. A significant portion is dedicated to writing instruction. Requires a minimum of 4,000 words of graded writing. Repeatable one time. Pre: FW
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters English (ENG)

subject: ARCH
title: Historic Preservation (3)
desc: Federal, state, and local laws and regulations that regulate and provide protection to significant archaeological and historical resources in Hawai‘i and the region. (Alt. years: spring only) (Cross-listed as AMST 645 and ANTH 645)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: American Architecture (3)
desc: Cultural analysis of the evolution of American architecture from the Colonial period to the present involving sociopolitical and economic, as well as aesthetic, considerations. (Cross-listed as AMST 623)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: NAVL
title: Naval Operations and Seamanship (3)
desc: Study of U.S. Navy ships professional and efficient operations. Lecture series on Fleet communications, tactical employment, relative motion plotting, seamanship, Joint Warfare, and employment of naval forces as an element of National Security. A-F only. Pre: 201. (Fall only)
metadata: Naval Science and Leadership (NAVL) ROTC

subject: HIST
title: Topics on Transitional Justice (3)
desc: Explores how societies in the wake of armed conflict, repression, or mass human rights abuses build institutional capacities for promoting justice, human rights, and the rule of law
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters History (HIST)

subject: ERTH
title: Undergraduate Research in Earth Sciences (3)
desc: Research experience for Earth Science undergraduates. Under the guidance of a mentor, the student will conduct research and write a report on the background, methods, data, interpretations, and conclusions of the work. Repeatable one time only. Earth Sciences majors only. Junior standing or higher. CR/NC only.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Climate Change (3)
desc: Introduction to the science of climate change focusing on Earth’s past, present and future, specifically, the causes, consequences, and record of past changes; future projections, mitigation, and adaptation. Appropriate for both science and non-science majors. Pre: 101 or 103 or 104 or 106 or 111 or 130 or ATMO 101 or GES 102, or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: PHIL
title: Philosophy Through Computer Science (3)
desc: Introduction to classic philosophical issues (e.g., external world skepticism and free will) through computational concepts grounded in an introduction to computer science using Python. A-F only.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Philosophy (PHIL)

subject: THEA
title: Curtain Up! Broadway Musicals, Then and Now (3)
desc: Traces the history of the Broadway musical in a survey of works from the mid-1800s through the recent “Hamilton” phenomenon, and explores their developmental process, structure, and sociocultural, religious, and political contexts. Pre: MUS 106 or consent. (Cross-listed as MUS 362)
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: MATH
title: Financial Mathematics (3)
desc: Interest rate measurement, valuation of annuities, loan repayment, bond valuation, rate of return. Term structure of interest rates, cashflow duration, and immunization. Financial mathematics actuarial exam topics. Pre: 216 or 242 or 252A or (203 and BUS 250). (Alt. years: fall)
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Mathematics (MATH)

subject: ICS
title: Advanced Data Visualization (3)
desc: Explores advanced techniques in data visualization by surveying visualization techniques from the past 5-10 years, and designing and developing data visualizations leveraging those techniques. Graduate students only. (Fall only)
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Information and Computer Sciences (ICS)

subject: ASTR
title: Introduction to Astronomical Research (1)
desc: Introduction to astronomical research, including literature resources, basic computing skills, software tools, data analysis, scientific communication, and research opportunities. Prepares students for effective internships and directed research projects. ASTR and ASTP majors only. A-F only. (Spring only)
metadata: Astronomy (ASTR) College of Natural Sciences

subject: SOC
title: Sociology of Happiness in Unsettled Times (3)
desc: Combines theoretical, scientific and ‘hands-on’ learning to explore how happiness and well-being can be cultivated, even in this challenging era of extreme global climate events. Pre: 100 or a 200-level SOC course.
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Sociology (SOC)

subject: HIST
title: Themes of War in History (3)
desc: Explores cross-cutting themes of war from ancient times to the present, such as concepts of just war and unjust war, valor and heroism, and war trauma among combatants and civilian populations in conflict zones.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters History (HIST)

subject: ERTH
title: Lunar Geology (3)
desc: Introduction to the basics of the geology and spectroscopy of our Moon. A-F only. Senior standing or higher. Pre: 101. (Fall only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: WGSS
title: Queer Dance Exploratory (3)
desc: Queer dance exploration in movement practices and performance. Repeatable two times. Open to all majors. A-F only. (Cross-listed as DNCE 357)
metadata: DA College of Social Sciences Women, Gender, & Sexuality Studies (WGSS)

subject: BIOL
title: Life Sciences Colloquium (1)
desc: Seminars presented with the School of Life Sciences; topics will vary across the biological sciences. Repeatable up to four credits. BOT, MBIO, MICR, ZOOL graduate students only.
metadata: Biology (BIOL) School of Life Sciences

subject: ASAN
title: Media, Advertising & Desire in East Asia (3)
desc: Examines concepts of beauty and desire in East Asian cultures within historical and contemporary media contexts. Uses critical theory and in-depth case studies to explore how images, language, and branding work in contemporary Asian societies. A-F only. Pre: ENG 100. (Summer only)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASTR
title: Being a Professional Astronomer (1)
desc: Seminar for beginning graduate students focusing on professional skills needed for astronomy and discussing possible research opportunities. Repeatable one time. ASTR majors only. Graduate students only. CR/NC only. (Fall only)
metadata: Astronomy (ASTR) College of Natural Sciences

subject: THEA
title: Directing Multicultural Theatre (3)
desc: Directing multicultural/intercultural theatre; development of new performance styles based on the study of diverse theatre traditions from around the world; directing of scenes and one-act plays. A-F only. Repeatable one time. Pre: graduate theatre major and one directing course with a minimum grade of B, or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: LING
title: Professionalism in Linguistics (3)
desc: Topics related to career development and professional/scholarly communication in linguistics, including CVs, abstracts, grant proposals, publications, conference planning. Topics vary by instructor. Repeatable two times. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Linguistics (LING)

subject: ANTH
title: Decolonizing Anthropology (3)
desc: Decolonizing approaches to anthropology with a focus on South Africa and its relevance for the Pacific and U.S. Topics include race, inequality, nationalism, migration, heritage, and violence.
metadata: Anthropology (ANTH) College of Social Sciences

subject: REL
title: Sacred Animals (3)
desc: Critical study of the ethical treatment of nonhuman animals and the religious beliefs and practices associated with them throughout history and across various cultures. Emphasis on teaching oral communication.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Religion (REL)

subject: NAVL
title: Leadership Laboratory (1)
desc: Laboratory instruction will include leadership development, teamwork, physical fitness training, and activities designed for students pursuing Navy and Marine Corps commissions. Repeatable unlimited times. CR/NC only
metadata: Naval Science and Leadership (NAVL) ROTC

subject: DNCE
title: Queer Dance Exploratory (3)
desc: Queer dance exploration in movement practices and performance. Repeatable two times. Open to all majors. A-F only. (Cross-listed as WGSS 357)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Dance (DNCE)

subject: BOT
title: Plant Ecology (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Ecological principles and process that determine patterns of plant distribution and abundance. Lectures cover theory and examples from primary literature. Labs cover study design, descriptive and experimental techniques, field skills, and data analysis and interpretation. A-F only. Pre: 305 or BIOL 305.
metadata: DB DY Botany (BOT) College of Natural Sciences

subject: ART
title: Sound Design and Video Art (3)
desc: Combined theory and practice studio art course examining the techniques, concepts, and aesthetics of congtemporary sound design and video art. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 202 or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ANTH
title: Decolonizing Anthropology Through South Africa (3)
desc: Decolonizing approaches to anthropology explored through the archaeology and ethnography of South Africa. Topics include race, inequality, nationalism, migration, heritage, and violence. Junior standing or higher. (Alt years)
metadata: DS Anthropology (ANTH) College of Social Sciences

subject: PACE
title: Governing, Policy, and Political Journalism (3)
desc: Survey of the institutions of democratic governance and the role of journalism in covering and analyzing public policy. A-F only. (Cross-listed as JOUR 301)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Peace Studies (PACE)

subject: TPSS
title: Understanding Agroecosystems: Visualization, Interpretation, Analysis, and Application (3)
desc: Designed for students interested in developing a critical framework for understanding different ways of measuring, visualizing, and interpreting the different goals humans have for agroecosystems. Repeatable one time. Pre: 200 or instructor consent. (Fall only)
metadata: DB College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources Tropical Plant and Soil Sciences (TPSS)

subject: SPED
title: Intensive Behavioral Interventions (3)
desc: Principles of behavior, emphasizing positive methods for eliminating significant behavior problems and improving behavior and learning for students with severe disabilities and autism. BEd in SPED majors only. A-F only. Pre: 485B, 485C, or 485D. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: SPED
title: Inclusive Practices Across the Curriculum-Mild/Moderate Disabilities (3)
desc: Strategies for teaching science, math, and social studies to students with mild/moderate disabilities in secondary settings; selection of appropriate materials, teaching techniques, and curriculum development. BEd in SPED majors only. A-F only. (Fall only)
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: SPED
title: Introduction to Assessment and Instruction-Severe Disabilities/Autism (3)
desc: Assessment methods and tools, instructional and assistive strategies, and special procedures to support the participation of students with severe disabilities and autism in inclusive settings. BEd in SPED majors only. A-F only. (Fall only
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: SPED
title: Secondary Transition-Mild/Moderate Disabilities (3)
desc: Transition planning for youth with disabilities in preparation for postsecondary education, employment, and community living. BEd in SPED majors only. A-F only. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: SPED
title: Non-School-Age Individuals with Severe Disabilities/Autism (3)
desc: Effective planning, instruction, and support for non-school-age individuals (infants, toddlers, and adults) with severe disabilities or ASD across natural environments. BEd in SPED majors only. A-F only. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: SPED
title: Physical and Medical Needs-Severe Disabilities/Autism (3)
desc:
Learning to teach children with physical and health impairments, with a focus on developing independence. Instructional and assistive strategies for meeting the student’s physical and medical 
needs as well as managing medical conditions. BEd in SPED majors only. A-F only. (Fall only)
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: CEE
title: Risk Analysis and Decision Making (3)
desc: Risk analysis and decision making are fundamental areas of construction and project management. Students will benefit from analyzing risks and learning various decision making techniques for real-time applications. A-F only. Pre: 472 and 474 or consent. (Alt. years: fall)
metadata: Civil, Environmental and Construction Engineering (CEE) College of Engineering

subject: SPAN
title: Phonetics and Pronunciation Practice (3)
desc: Analysis of the Spanish phonological system, in contrast with English. Practice in pronunciation. Pre: 301 or 310, or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Languages and Literatures of Europe and the Americas (LLEA) Spanish (SPAN)

subject: DNCE
title: Hawaiian Performance Workshop (3)
desc: Training in skills and techniques for selected traditional Hawaiian performance forms and Hawaiian medium theatre. Emphasis on movement and vocal technique. Repeatable one time. Pre: one of: 312, 411, 412, HAW 202, HAW 321, HAW 384, HAW 486, THEA 101, THEA 221, THEA 224, THEA 468; or consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as THEA 424)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Dance (DNCE)

subject: NURS
title: Health Law (V)
desc: Introduction to medical jurisprudence, medical malpractice, informed consent, health care decisions, medical ethics, the health care industry, managed care, financing health care, and the role of government in health care. LAW majors only; NURS DNP majors only (Cross-listed as LAW 532)
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Health Policy and Economics (3)
desc: Evaluate the implications of policies on health care funding and regulations, provider payments, and other variables shaping the ability of health care systems (Western and other) on advanced practice. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Applied Biostatistics and Epidemiology for Nurses in Advance Practice (3)
desc:
Investigation of epidemiologic and biostatistical methods for advance practice nurses within healthcare settings and complementary roles of epi/biostatistics in shaping advance nurse practice. Application of epi/biostatistical approaches to the design and analysis of DNP projects. 
NURS majors only or permission. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NAVL
title: Leadership and Ethics (3)
desc: Introduces ethical theories in discussion-oriented formats to provide a solid foundation of various moral, ethical, and leadership philosophies. Serves to guide, refine, and strengthen moral character and increase awareness of different ethical decision-making tools. A-F only. (Spring only)
metadata: Naval Science and Leadership (NAVL) ROTC

subject: NAVL
title: Fund of Maneuver Warfare (3)
desc: Introduction to the foundational concepts and history of the USMC as the premiere Maneuver Warfighting Organization. Theoretical course that utilizes historical examples. A-F only. (Fall only)
metadata: Naval Science and Leadership (NAVL) ROTC

subject: DIS
title: Sexuality & Health (3)
desc:
Examines concepts, theories, and skills-based practices of sexuality and 
health. Topics on underserved populations, disability, reproductive health, family planning, and family health. Utilizes research-based curriculum/strategies to promote personal and social responsibility for health. (Cross-listed as KRS 651)
metadata: College of Education Disability and Diversity Studies (DIS)

subject: PACS
title: Topics in Histories of Oceania (3)
desc: Reading and research on major issues, topics, and themes in the history of Oceania. Repeatable three times. Pre: graduate standing or consent. (Cross-listed as HIST 675
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Pacific Islands Studies (PACS)

subject: ECON
title: Macroeconomics for Business and Policy Analysis (3)
desc:
Topics on production, consumption, labor market, asset market, economic 
growth, and business cycles are discussed with emphasis on real-economy applications and policy analysis. Implications of monetary, fiscal, and international finance and economic policies are explored. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Economics (ECON)

subject: HIST
title: Slavery and Modern Memory (3)
desc: Exploration of contemporary resonances of slavery in the Americas through literature, historical scholarship, memory and trauma studies, and the visual and performing arts. Graduate students only. A-F only. (Cross-listed as AMST 619)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters History (HIST)

subject: SLS
title: Learning and Teaching World Languages (3)
desc: Hybrid technology intensive course for pre- or in-service teachers of world languages. Topics: online learning, curriculum and lesson planning, assessment, language teaching approaches, technology for learning world languages. Junior standing or higher. (Cross-listed as LLEA 455)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Second Language Studies (SLS)

subject: ICS
title: Special Topics Seminar (V)
desc: Seminar discussing special topics in information and computer science. Topics and number of credits vary. Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Natural Sciences Information and Computer Sciences (ICS)

subject: ARCH
title: (Alpha) MArch Capstone Studio (V)
desc: Advanced capstone architectural design research synthesizing theory and practice. (D) design; (R) research. MArch students only. A-F only. Pre: 716, 726, 744, and 745. Co-requisite: (R) for (D); (D) for (R).
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: FDM
title: Branding (3)
desc: Study of principles and practices in brand architecture and effective brand-building strategies; analysis of a case study and application of the concepts of brand management. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. Pre: 101. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources Fashion Design & Merchandising (FDM)

subject: KRS
title: Social Emotional Learning (SEL) Pedagogy and Practice (3)
desc:
Introduces concepts, theories, and pedagogies of Social Emotional Learning 
(SEL), health and wellness, and trauma informed teaching with an emphasis on culture, social justice, and equity in Hawai‘i and our global community. A-F only. (Summer only) (Cross-listed as DIS 650 and EDCS 650)
metadata: College of Education Kinesiology and Rehabilitation Science (KRS)

subject: DIS
title: Social Emotional Learning (SEL) Pedagogy and Practice (3)
desc:
Introduces concepts, theories, and pedagogies of Social Emotional Learning 
(SEL), health and wellness, and trauma informed teaching with an emphasis on culture, social justice, and equity in Hawai‘i and our global community. A-F only. (Summer only) (Cross-listed as EDCS 650 and KRS 650)
metadata: College of Education Disability and Diversity Studies (DIS)

subject: ASAN
title: Resource Management in Southeast Asia (3)
desc:
Challenges associated with the management of land, water resources, fisheries, forests and agriculture in modern Southeast Asia. Case studies are used to illustrate current problems and evaluate potential management 
solutions. A-F only. Pre: junior standing or higher. (Cross-listed as GEO 413)
metadata: DS Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: PHIL
title: Marxism and Critical Theory (3)
desc: Introduction to the philosophical works of Karl Marx and a historical overview of the development of the Frankfurt School of Critical Theory. Sophomore standing or higher. A-F only.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Philosophy (PHIL)

subject: PHIL
title: Philosophy of Disability (3)
desc: Uses tools of philosophical inquiry to explore philosophical concepts emerging from the study of disability. Ethical issues of personhood and justice are discussed, with significant attention given to helping students express their thinking through writing. A-F only.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Philosophy (PHIL)

subject: MUS
title: Western Music and Japan (3)
desc: Historical survey of Western music in Japan from modernization through the Meiji Restoration up to the present. Topics include: Western-style symphonic music, J-pop, and Enka by Japanese artists; develops written communication skills. Junior standing or higher.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Music (MUS)

subject: CHN
title: High-Advanced Chinese II (3)
desc: Aims to build Superior Level Chinese proficiency in reading, speaking, writing, and listening using authentic texts covering Chinese education, and economy, philosophy, while broadening and deepening knowledge of Chinese culture. Pre: 402, 404, 405, or instructor consent. (Spring only)
metadata: Chinese (CHN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: WGSS
title: Performance, Culture, and Theory (3)
desc: Survey of major critical works in fields of performing arts and public culture (e.g., dance, theater, music, commemoration). Topics include: theoretical application for the discipline of American studies, and the impact of social movements and labor migration on the performing arts. (Cross-listed as AMST 615)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Women, Gender, & Sexuality Studies (WGSS)

subject: SPED
title: Advanced Diagnostic-Prescriptive Reading Intervention (3)
desc: Structural and functional features of reading development using diagnostic-prescriptive reading intervention. Advanced diagnostic-prescriptive intervention selection and design for students with reading disabilities using tool-component-composite analysis. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 655. Co-requisite: 629.
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: SPED
title: Reading Assessment & Tiered Intervention for Students with Disabilities (3)
desc: Selection and administration of formal and informal assessments within a problem-solving model for designing robust reading instruction for struggling readers. Guiding planning and reading intervention using data-based decision-making. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 421B or 421C or 421D, and 423. Co-requisite: 629.
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: SPED
title: Vocabulary Comprehension, Fluency & Writing Interventions for Students with Disabilities (3)
desc: Development of and intervention for fluent reading vocabulary acquisition, comprehension and writing in students with disabilities. Explicit and systematic instruction of core aspects of reading and writing. A-F only. Pre: 421B, 421C, or 421D. (Summer only)
metadata: College of Education Special Education (SPED)

subject: SW
title: Cultural Factors in Work with Hawaiians (3)
desc: Provides students with a body of knowledge, skills, and values that facilitate social work with Native Hawaiians. SW or Social Welfare students.
metadata: Social Work (SW) Thompson School of Social Work & Public Health

subject: SW
title: Ke A‘o Mau: Learning Preserved (3)
desc: To provide a holistic examination of issues and to explore culturally-anchored resolutions and practices to achieve social justice and health and well-being. SW, Social Welfare, or PH students only.
metadata: Social Work (SW) Thompson School of Social Work & Public Health

subject: SW
title: Native Hawaiian Perspectives: A Cultural Context for Well-Being (3)
desc: To preserve the cultural knowledge of kupuna as it relates to health and wellbeing. Disseminate cultural knowledge of health and well-being to social work students and students in allied health professions. SW or Social Welfare students only.
metadata: Social Work (SW) Thompson School of Social Work & Public Health

subject: CEE
title: Numerical Methods in Geotechnical Engineering (3)
desc: Finite element and finite difference formulation and analyses to solve problems in geotechnical engineering. Also covers constitutive modelling. Pre: 355 (with a minimum grade of C) and 455 (with a minimum grade of C), or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Civil, Environmental and Construction Engineering (CEE) College of Engineering

subject: SLS
title: Introduction to Second Language Assessment (3)
desc: Assessment of second language knowledge and skills. Topics include design, use, and analysis of assessments. Graduate standing only or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Second Language Studies (SLS)

subject: NURS
title: Effective Program Evaluation for Quality Improvement (3)
desc:
Integration of program evaluation and translational science for assessment 
and communication of programmatic health impacts to improve well-being of patients, families, and stakeholders/communities at local, regional, national/ international levels. NURS majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing Nursing (NURS)

subject: NURS
title: Diagnosis & Management of Complex Care Across the Lifespan (2)
desc:
