desc: Epidemiology of infectious diseases as it relates to tropical medicine. Lecture/seminar format. A-F only. Pre: TRMD graduate standing or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Advanced Medical Bacteriology (2)
desc: Role of bacteria in infectious diseases, with emphasis on clinical aspects and identification of etiological agents. Pre: 605 or equivalent, or consent.
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Advanced Medical Virology (2)
desc: In-depth study of the major groups of viruses pathogenic for human; virus replication, host range, pathogenesis, immunology, and epidemiology. Pre: 605 or equivalent, or consent. (Alt. years: fall)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Advanced Medical Parasitology (2)
desc: Consideration of ultrastructure, physiology, biochemistry, in-vitro cultivation and host-parasite relationship of parasites of medical importance. A-F only. Pre: consent. (Alt. years: fall)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Fundamentals of Biostatistics (3)
desc: Fundamental biomedical statistics concepts and tools will be introduced, as well as their applications to biomedical data. Students will perform hands-on analysis using statistical software and learn to interpret and present the results. A-F only. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as QHS 601)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Advances in HIV/AIDS (2)
desc: History of HIV, basic biology and virology, epidemiology, HIV pathogenesis and immunology, clinical features, and co-morbidities. Treatment and prevention of HIV/ AIDS, including research methods, statistics, cultural competence, genetics, pathophysiology, drug and vaccine development. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only. Pre: 604 and 605, or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Bioinformatics I (3)
desc:
Provides fundamental concepts in bioinformatics with strong emphasis on hands-on training. Topics such as molecular biology, sequence alignment, biological databases, phytogeny, 
and genomics including microarray and RNA-sequence analysis. Repeatable one time, but credit earned one time only. Open to nonmajors. A-F only. (Fall only) (Cross-listed with QHS 610)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Advanced Genetics and Evolution of Infectious Diseases (2)
desc: An evolutionary perspective to examine the interactive responses between infectious agents and the immune system. Topics will include natural selection, life history evolution, population genetics of pathogens and hosts, and anti-microbial resistance. A-F only. Pre: 604 (or concurrent) and 605 (or concurrent), or consent. (Alt. years: spring)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Vaccinology (2)
desc: History/evolution of vaccines, current and next generation vaccines, vaccine immunology, adjuvants, vaccine strategies, vaccines for viral, bacterial, and parasitic diseases, vaccine-proof-of-concept and downstream developmental studies; vaccine safety production processes. Repeatable one time. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: (604 and 605) with a minimum grade of B. (Spring only
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Ecological Epidemiology (2)
desc: Applications of population biology, pathogen/host life history, and population genetics to infectious disease epidemiology, including micro- and macroparasites, and implications to disease control and prevention of strategies. A-F only. Pre: consent. (Alt. years: spring) (Cross-listed as PH 650)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Infection and Immunity (3)
desc: Combined lecture/discussion of interactions of pathogens with the innate and acquired immune systems. Topics will include the role of novel receptors in pathogen detection, inflammation in disease pathogenesis, pathogen immune evasion, and neuroimmunology. Repeatable two times. A-F only. Pre: 604, MICR 461, or consent. (Alt. years: fall)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Advances In Medical Immunology (3)
desc: Presentations/discussions of current literature concerning recent advances in immunology relevant to disease and to disease processes. Pre: consent. (Alt. years: spring)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Infectious Disease Microbiology III (3)
desc: Basic structure, physiology, epidemiology, and genetics of pathogenic bacteria as well as the host response to these organisms. Correlation of these characteristics to disease pathogenesis in humans and animal models. A-F only. Pre: 604 or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Neurovirology (2)
desc: Seminar on neuroinvasive viruses giving basics of viruses causing nervous system diseases and discussing recent advances in the research field of neurovirology. Pre: MICR 351 or equivalent; or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Tropical Medicine Laboratory Rotations (V)
desc: Practical experience in use of equipment and procedures in infectious disease and immunology research; introduction to research in tropical medicine. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: 604 (or concurrent), or consent.
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Infectious Disease Micro II (3)
desc: Will cover different families of animal viruses of importance to human diseases. The genome, structure, replication, as well as host immune responses, epidemiology, clinical features, and animal models will be presented. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 604 and MICR 351, or consent. (Cross-listed as PH 667)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Concepts in Immunology and Immunopathogenesis (2)
desc: Immunological concepts relating to infectious diseases and host pathogen interactions. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: MICR 461 (or equivalent) or consent. (Cross-listed as PH 665)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Infectious Disease Microbiology I: Medical Parasitology (3)
desc: Epidemiology, pathogenesis, immunobiology and diagnostic aspects of human parasitic infections; principles of host-pathogen interactions; public health aspects of parasitic infections. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: MICR 351 or equivalent. (Fall only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Laboratory Methods in Tropical Medicine (2)
desc: Microbiologic methods and techniques for identification of pathogenic viruses, bacterial, and parasitic organisms including specimen handling, culturing, and laboratory safety. Repeatable one time. Graduate standing only. A-F only. (Fall only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Tropical Medicine Journal Club (1)
desc: Students gain experience in the presentation and discussion of topics of current interest in the fields of tropical medicine and infectious diseases. Repeatable unlimited times. Graduate students only.
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: (Alpha) Selected Research Topics in Infectious Diseases (V)
desc: Research elective for medical students; (B) infectious diseases; (C) parasitology; (D) epidemiology; (E) immunology. MD majors only. CR/NC only. Pre: MDED 554 or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: (Alpha) Selected Topics in Infectious Diseases (1)
desc: Elective for medical students; (B) infectious diseases; (C) parasitology; (D) epidemiology; (E) immunology. MD majors only. CR/NC only. Pre: MDED 554 or consent.
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Selected Topics in Tropical Medicine and Infectious Diseases (V)
desc: Elective for medical students in Tropical Medicine and Infectious Diseases. Repeatable six times, up to 12 credits. Medical students only. CR/NC only. Pre: consent.
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Topics in Tropical Medicine (V)
desc: Elective for fourth-year medical students for advanced study of selected topics within the field of tropical medicine and medical microbiology. Pre: fourth-year standing or MD degree.
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: Reading and Research (V)
desc: Directed reading and research in laboratory; diagnostic aspects of bacterial, parasitic, and viral infections. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: consent.
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine, Medical Microbiology and Pharmacology

subject: TRMD
title: Summer Research Experience (5)
desc: Hands-on research experience at assigned international sites. Students learn research and analytical skills in the field and laboratory setting, and present data to peers and faculty upon completion of the training. MHIRT cohort only. A-F only. (Summer only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine, Medical Microbiology and Pharmacology

subject: TRMD
title: Health Disparities (2)
desc: Overview of biosciences research related to health and health disparities in a global setting as well as in Hawai‘i. Workshop topics include health research, Native Hawaiian health, global health, and cultural competency. MHIRT cohort only. A-F only. (Summer only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine and Medical Microbiology (TRMD)

subject: TRMD
title: International Training in Biosciences Research (3)
desc: Combines weekly lectures by faculty for discussion of the 9 Steps of Research and completion of training courses for working with human subjects, including research ethics, laboratory safety, blood-borne pathogens, and principles of health disparity. MHIRT cohort only. A-F only. (Summer only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine, Medical Microbiology and Pharmacology

subject: TRMD
title: Principles of Medical Parasitology (2)
desc: Epidemiology, pathogenesis, immunobiology and diagnostic aspects of human parasitic infections; principles of host-pathogen interactions; public health aspects of parasitic infections. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: MICR 351 with a grade of B or higher or equivalent. (Spring only)
metadata: John A. Burns School of Medicine Tropical Medicine, Medical Microbiology and Pharmacology

subject: TAHR
title: Extension Education & Outreach (2)
desc: Introduces an essential component of the Land Grant Mission. Students will explore the foundational components of extension education including agent expectations, program development and evaluation, audience engagement, building partnerships, funding structures. Repeatable one time. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. (Cross-listed as TPSS 415)
metadata: College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources (TAHR)

subject: TAHR
title: Scientific Principles of Sustainability (3)
desc: Introduction to the scientific principles of sustainability, including the ecology of managed and natural ecosystems, global change biology, ecological principles of natural resource management, renewable energy technologies, and the environmental impacts of humans.
metadata: College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources (TAHR)

subject: TAHR
title: Introduction to Sustainability from Social Science Perspectives (3)
desc: Introduction to key concepts and theories in social sciences in relation to sustainability issues. (Cross-listed as SOC 230 and SUST 250)
metadata: DS College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources (TAHR)

subject: TAHR
title: International Exchange Study/Research (V)
desc: Study overseas in an approved international or similar exchange program. CR/NC only. Pre: consent of academic advisor.
metadata: College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources (TAHR)

subject: TIM
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Independent supervised research. Formal and oral written presentation of research findings. Repeatable up to six credits.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Directed Reading (V)
desc: Independent study of approved, advanced reading with faculty supervision. Requires proposal prepared by student and approved by supervisor and graduate chair before registration. Repeatable one time.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Seminar: Travel Industry Management Policy (3)
desc: Integration of learning through analysis of policy issues, trends, and problems in the travel industry. A-F only. Pre: three 600-level TIM courses completed or consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Professional Paper (3)
desc: Independent project or paper under faculty supervision in lieu of Plan A, TIM 700 thesis. Requires proposal approved by supervisor and graduate chair prior to registration. A-F only. Pre: three 600-level TIM courses completed or consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Hospitality, Tourism, and Transportation Field Studies (3)
desc: Integration of concepts and application of knowledge and skills from other courses to a selected field study project. Pre: any two 600-level TIM courses completed and a third concurrent; or consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Financial Management in Hospitality, Tourism, and Transportation (3)
desc: Applications of financial analysis to both the domestic and international travel industry. TIM majors only. A-F only. Graduate students only. Pre: consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Global Tourism Analysis (3)
desc: International trade theory and regional analysis methodologies applied to tourism and the service industry, including travel balance account, inter-regional transactions flow, economic impacts, environmental economics, demand theory and forecasting. A-F only. Graduate students only. Pre: consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Managerial Economics in Hospitality, Tourism, and Transportation (3)
desc: Advanced study analysis of economics and management of passenger transportation systems serving the travel industry. Emphasis on topics such as government policy, transport economics, marketing and management, and the relationships between transportation systems and tourism development. Graduate students only. Pre: consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Hospitality Management (3)
desc: Advanced human relations and operating issues; use of accounting, behavioral, financial, marketing, and informational systems in managing hospitality organizations. Graduate students only. Pre: consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Managerial Accounting for Travel Industry (3)
desc: Advanced study of management accounting within travel industry: responsibility accounting, pricing decisions, concepts and application of central systems, financial planning, price level impacts, performance evaluation. Graduate students only. Pre: consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Information Technology, e-Commerce, and Travel Industry in Hospitality, Tourism, and Transportation (3)
desc: Planning, implementation, management, evaluation, and impact of information and electronic communication technologies, including e-commerce applications in the travel industry. Analysis of new information technology use as an area of research and strategic application. Graduate students only. Pre: consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Strategic Marketing in Hospitality, Tourism, and Transportation (3)
desc: In-depth study of marketing principles and problems related to travel industry organizations. Emphasis on strategic marketing. Research applications, international and domestic marketing of travel industry services. Graduate students only. Pre: consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Research Application in Hospitality, Tourism, and Transportation (3)
desc: Analysis of methodologies appropriate for research in travel industry management. Survey of the literature of applied techniques and approaches including exploratory approaches. Familiarization with research design and implementation of development of research proposals. Graduate students only. Pre: consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: (Alpha) Advanced Topics in Travel Industry Management (V)
desc: (B) tourism planning; (C) advanced travel industry management; (D) advanced hospitality management; (E) advanced hotel management; (F) advanced restaurant management; (G) advanced tourism management; (H) advanced recreation management; (I) advanced leisure management; (J) advanced transportation management; (K) advanced travel industry management education; (M) advanced travel industry management technology; (N) advanced meetings, incentives, conventions, and exhibition management; (O) advanced food and beverage management; (P) leadership and advanced human resources; (Q) advanced assets management. Repeatable five times with consent for (B), (C), (D), (E), (F), (G), (H), (I), (J), (K), (M), (N); repeatable six times for (O), (P), and (Q). TIM majors only. A-F only for (O), (P), and (Q).
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Environmental Management Systems (3)
desc: Introduction to the process of developing Environmental Management Systems that address the principles outlined in ISO14001:2015. Repeatable one time. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. (Spring only) (Cross-listed as OCN 442 and SUST 442)
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Advanced Topics in Transportation (3)
desc: Advanced level of discussion in terms of transportation, including management, economics, strategy, regulation, operating performance, fleet management, and network management. Pre: 101. Recommended: 350 and/or 353.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Strategic Management for the Travel/ Hospitality Industry (3)
desc: Strategic management in the travel/hospitality industry. Case study analysis, discussion and written reports, covering strategies, management problems and industry issues. Emphasis on writing instruction. A-F only. Pre: 301, 302, 303, 304, 305 and graduating senior.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Destination Development and Marketing (3)
desc: Analysis of key factors in the marketing and management of tourism destinations, including destination branding, product development, integrated marketing, stakeholder relations, and the role of destination marketing/marketing organizations. Emphasis on written communication. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Sustainable Tourism Policies and Practices (3)
desc: Seminar examining the social, environmental, economic factors of sustainable tourism development. Emphasis on methods and processes and the role of stakeholders (government, industry, host community, tourists). Group projects. A-F only. Pre: 101 and departmental approval. (Cross-listed as SUST 421)
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Nature-Based Tourism Management (3)
desc: Principles of nature-based tourism, including a survey of impacts, objectives, planning, and management systems. Junior standing or higher. Pre: 101 or 324/ GEO 324. (Cross-listed as GEO 415 and SUST 415)
metadata: DS School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Revenue Management in Travel Industry (3)
desc: An in-depth comprehensive introduction to the theory and practice of revenue management and provides recognition of thorough knowledge of the fundamental metrics and methodologies used within the hotel industry. TIM majors only. Pre: 101, ECON 130, and ACC 210.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Resort Mixed Use Development (3)
desc: Critical and essential aspects of developing and managing resort mixed use facilities. Includes multidimensional and dynamic interrelationships of site development and facilities, business mix, management structures and systems, and industry practices. A-F only. Pre: 313 or 369; and 314. Recommended: 333 and 401. (Fall only)
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Resort, Spa and Wellness Management (3)
desc: Principles of resort and spa development. Essential aspects of understanding the leadership and interrelationships of managing/operating and marketing resorts, spas, and wellness. A-F only. Pre: 314. Recommended: 305.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: (Alpha) Internship IV (2)
desc: Requires a minimum of 150 hours of internship, a business presentation, and an analytical report synthesizing experience and related theories. A significant portion of class time is dedicated to writing instruction, which will enhance and improve students’ writing skills. (B) executive internship; (C) community service internship. Restricted to majors. CR/NC only. Pre: 200 and consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Directed Reading and Research (V)
desc: Reading and research into problems in hotel, restaurant, transportation or tourism sectors of the travel industry. TIM majors only. Junior standing or above. Pre: a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 and consent of dean’s office and instructor based upon student’s written proposal of content and objectives of course program.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Directed Reading and Research (V)
desc: Reading and research into problems in hotel, restaurant, transportation or tourism sectors of the travel industry. Pre: junior standing or above, a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 and consent of dean’s office and instructor based upon student’s written proposal of content and objectives of course program. TIM majors only.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: (Alpha) Current Topics in Travel Industry Management (V)
desc:
(B) resort development; (C) assets management; (D) transportation and public policy; 
(E) management by cultural values; (F) travel industry management; (G) hospitality management; (H) hotel management; (I) restaurant entrepreneurship; (J) tourism management; (K) recreation management; (M) leisure management; (N) transportation management; (O) travel industry management education; (P) travel industry management technology; (Q) meetings, incentives, conventions, and exhibition management. Repeatable five times with consent. TIM majors only for (B), (C), (D), (E), (F), (G), (H), (I), (J), (K), (M), (N). Pre: 101 and 313 for (I).
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: TIM Study Abroad (V)
desc: Study abroad instructional experience emphasizing international travel, tourism and hospitality-related topics at equivalent, accredited programs. Content varies depending on locus of instruction and instructor. Course qualifies as either a TIM or general elective with pre-approval or department. Repeatable unlimited times. TIM majors only. Pre: consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Economics in Travel Industry (3)
desc: Microeconomic theory of consumer behavior and demand production cost analysis, market structure and pricing in travel companies. Economic impact of tourism. Students may not earn credit for 365 and BUS 313. TIM majors only. Pre: either ECON 120 or ECON 130.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Surface Transportation Management (3)
desc: Management of surface transportation such as cars, buses, and intercity rail, etc. Includes marketing, ownership and financing, supply chain, operations, regulation and promotion, human resources. TIM majors only. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Air Transportation Management (3)
desc: Marketing, management and strategies used by airlines, airports, catering, and aircraft manufacturers. TIM majors only. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Principles of Logistics (3)
desc: Management of logistics systems: inventory control, warehousing, materials management, physical distribution, transportation. Emphasis on Hawai‘i’s location and unique problems. TIM majors only. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Introduction to Tourism Transportation (3)
desc: Introduction to managerial and operational issues related to all modes of transportation used by tourists into or within a tourist destination. Passenger behavior; transport infrastructure; transport networks; regulation; sustainable transport. TIM majors only. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Hospitality Sales & Negotiation (3)
desc: Personal selling by hospitality and tourism firms engaged in business-to-business marketing. Emphasis will be placed on negotiation case studies, exercises, and role-plays. TIM majors only. A-F only. Pre: 101. Recommended: 304.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Hotel/Resort Facilities and Design (3)
desc: Comprehensive understanding of facilities management and design including maintenance systems, sustainable development options and design and environmental management. TIM majors only. A-F only. Pre: 313 and 314.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Travel Distribution Management (3)
desc: History, development, operations, and management of travel distribution organizations including: travel agents, tour operators and wholesalers, specialty channelers, meeting planners, incentive houses, travel associations, and other destination management organizations. Evolution and economics of the distribution of travel products through destination databases and electronic commerce. TIM majors only. Pre: 302.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Geography of Global Tourism (3)
desc: Tourist landscape in relation to resources, spatial patterns of supply and demand, impacts of tourism development, and models of tourist space. Flows between major world regions. Sophomore standing or higher. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as GEO 324)
metadata: DS School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Sociocultural Issues in Tourism (3)
desc: Issues arising from the impacts of tourism on societies and cultures. Class discussions of the ethical dimensions of such impacts. Includes an emphasis on writing instruction. TIM majors only. Pre: 101.
metadata: DS School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Introduction to Tourism Economics (3)
desc: Examines tourism from an economic perspective. Topics include: the determinants of consumer demand for leisure travel, structure of competition among suppliers of tourism services, benefits and costs of tourism development to the host community, government’s role in the taxation, subsidy, regulation and protection of the tourism industry, tourism’s impact on the environment, and sustainable tourism development. TIM majors only. Pre: ECON 120 or 130 or 131; or consent. (Cross-listed as ECON 320)
metadata: DS School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Quantity Foods and Institutional Purchasing (3)
desc: Quantity food and beverage operations, menu development and costing, dietary menu claims, purchasing procedures, inventory control, procurement, transportation, legislation. Institutional foodservice sanitation, Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point and National Restaurant Association Certification. TIM majors only. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Events Planning and Marketing (3)
desc: Introduction to special event planning processes and techniques. Emphasis on designing, planning, marketing, management, staging events, legal compliances, risk management, financial control, and successful event evaluation. TIM majors only. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. Pre: 313.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Quality Food Management (3)
desc: Explore various aspects of the quality in foodservice operations and develop strategies to measure and improve the quality. A-F only. Pre: 101 and departmental approval.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Hotel Management (3)
desc: Comprehensive understanding of hotel management and functional departments including front office, accounting, housekeeping, food and beverage, marketing, security and safety. Simulation of management trainee programs by hotel chains. Synthesis of concepts, tools and theories of decision-making relevant to hotel operations. TIM majors only. A-F only. Pre: 101, 302, and 303 (with a minimum grade of C- in 302 and 303).
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Foodservice Management (3)
desc: Critical and essential aspects of managing foodservice operations including principles of food safety and sanitation, procedural knowledge in front and back of the house and guest relations. TIM majors only. A-F only. Pre: 101 and 303.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Club Management (3)
desc: Introduction to club and institutional management, including operations, services, and facilities. TIM majors only. A-F only. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Institutional Purchasing (3)
desc: Procurement responsibilities in hospitality management. Emphasis on institutions supplying hospitality operations and legislation which controls standards of industrial supplies and goods. TIM and FSHN majors only. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Human Resource Management: Travel Industry (3)
desc: Comprehensive overview of human resources management (HRM) with emphasis on the supervision in the travel industry, including HRM as a firm’s strategic asset, contemporary theories, issues and developments, to improve employee recruitment productivity and retention. TIM majors only. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Financial Management for the Travel Industry (3)
desc: Cash flow determination and management strategies for financing hospitality ventures and expansion. Determining the financial viability of proposed and existing operations through traditional and state-of-the-art techniques. TIM majors only. Pre: 101, ACC 200 and ACC 210; and NREM 203, MATH 203, MATH 215, MATH 241, or BUS 250.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Principles of Travel Industry Marketing (3)
desc: Concepts, problems, processes of marketing within the travel industry; development of marketing strategies including product, place, promotion, and price for travel institutions. Students may not earn credit for 304 and BUS 312. TIM majors only. Pre: 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Management of Service Enterprises (3)
desc: Principles and philosophies of management with special emphasis on those principles and theories that are most relevant to management in service-based industries. Students may not earn credit for 303 and BUS 315. TIM majors only. Pre: 101 or consent.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Information Systems Technology (3)
desc: Computer applications in the travel industry; operation and evaluation of specific travel industry systems and applied business systems. TIM majors only. Pre: 101; and either ICS 101, or both LTEC 112 and LTEC 113
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Legal Environment of the Travel Industry (3)
desc: Origin, development, and principles of common, statutory, constitutional, international, and maritime law relating to hospitality industry. TIM majors only. Pre: 101. Recommended: BLAW 200.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Internship III (2)
desc: A minimum of four hundred hours of travel industry experience. Position must be different from TIM 200 position and of a more responsible nature or in a different organization. Comprehensive report by student and performance evaluation from employer required. CR/NC only. Pre: TIM major and 200.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Internship II (2)
desc: A minimum of four hundred hours of travel industry experience. Comprehensive report by student and performance evaluation from employer required. CR/NC only. Pre: TIM major, 100, and 101.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Food and World Cultures (3)
desc: An integrated cross-cultural approach to the study of foods and cultures. Examine history, concepts, principles of cultures and cuisines, the background of food tradition including habitat, social status, religious beliefs, gender, and other environmental considerations. A-F only.
metadata: FGB School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Introduction to Travel Industry Management (3)
desc: Overview of travel industry and related major business components. Analysis of links between hotel, food, transportation, recreation, and other industries comprising tourism.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: Internship I (2)
desc: Introduction to travel industry. Discussion of job search strategies, TIM internship requirements, career and academic planning. CR/NC only.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TIM
title: International Exchange Programs (V)
desc: UH Mānoa School of Travel Industry Management majors participating in approved international exchange programs. CR/NC only.
metadata: School of Travel Industry Management Travel Industry Management (TIM)

subject: TI
title: Directed Reading/Studies (V)
desc: Independent study of approved readings and research with faculty supervision. Repeatable two times, up to nine credits. A-F only.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Translation and Interpretation (TI)

subject: TI
title: (Alpha) Sight Translation (3)
desc: Focus on the ability to translate orally information from a written text. Emphasis on improving linguistic (discourse analysis) and communicative (public speaking) skills. (J) Japanese; (K) Korean; (M) Mandarin; (O) other; (S) Spanish. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: CITS screening exam.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Translation and Interpretation (TI)

subject: TI
title: (Alpha) Simultaneous Interpretation (3)
desc: Simultaneous interpretation of speeches. Focus on the study of formulaic and frozen language characteristically used in international meetings. (J) Japanese; (K) Korean; (M) Mandarin; (O) other; (S) Spanish. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: CITS screening exam.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Translation and Interpretation (TI)

subject: TI
title: (Alpha) Consecutive Interpretation (3)
desc: Extensive note-taking and note-reading in a bilingual context. Focuses on the translation of numbers, acronyms, initials, and economic and financial information. (J) Japanese; (K) Korean; (M) Mandarin; (O) other; (S) Spanish. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: CITS screening exam.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Translation and Interpretation (TI)

subject: TI
title: Medical Interpreting (3)
desc: Healthcare interpreting requires students to understand basic biosystems, common illnesses and treatments, as well as interpreting skills. Students must have 402 or above equivalency of second language skills (or instructor approval). Repeatable one time. Pre: 406 or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Translation and Interpretation (TI)

subject: TI
title: Court Interpreting II (3)
desc: Combined lecture/ discussion/practice. Continuation of 405 Court Interpretation, diving deeper into the practical side of oral interpreting for various proceedings, including arraignments, trials, witness testimonies, etc. Must be bilingual. Real courtroom observations required. Repeatable one time. Pre: 405 or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Translation and Interpretation (TI)

subject: TI
title: Community Interpreting (3)
desc: Basic principles, ethics and skills involved in community interpreting in medical, legal, and social service settings; practical information about the community interpreter’s role and profession; practice of various community interpreting situations and techniques. Repeatable one time.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Translation and Interpretation (TI)

subject: TI
title: Court Interpreting I (3)
desc: Introduction to the legal system, as well as theoretical principles, ethics, practical techniques, and current issues surrounding the practice and profession of court and other legal interpreting. Repeatable one time.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Translation and Interpretation (TI)

subject: TONG
title: Intermediate Tongan (4)
desc: Continuation of 201. Pre: 201 or consent.
metadata: HSL Indo-Pacific Languages and Literatures Tongan (TONG)

subject: TONG
title: Intermediate Tongan (4)
desc: Listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. History and culture. Meets four (4) hours weekly. Pre: 102 or consent.
metadata: HSL Indo-Pacific Languages and Literatures Tongan (TONG)

subject: TONG
title: Beginning Tongan (4)
desc: Continuation of 101. Pre: 101 or consent.
metadata: HSL Indo-Pacific Languages and Literatures Tongan (TONG)

subject: TONG
title: Beginning Tongan (4)
desc: Listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Structural points introduced inductively. History and culture. Meets four (4) hours weekly.
metadata: HSL Indo-Pacific Languages and Literatures Tongan (TONG)

subject: THEA
title: Dissertation Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Seminar in Theatre for Young Audiences (3)
desc: Theories and methods applied in theatrical experiences with and for young audiences: creative movement/drama, puppetry, and theatre/ dance. Pre: one of 470, 474, 475, 476, 477, or DNCE 490.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Seminar in Asian Theatre (3)
desc: (B) Southeast Asia and India; (C) China; (D) Japan. Repeatable two times. Pre: one of 464, 465, 466, or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Seminar in Drama and Theatre (3)
desc: Special topics. Repeatable when topics change. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Directed Research (V)
desc: Reading or research in theatre theory or history; reading and practice in particular areas of dramatic production. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Professional Internship (V)
desc: Internship program where students will work for or with a professional theatre company under supervision of a UH faculty member, plus possible supervisor(s) from the theatre company. Students must participate hands-on in production activities of that company and receive a satisfactory (or better) review from their supervisor(s); (B) entertainment design: costume, lighting, scenery, props, sound, or other related disciplines; (C) performance: acting, directing, dance, choreography, or other related disciplines. Repeatable eight times per alpha, up to nine credits per alpha. A-F only. Pre: 345 or 353 or 356 for (B); 621 or 682 or DNCE 371 for (C). (Cross-listed as DNCE 696 (Alpha))
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Creative Projects (V)
desc: MFA play or dance productions, design projects, original full-length plays. Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Internship: Youth Theatre/Dance (V)
desc: Supervised leadership experiences in theatre/dance program with children. Students spend nine hours per week in supervised setting and three hours in weekly class meeting. Pre: one of 470, 476, or DNCE 490; or consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 693)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Practicum in Teaching (V)
desc: Supervised teaching experience at the introductory or undergraduate level. Students will teach an appropriate level course in their field of expertise under faculty supervision. Repeatable up to nine credits. THEA or DNCE majors only. (Cross-listed as DNCE 692)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Seminar in Teaching Dance/Theatre (3)
desc: Pedagogy and classroom experience in teaching technique and theory. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as DNCE 691)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Graduate Theatre Workshop (V)
desc: Practical and supervisory theatre work pertinent to professional degree objectives on productions being done in Kennedy Theatre or in other venues, by approval. Repeatable eight times, up to 9 credits. THEA majors only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Directing Western Styles (3)
desc: Students direct scenes in classic or non-realistic western theatre styles or genres. Repeatable one time with consent. THEA majors only. A-F only. Graduate student in theatre program. Pre: consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Workshop in Directing Process (3)
desc: Methods class in theatre production for the director. Covers organization and techniques such as rehearsal planning, scheduling, and execution. Repeatable one time.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Graduate Workshop in Directing (3)
desc: Direction of scenes and major one-act plays. Pre-thesis production. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: 600 or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Advanced Topics in Theatre Directing (V)
desc: Readings, discussion, research, and/or performance and scene work. Repeatable five times, up to nine credits. THEA majors only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Directing Asian Theatre (3)
desc: Directing traditional Asian theatre pieces and Western plays performed with Asian techniques; development of new performance styles based on Asian examples; directing of scenes and one-act plays. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: graduate theatre major and one Asian theatre course, or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Topics in Theatre for Young Audiences(3)
desc: Creative movement/drama, puppetry, and theatre/dance; (B) production concepts. Repeatable when topics change. Pre: one of 470, 474, 475, 476, 477, DNCE 490; or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Seminar in Advanced Creative Dramatics (3)
desc: Advanced seminar in applied methods and theories of creative dramatics. Repeatable one time. THEA or DNCE majors only.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Topics in Asian Theatre (3)
desc: Comparative and cross-cultural examination. (B) origins; (C) theories and systems; (D) modern Asian drama. Repeatable one time. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Field Research Methods (3)
desc: Goals and methods. Grant writing, interview, questionnaire, observation, and performance study as research techniques. Practical application by designing a research project. Pre: 600.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Business for the Arts (3)
desc: Seminar offering overview and foundation for launching or advancing enterprises in the arts. A focus on the processes and method for creating economically successful grants and project development applications. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 658)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Seminar in Design (3)
desc: Research, design, and discussion exploring collaborative design problems and solutions. Repeatable two times. A-F only. Pre: 445, 453, 456; or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Costumes III: Advanced Costume Design (3)
desc: Workshop dealing with special topics in costume design and related skills. Repeatable one time with consent. A-F only. Pre: 456 or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Advanced Topics in Costume Construction (3)
desc:
Advanced costume production techniques for entertainment design. Topics may 
include corset, draping, patterning, tailoring, dye work, fabric modification, millinery, leatherwork, and crafts. Topics presented within the context of both current entertainment industry and traditional practices. Repeatable three times for different topics. Pre: 354 (with a minimum grade of B) or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Scenic III: Advanced Scenic Design (3)
desc: Workshop dealing with special topics in scenic design, related skills, and portfolio preparation. Repeatable two times with consent. Pre: 453 or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Scenic II: Intermediate Scene Design (3)
desc: Workshop in advanced techniques and skills of scenic design; research, presentation, rendering, drafting, and model making. Pre: 353 (with a minimum grade of B) or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Professional Advancement in Entertainment Design (1)
desc: Directed study designed to help MFA candidates in Design acquire the tools helpful in obtaining future employment. Portfolios, resumes, and related application tools will be developed along with other necessary skills. Must be current MFA candidate in theatre. Repeatable six times. THEA majors only. Graduate students only.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Lighting III: Advanced Lighting Design (3)
desc: Workshop dealing with special topics in theatrical lighting design and related skills. Repeatable two times. THEA or DNCE majors only. Pre: 644 or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Lighting II: Intermediate Lighting Design (3)
desc: Workshop in intermediate techniques and skills of lighting design; storytelling, analysis, research, envisioning, and communicating a design plan, execution of successful design projects. Use of communication tools such as mini-plots, light renderings, LightWright, and VectorWorks. Repeatable one time. Pre: 345 (with a minimum grade of B) or equivalent experience.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Taiji Weapons for Actors (3)
desc: Advanced level Taijiquan (T’ai Chi Ch’uan) weapons training. Repeatable two times. Pre: 334 or 434, or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Advanced Topics in Performance (V)
desc:
Readings, discussion, research, and/or performance 
work. Repeatable two times, up to nine credits. THEA 
and DNCE majors only. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as 
DNCE 626)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Experimental Asian Acting (3)
desc: Integration of movement, vocal technique, and concepts of traditional Asian genres into the actor’s repertory. Exploration of application to contemporary Asian and non-Asian texts. Workshop format. Repeatable one time. THEA and DNCE majors only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Great Roles in Acting (3)
desc: Great roles from the Western theatre repertory; focus on the individual actor and performance styles. Repeatable one time with consent. Graduate students only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Advanced Voice for the Actor (3)
desc: Training at advanced level in speaking and vocal skills and techniques in preparation for a solo performance. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 420 or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Advanced Topics: Playwriting and Dramatic Theory (3)
desc: Readings, research, writing, and seminar discussions. Pre: 418, 611, and consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Digital Multimedia Tools for Performance Research (3)
desc: Dance, Theatre, Music Majors only. A-F only. Repeatable one time. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Seminar in Performance Studies (3)
desc: Special topics. Repeatable up to two times when topics change. Pre: 615 or consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 617)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Script Analysis (3)
desc: Theory and practical application of script analysis with reference to dramatic texts from various cultural traditions. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Performance Theory (3)
desc: Introduction to key texts and concepts of performance studies. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 615)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Topics in Dramaturgy (3)
desc: (B) role of the dramaturg; covers history, theory, and practice; (C) dramaturgy workshop; accompanies specific Kennedy Theatre productions. Repeatable one time per alpha. Pre: consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Theatre in Europe and the U.S., 1700-Present (3)
desc: Theatre as a cultural and social institution in Europe and the U.S., from the 18th century to the present. Pre: one of 311, 312, 411, 412, or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Theatre in Europe: Classical to 1700 (3)
desc: Theatre as a cultural and social institution in the West, from ancient Greece to Restoration England. Pre: one of 311, 312, 411, 412, or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Seminar in Major Theatre Theory (3)
desc: Major theatre theories from antiquity to the present and across a broad range of cultures. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Seminar in Theatre Research (3)
desc: Bibliography and research methods; preparation for thesis and dissertation writing. Required of many graduate theatre majors.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Directed Work (V)
desc: Individual projects; tutorial. Repeatable two times. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Topics in Drama and Theatre (3)
desc: (B) theatre traditions; (D) contemporary theatre. Repeatable two times each for (B) and (D). Junior standing or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Experimental Theatre Studio (3)
desc: Working collectively, students research, write, design, develop, and perform a full-length production. Repeatable two times. Pre: 6 credits above the 200 level in acting, directing, playwriting, dancing; or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Intermediate Directing (3)
desc: Workshop; students direct one-act plays. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: 380 and consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Hula Ki‘i: Hawaiian Puppetry and Image Dancing (3)
desc: History, techniques, construction, and performance of Hawaiian puppetry and traditional image dancing. Repeatable one time. Junior standing or higher.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Giant Puppetry (3)
desc: History, construction, and performance techniques for large-scale and giant puppets. For teachers, recreation directors, and others working with students aged 10 to 18 and adults
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Puppetry (3)
desc: History and scope of puppetry. Construction and presentation of puppets for adult and child audiences. Repeatable one time.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Puppetry for Young Children (3)
desc: Methods of constructing puppets and stages with and for children 3 to 8 years of age. Use of puppets in the creative arts. Fieldwork.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Theatre for Young Audiences (3)
desc: Theories and principles of formal theatre for young audiences. Study of and practice in the selection, direction, and production of plays.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Storytelling (3)
desc: Storytelling development through focused activities on personal artistic practice, story content, and public performative techniques. Repeatable one time.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Creative Drama (3)
desc: Dramatic activities for young people. For teachers, group workers, recreation majors, and others dealing with children. Supervised field activities.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Drama and Theatre of Hawai‘i (3)
desc: Survey of indigenous theatre forms of Hawai‘i, Native Hawaiian, and other ethnic playwrights, and contemporary multicultural landscape of drama and theatre in Hawai‘i. Sophomore standing or higher. (Alt. years: fall)
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Drama and Theatre of Japan (3)
desc: Survey of Japanese theatre forms, from traditional to contemporary. Includes examination of dramatic texts, performance elements, and historical context, utilizing written, aural, and visual materials. Junior standing or above. Pre: 311 or consent.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Drama and Theatre of China (3)
desc: Yuan, southern, spoken drama; Beijing opera and the manner of their production. Pre: consent.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Drama and Theatre of Southeast Asia and India (3)
desc: Court, folk, popular traditions, and the manner of their production. Pre: consent.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Drama and Theatre of Oceania (3)
desc: Survey of the contemporary drama and theatre of Oceania that combines island and Western traditions. Includes Papua New Guinea, Hawai‘i, Fiji, Samoa, Australia, New Zealand. Pre: 101 or ANTH 350, or consent. (Cross-listed as PACS 462)
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Costumes II: Intermediate Costume Design (3)
desc: Advanced costume design for theatre and dance. Introduction to collaborative process in costume. Intensive work on rendering skills, applied to various design problems. Cost analysis and organizational techniques. Pre: 356 or consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 456)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to Computer-Aided Design for the Theatre (3)
desc: Basic concepts and techniques of 2D computer-aided design. Lecture/ workshop covers language and commands common to most CAD packages with a focus on drafting specific to theatre. A laptop with Vectorworks installed is required. Pre: 343 or consent. (Once a year)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Stage Management (3)
desc: Business, organization and management for theatre and dance productions. Junior standing or higher. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Topics in Costume Construction (3)
desc: Costume production techniques, both Western and Asian, for theatre and dance. Topic rotation includes: understructures and armatures, patterning, tailoring, dyeing, fabric modification, millenery and crafts, within the context of current industry practice. Repeatable two times. A-F only. Pre: 354, 356, or consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 446)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Musical Theatre Dance Forms (3)
desc: Theatrical dance forms used in 20th-century musical theatre. Pre: 100 level or above dance technique class, 421, or consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as DNCE 439)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Advanced Movement for Actors (3)
desc: Detailed development of material presented in 435. Focus on Bartenieff fundamentals and movement analysis as it applies to the physical interpretation of theatrical roles. Pre: one of 435, DNCE 435, or consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as DNCE 436)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Movement for Actors (3)
desc: Training actors to discover experientially the sources of movement; to teach skills for analyzing movement for its mechanical, anatomical, spatial, and dynamic content; and then to apply these skills in a role. Pre: 222 or consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 435)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Taiji (T’ai Chi) for Actors II (3)
desc: Intermediate-level Taijiquan (T’ai Chi Ch’uan) movement training. Repeatable two times. Pre: 334 or consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 434)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Movement Workshop (V)
desc: Special workshops in movement relating to specific departmental theatrical productions beyond the scope of movement taught in 437 and 438. Repeatable one time. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as DNCE 433)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Stage Combat (3)
desc: Techniques for performing unarmed and armed stage combat. Repeatable one time. Pre: one of 221, 222, 321, 322; or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Contemporary Performance Practices (3)
desc: Focus on individual training in the skills and techniques of contemporary experimental theatre including acting, directing, and self-scripting. Repeatable two times. Pre: one of 222, 318, 380, or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Japanese Acting Workshop (V)
desc: Training in skills and techniques for selected traditional Japanese theatre forms. Emphasis on movement and vocal technique. Repeatable to six credits. Pre: 221, 222 or consent. (Alt. years)  DA
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Chinese Acting Workshop (V)
desc: Training in skills and techniques for selected traditional Chinese theatre forms. Emphasis on movement and vocal technique. Repeatable to six credits. Pre: 221, 222, or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: South/Southeast Asian Acting Workshop (3)
desc: Training in skills and techniques for selected traditional south and southeast Asian theatre forms. Emphasis on movement and vocal techniques. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 222 or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Hawaiian Performance Workshop (3)
desc: Training in skills and techniques for selected traditional Hawaiian performance forms and Hawaiian medium theatre. Emphasis on movement and vocal technique. Repeatable one time. Pre: one of: 101, 221, 224, 468, HAW 202, HAW 321, HAW 384, HAW 486, DNCE 312, DNCE 411, DNCE 412; or consent. (Alt. years) (Crosslisted as DNCE 424)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Acting Shakespeare (3)
desc: Techniques for acting in Shakespearean and heightened language texts. Repeatable one time. Pre: 222, 322, or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Period Styles in Acting (3)
desc: Presentational acting in comedy and tragedy; emphasis on performance styles in Elizabethan, Restoration, and 18th-century drama. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: 222 or 322 or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Musical Theatre (3)
desc: Training in skills required to perform in musicals. Students present scenes from musical comedies for criticism and review. Repeatable two times with consent. Pre: one of 321, 322, MUS 231B, or consent; and/or audition. (Cross-listed as MUS 421)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Intermediate Voice for the Actor (3)
desc: Training in proper and dynamic use of the voice for the actor. (B) Western traditions; (C) Asian traditions. Repeatable two times. Pre: 220 or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Advanced Playwriting (3)
desc: Workshop in experimental writing in dramatic form; full-length plays. Repeatable one time. Pre: 318.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Women, Gender, & Sexuality in Performance (3)
desc: Feminist and performance studies approaches to performances by women and other genders; focus on the representation and status of women Pre: 311 or consent. (Cross-listed as WGSS 414) DH
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Approaches to Dramatic Texts (3)
desc: Intensive analysis and discussion of dramatic texts from a variety of authors. Understanding trends and variations in dramatic form and content. (B) contemporary British and American drama; (C) political drama in the West. Pre: one of 311, 312, 411, 412, or consent.
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: World Theatre: Modern (3)
desc: Pluralism in modern theatre, 1900–present. Reactions to realism and current international theatre forms, develops written communication skills. Pre: 311 (or concurrent). (Alt. years)
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: World Theatre: Elite and Popular (3)
desc: Interplay between elite and popular forms to 1900. Develops written communication skills. Pre: 311 (or concurrent). (Alt. years)
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Advanced Practicum (1)
desc: Advanced workshop experience in the practical application of performing arts skills. (B) performance; (C) stagecraft; (D) costume; (E) performing arts management; (F) directing dramaturgy stage management choreography. Repeatable up to four credits per alpha. Pre: audition and performance of role in a Department of Theatre and Dance production for (B); 200C for (C); 200D for (D); 200E for (E); 200B or 200C or 200F, and consent for (F). (Cross-listed as DNCE 400)
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Beginning Directing (3)
desc: Basic practical course in how to direct a play. Students will direct scenes. Emphasis on writing instruction. THEA and DNCE majors only. Pre: upper division theatre majors or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Stage Makeup Workshop (3)
desc: Western and traditional Asian makeup theory and application practice. Western corrective, period, and old age makeup. Asian may include Jingju, Kabuki, Wayang. Repeatable one time. Pre: 240 or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Costumes I: Beginning Costume Design (3)
desc: Basic principles and approaches to costume design for theatre and dance. Visual communication methods, creative process, historical research, and organizational practices. Repeatable one time. Pre: 240, or consent. (Cross-listed as CINE 356 and DNCE 356)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to Costume Construction (4)
desc: Workshop on basic principles of costume construction for theatre and dance. Professional practices, materials, and methods. (Cross-listed as DNCE 354)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Scenic I: Beginning Scenic Design (3)
desc: Workshop introducing the basic principles and approaches of scenic design for theatre and dance, with emphasis on the creative process. Pre: a course in THEA or DNCE, production experience, or consent. (Consent required for production experience option) (Cross-listed as CINE 353 and DNCE 353)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Lighting I: Beginning Lighting Design (3)
desc: Basic principles of lighting design and associated technologies. Includes functions and properties of light, lighting and control equipment, working procedures, and drafting and paperwork techniques. Pre: THEA/DNCE 240 or consent. (Once a year) (Cross-listed as DNCE 345)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Topics in Theatre Production (3)
desc: Workshop in principles, techniques, and application of contemporary theatre production practices. (B) entertainment electrics: lighting, sound, special effects, projections, and related areas; (C) technical production: technical direction, technical design, construction, rigging, and related areas; (D) scenic painting: techniques of scene painting for theatre through reading, drawing exercises, color theory, and practical projects; (E) props and crafts: techniques to create props for theatre. Repeatable one time for different alphas, each alpha can be taken one time. Pre: any course in THEA or DNCE, or production experience; or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Taiji Round Form for Actors (3)
desc: Introduction to basic Asian movement skills through learning the Wu-style taijiquan round form, a faster and more fluid version of the full 108 taiji sequence of forms. Open to non-majors. Repeatable two times. Sophomore standing or higher. Pre: consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Taiji (T’ai Chi) for Actors I (3)
desc: Basic Taijiquan (T’ai Chi Ch’uan) movement training. Repeatable two times. Sophomore standing or higher. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 334)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to Asian Acting Styles (3)
desc: Principles of acting based on traditional Asian models. Voice, movement exercises. Pre: 221 or 222 or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Advanced Film/TV Acting (3)
desc: Advanced acting techniques for film and TV production. Taping/filming of scenes and full-length scripts. Repeatable one time. Pre: 323 and consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Film/TV Acting (3)
desc: Acting techniques for film and TV production. Students appear in scenes from TV and film scripts. Repeatable one time. Pre: 101 or 221 or 222 or COM 201 or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Acting II: Advanced Scene Study (3)
desc: Further exploration of character development and dramatic action through textual analysis. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: 221 or 222 or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Auditioning (3)
desc: Preparation of material from different audition situations, including monologues, cold readings, dance, singing, and TV/ film. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: 221 or 222 or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Screenplay Writing (3)
desc: Characterization, structure, theme, image, and other components of writing for film. Pre: 201 and grade of B or better in composition, or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Playwriting (3)
desc: One-act plays; practice in writing in dramatic form. Repeatable one time. Pre: grade of B or better in composition or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: World Theatre II: Myth to Drama (3)
desc: Myth and ritual into drama, 1000 BCE–1700 CE. Development of secular drama from sacred and ritual beginnings. Required of all majors. Pre: 311 (Alt. years)
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: World Theatre I: Script Analysis (3)
desc: Script analysis methods for world drama. Develops written and oral communication skills. Required of all majors. Pre: one of 101, 221, 222, 240; or consent.
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to Voice Function and Singing Styles (3)
desc: Students will study how the singing voice works in various styles, including classical, musical theater, jazz, choral, and pop/ rock. Students will learn historical contexts, aural characteristics, and musical vocabulary through lecture, discussion, and listening. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as MUS 259) DA
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Principles of Design (3)
desc: Introduction to general design principles as applied to theatre. Will introduce the language and tools of visual literacy and visual communications via individual projects and collaboration. Repeatable two times. (Cross-listed as DNCE 245)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Film/TV Production Process (3)
desc: Entry-level course details three phases of the production process for film and video projects: pre-production, production, and post-production. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Theatre Production Lab (1)
desc: Lab observations and projects illustrating basic principles of theatre production. A-F only. Co-requisite: 240.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to Stage Production (3)
desc: Survey class introducing theater management, lighting, costuming, scenery, and other aspects of theatre that relate to producing stage performances. (Cross-listed as DNCE 240)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Pidgin/HCE Drama (3)
desc: Introduction to Hawaiian Creole English (HCE) multicultural comedy and drama in Hawai‘i. Emphasis on acting exercises, local dialects, and the performance of Pidgin/HCE plays. Repeatable one time with consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Acting I: Foundations and Techniques for Stage and Screen (3)
desc: Fundamentals of contemporary acting styles for stage and screen, including self-awareness, character, and scene work. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: THEA major or 221, or consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to Acting for Stage and Screen (3)
desc: Beginning acting techniques for theatre and screen media including exercises, improvisations, monologues, and scenes. Focus on voice, relaxation, body awareness, and freedom from self-consciousness. Emphasis on writing instruction as appropriate to discipline. Repeatable one time with consent.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Beginning Voice and Movement (3)
desc: Introduction to vocal and movement techniques to increase self-awareness and potential for self-expression. Repeatable one time.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Development of the Sound Film (3)
desc: Growth and changes in aesthetics of the sound film from 1929 to present; films by Renoir, Welles, Eisenstein, etc. Pre: 201. (Alt. years)
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to Long-Form Improvisation (1)
desc: Introduction to long-form improvisation as developed by companies such as Second City and iO Chicago. Focus will be on games, situations, creating characters, and forming narratives from those elements. Repeatable two times.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to the Art of the Film (3)
desc: Introduction to the aesthetics of silent and sound movies. Technical subjects analyzed only as they relate to theme and style.
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: (Alpha) Beginning Practicum (1)
desc: Beginning workshop experience in the practical application of performing arts skills. (B) performance; (C) stagecraft; (D) costume; (E) performing arts management; (F) directing dramaturgy stage management choreography. Repeatable up to four credits in each alpha. Pre: (B) audition and performance of role in a Department of Theatre and Dance production; (F) consent. (Cross-listed as DNCE 200) DA
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Live on Stage (3)
desc: Students view locally produced theatre and dance productions and write performance reviews. Readings, writing, and class discussion will guide students to understand each performance. Performances include theatre, dance, musical theatre, opera, and performance art. Repeatable one time. (Spring only) (Cross-listed as DNCE 152)
metadata: DH College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THEA
title: Introduction to World Drama and Theatre (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 1-hr Lab) Performance traditions of Africa, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, and the Pacific from the 5th century B.C. to the present. Analysis of political, religious, and technological conditions of theatre. Includes practical theatre workshop. Emphasis on writing instruction. A-F only.
metadata: DA College of Arts, Languages & Letters Theatre (THEA)

subject: THAI
title: (Alpha) Readings in Thai Contemporary Prose Literature: the Novel (3)
desc: Selected readings in Thai novels from early 1930s to present. Oral and written reviews. (B) 1930–1969; (C) 1970–present. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: 402, 461(B) or 461(C), or consent.
metadata: DL Thai (THAI)

subject: THAI
title: (Alpha) Readings in Thai Contemporary Prose Literature: the Short Story (3)
desc: Selected readings in Thai short stories from early 1930s to present. Oral and written reviews (B) 1930-1969; (C) 1970-present. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: 402 or consent.
metadata: DL Thai (THAI)

subject: THAI
title: Structure of Thai (3)
desc: Continuation of 451. Pre: 451 or consent.
