desc: From design to performance, students mount an original production based on traditional motifs. Repeatable one time. Pre: 402 (or concurrent), or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Haku Hanakeaka–Hawaiian Language Playwriting (3)
desc: The creation and authoring of Hawaiian language play scripts based on traditional motifs. Repeatable one time. Pre: 402 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: DA Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Hawaiian Poetry (3)
desc: Historical survey and analysis of poetry found in traditional chants, folk songs, modern poetry written in Hawaiian. Interpreting and composing Hawaiian poetry. Pre: 302 and consent, or 401.
metadata: DL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Papa Mele Wahi Pana (3)
desc: Will provide students with the opportunity to learn mele, mainly poetry and song, composed specifically for a certain area of Hawai‘i. Pre: 302 or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Ho‘omōhala Ha‘awina Kaiapuni Curriculum Development (3)
desc: Examination of curricular issues of indigenous language programs; weekly participation in an immersion classroom; development of materials. Repeatable one time. Pre: 302 or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Kuleana Kula Kaiapuni (3)
desc: Examination of the political struggles of the Kula Kaiapuni (Hawaiian Immersion Program)–past and present. Special attention given to federal and state governments, Department of Education, and internal political struggles. Pre: 401 (or concurrent with consent).
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Language for the Classroom (3)
desc: Examination of language needs in various classroom settings and introduction to new vocabulary in school content areas. Pre: 302, 452, and consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: (Alpha) Ha‘uki: Sports Education Through the Medium of Hawaiian (2)
desc: Provide Hawaiian language students with linguistic tools necessary to provide sports education to Hawaiian immersion schools and for basic intergenerational use of Hawaiian in the linguistic domain of sports. (B) basketball; (C) volleyball; (D) football; (E) baseball. Repeatable for other topics.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: History of the Hawaiian Language (3)
desc: Development from proto-Polynesian. Phonology, morphology, and grammar; history of research. Pre: 302 (or concurrent) and 452, or consent.
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: ‘Ōlelo Ni‘ihau I (3)
desc: Basic study of ‘Olelo Ni‘ihau. Speaking and listening comprehension will be developed through listening to audio recordings, watching video recordings, and participating in faceto-face conversations with Ni‘ihau native speakers. Pre: 402 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Structure of Hawaiian (3)
desc: Descriptive linguistic analysis. Intensive exercises in advanced grammar. Pre: 302 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Na Politika ma ka Nuhou Hawai‘i– Politics in Hawaiian Language Media (3)
desc: Study of Hawaiian news media with emphasis on political content. Includes field trips to various archives. Pre: 302 (or concurrent), or consent. (Cross-listed as POLS 344)
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: (Alpha) Problems in Translation (3)
desc: Problems in translation of: (B) legal documents; (C) newspapers; (D) religious writings. Pre: 302 or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: E Pū Pa‘akai Kākou: A Study of Traditional Hawaiian and Contemporary Food Culture (3)
desc: A study of traditional Hawaiian and contemporary food culture through hands-on applications and lectures. Pre: 302 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: I Pa‘a Ke Kahua (3)
desc: An experiential approach to the acquisition of vocabulary, which will allow students to broaden and deepen their knowledge of language and the range of domains to perpetuate Hawaiian as a living language. Repeatable one time. Pre: 302 (or concurrent), or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Haku Mo‘olelo–Creative Writing in Hawaiian (3)
desc: Study and composition of written works in various creative genres of Hawaiian storytelling, with a focus on the adaptation and maintenance of a Hawaiian voice and worldview in writing. Pre: 302 and 331.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Ma Ka Hana Ka ‘Ike (3)
desc: Study of traditional Hawaiian language and cultural practices through hands-on applications and lectures. Pre: 302 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Ka Hō‘ike Honua (3)
desc: Study of Hawaiian land tenure practices through readings and discussions of audiotapes, written primary sources, maps, wind names, rain names, ‘Ōlelo no‘eau (wise sayings), and mele (poetry). Readings are drawn from 19th and 20th century Hawaiian newspapers and other primary sources. Pre: 302 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Ka Mana‘o Politika Hawai‘i–Political Thought in Hawaiian (3)
desc: Intensive study of Hawaiian political thought in writing and speech. Pre: 302 (or concurrent) or consent. (Cross-listed as POLS 303C)
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: I Le‘a Ka Hula I Ka Ho‘opa‘a (Mo‘olelo, Ka‘ao, Mele and Hula) (3)
desc: The incorporation of mele and hula performance with mo‘olelo and ka‘ao. Pre: 302 or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Ka‘ao Hawai‘i (3)
desc: Survey of the core literature written by Hawaiian scholars, including both historical and mythological epics and folk tales. Pre: 302.
metadata: DL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Mo‘olelo Hawai‘i (3)
desc: Survey of the major works by Hawaiian scholars writing about the history and culture of Hawai‘i including David Malo, Kamakau, Kepelino, and John Papa Î‘i. Pre: 302.
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Fourth-Level Hawaiian II (3)
desc: Continuation of 401. Pre: 401 or exam, or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Fourth-Level Hawaiian I (3)
desc: Advanced speaking/conversation, discussion, listening comprehension, reading, writing, and cultural understanding. Conducted in Hawaiian. Transcribing and translating recordings of native speakers in Hawaiian. Pre: 302 or exam, or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Ka Haku Mele (3)
desc: Composers and Their Compositions. Provides a venue which will allow students to analyze, dissect and discuss mele (song, poetry and chant), paying close attention to the style of composition by identifying reoccurring nuances found in mele composed by the same as well as various authors. Pre: completion of 202 or consent. (Once a year)
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Hana ‘Oe a Kani Pono-Hawaiian Radio Broadcasting (3)
desc: Combined lecture/lab involving students in the planning and production of a weekly Hawaiian language radio broadcast. Includes research, writing, and voicing of mele and their stories on live radio. Repeatable one time. Pre: 302 or 384 (or concurrent with consent), or consent.
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Ka Mo‘omeheu Hawai‘i (3)
desc: A survey course on the study of traditional Hawaiian culture including origins, the socioeconomic system, land tenure, religion, values, and the arts. The course will be taught in Hawaiian. Pre: 302 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Ulu ka Hoi (3)
desc: Lecture offering focused study and creation of Hawaiian language newspapers with a concentration on the characteristics of writing in this genre. Students will produce a monthly newsletter in Hawaiian. Repeatable one time. Pre: 302 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: DH Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Listening Comprehension and Transcription (3)
desc: Development of listening comprehension through transcription and discussion of tape recordings. Pre: 202.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Hawaiian Composition (3)
desc: Intensive work in the grammatical, semantic, and pragmatic dimensions of composition writing in Hawaiian. Pre: 202.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Hawaiian Conversation (3)
desc: Systematic practice on various topics for control of spoken Hawaiian. Repeatable up to six credit hours. Pre: 202 or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Third-Level Hawaiian II (3)
desc: Continuation of 301. Pre: 301 or exam, or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Third-Level Hawaiian I (3)
desc: Continuation of 202 with emphasis on increasing proficiency in speaking/conversation, listening, comprehension, reading, writing, and cultural understanding. Conducted in Hawaiian. Pre: 202 or 206 or exam, or consent.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Papa Mele I (Mele in the Hawaiian Language Classroom) (3)
desc: The incorporation of mele and the performance thereof for the enhancement of second language acquisition in Hawaiian. Pre: 102.
metadata: Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Hawaiian Literature in Translation (3)
desc: Survey of Hawaiian literature, including prose narration and poetry with reference to Polynesian and Western themes and forms.
metadata: DL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Intensive Intermediate Hawaiian (8)
desc: Content of 201 and 202 covered in one semester. Meets two hours daily, plus lab work. Pre: 102 or 105, or exam.
metadata: HSL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Intermediate Hawaiian II (4)
desc: Continuation of 201. Pre: 201 or exam, or consent.
metadata: HSL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Intermediate Hawaiian I (4)
desc: Continuation of 102 with continued development in the foundational skills of language acquisition: speaking, listening, comprehension, reading, writing, and cultural understanding. Increased emphasis on reading or traditional texts. Pre: 102 or 105 or exam or consent.
metadata: HSL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: I Ka ‘Olelo No Ke Ola (4)
desc: Accelerated lecture/lab to bridge fluent speakers mainly from Kula Kaiapuni into Kawaihuelani’s system of Hawaiian that reflects a Hawaiian worldview, including HAW 101-201 content, grammar, writing, and spelling conventions. Students matriculate into HAW 202. Pre: instructor consent required. (Spring only)
metadata: HSL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Intensive Elementary Hawaiian (8)
desc: Content of 101 and 102 (Elementary Hawaiian I & II) covered in one semester.
metadata: HSL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Elementary Hawaiian II (4)
desc: Continuation of 101. Pre: 101 or exam or consent.
metadata: HSL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Elementary Hawaiian I (4)
desc: Introductory course in Hawaiian language focused on the foundational skills of language acquisition: speaking, listening, comprehension, reading, writing, and cultural understanding.
metadata: HSL Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: HAW
title: Language in Hawai‘i: A Microcosm of Global Language Issues (3)
desc: Survival kit for life in Hawai‘i: Introduction to Hawaiian and language related issues enhancing communicative experience in Hawai‘i. Examination of social, cultural, political, and linguistic cross-cultural interaction locally and globally. Taught in English/Hawai‘i Creole English.
metadata: FGB Hawaiʻinuiākea School of Hawaiian Knowledge Hawaiian (HAW)

subject: GRK
title: Seminar in Greek Studies (3)
desc: Study of an author or phase in Greek studies. Repeatable unlimited times with consent. Pre: any two 300-level GRK courses, or consent.
metadata: College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GRK
title: Greek Lyric (3)
desc: Selections from Sappho, Alcaeus, and others. Pre: 201 and 202, or consent.
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GRK
title: Greek Drama (3)
desc: Selections from Aeschylus, Sophocles, and Euripides. Pre: 201 and 202, or consent.
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GRK
title: Greek Philosophy (3)
desc: Selections from Plato, Aristotle, and others. Pre: 201 and 202, or consent.
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GRK
title: Greek Epic (3)
desc: Selections from Homer, Hesiod, and others. Pre: 201 and 202, or consent.
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GRK
title: Greek Historians (3)
desc: Selections from Herodotus, Xenophon, and others. Pre: 201 and 202, or consent.
metadata: DL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GRK
title: Intermediate Greek (3)
desc: Continuation of 201: emphasis on poetry. Pre: 201.
metadata: HSL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GRK
title: Intermediate Greek (3)
desc: Development of reading and translation skills. Emphasis on prose. Pre: 102 or equivalent.
metadata: HSL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GRK
title: Elementary Greek (3)
desc: Continuation of 101. Pre: 101.
metadata: HSL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GRK
title: Elementary Greek (3)
desc: Grammar and vocabulary, with reading of simple Greek.
metadata: HSL College of Arts, Languages & Letters Greek (GRK) Religions & Ancient Civilizations

subject: GES
title: Undergraduate Thesis (V)
desc: Directed research in which the student carries out a scientific project of small to moderate scope with one or more chosen advisors. The student must complete a document in the style of a scientific journal article. Repeatable up to six credits. GES majors only. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as OCN 499)
metadata: Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Communication of Research Results (2)
desc: Lecture/discussion to provide instruction and experience in oral and written presentation of scientific results and material. GES majors only in their final semester. A-F only. Pre: GES/OCN 499 (or concurrent). (Cross-listed as OCN 490)
metadata: Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Data Analysis in Earth Science (3)
desc: Combined lecture, discussion, and laboratory on global Earth system databases and satellite instrumentation, including computer laboratory. GES majors only. A-F only. Pre: MATH 242; or consent. (Cross-listed as OCN 463)
metadata: DP Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Earth’s Microbiome Lab(3)
desc: Lab on the diversity and function of the Earth’s microbiomes, inclusive of terrestrial and aquatic ecosystems, symbiotic and free living microorganisms with a focus on the microbial underpinnings of the Earth’s biogeochemistry. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only. Pre: OCN 102 or OCN 201 or BOT 305 or BIOL 305, or BIOL 171 and BIOL 172. (Alt years: Fall) (Cross-listed as OCN 454L)
metadata: DY Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Earth’s Microbiome (3)
desc: Lecture on the diversity and function of the Earth’s microbiomes, inclusive of terrestrial and aquatic ecosystems, symbiotic and free living microorganisms with a focus on the microbial underpinnings of the Earth’s biogeochemistry. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only. Pre: OCN 102 or OCN 201 or BOT 305 or BIOL 305, or BIOL 171 and BIOL 172. (Alt years: Fall) (Cross-listed as OCN 454)
metadata: DB Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Biogeochemical Systems (3)
desc: Relationship of biogeochemical cycles in the atmosphere, lithosphere, and biosphere to global chemical cycles and planetary climatic conditions. GES degree foundation and capstone course with an emphasis on improving student writing skills. GES majors only. Senior standing only. A-F only. Pre: OCN 201, GES 311, BIOL 172/172L, CHEM 162/162L, ERTH 101/101L, GES 319L (or concurrent), ATMO 200 (or concurrent), and GES/OCN 499 (or concurrent); or consent. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as OCN 401)
metadata: DP Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Directed Reading (V)
desc: Directed reading in earth system science, oceanography, or environmental science. Repeatable up to 6 credits. GES majors only. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as OCN 399)
metadata: Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Aquatic Pollution (3)
desc: Pollution of freshwater and marine systems by human activities. Causes, consequences, and correctives. GES majors only. Pre: 201, CHEM 161, BIOL 171. (Cross-listed as OCN 320)
metadata: DP Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Introduction to the Environment, Climate Change, & Sustainability (3)
desc: Introduction to the environment, climate change, and sustainability as they apply to ecosystems. Sustainability will be introduced through active learning exercises that address sustainable development and the three pillars of sustainability. Repeatable one time. A-F only. ((Cross-listed as OCN 102 and SUST 112)
metadata: DB Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GES
title: Global Environmental Science Seminar (1)
desc: Seminar to introduce new GES majors to the research interests of GES faculty and the research facilities available within SOEST. Restricted to GES majors. CR/NC only. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as OCN 100)
metadata: Global Environmental Science (GES) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GER

metadata: German (GER) Languages and Literatures of Europe and the Americas (LLEA)

subject: GER

metadata: DH German (GER) Languages and Literatures of Europe and the Americas (LLEA)

metadata: DH German (GER) Languages and Literatures of Europe and the Americas (LLEA)

subject: GER
title: Romanticism (3)
desc: Novalis, Tieck, E. T. A. Hoffmann, Eichendorff, etc. Pre: 306 or consent.

desc: Classical writings of Goethe and Schiller; some reference to other writers. Pre: 306 or consent.

title: Enlightenment—Sturm und Drang (3)
desc: Lessing and his contemporaries; early dramas of Goethe and Schiller; Goethe’s early lyrics. Pre: 306 or consent.

subject: GER
title: Practical German for use in Hawai‘i (3)
desc: Use of German in practical situations in Hawai‘i, e.g., in travel industry. Pre: 202.

subject: GER
title: Modern German Culture (3)
desc: Modern culture in post-World War II Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. Pre: 202 or consent.

subject: GER
title: Germanic Civilization to World War II (3)
desc: German cultural heritage and history in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland until World War II. Pre: 202 or consent.

desc: Study of German film history, film analysis, film theory, and film study. Lecture/discussion. Repeatable one time, or take LLEA 320 one time, for different topics. 6 cr. limit on GER/LLEA 320 courses. Pre: 303 or 306.

title: Introduction to German Literature 1914-Present (3)
desc: Reading and discussion of representative works of German literature from 1914 to present. Pre: 303 or consent.

subject: GER
title: Introduction to German Literature 1750- 1914: (3)
desc: Reading and discussion of representative works of German literature from 1750 to 1914. Pre: 303 or consent.
metadata: DL German (GER) Languages and Literatures of Europe and the Americas (LLEA)

title: Modern Readings: Freedom, Happiness and Free Body Culture (3)
desc: Further expansion and improvement of reading skills through the study of authentic modern texts (short stories; newspaper articles, and internet) with topics relating to culture, society, and history, e.g., FKK Freikörperkultur, or ‘free body culture’. Pre: 202 or consent.

subject: GER
title: Modern Readings: Wanderlust, Love, and Desire (3)
desc: Development of reading skills through the study of authentic modern texts (short stories; articles from newspapers, magazines, and the internet) with topics relating to culture, society, and history. Pre: 202 or consent.
metadata: DH German (GER) Languages and Literatures of Europe and the Americas (LLEA)

subject: GER
title: Conversation (3)
desc: Intensive practice in spoken German designed to increase vocabulary and improve oral proficiency. Pre: 202 (or concurrent with consent) or 260.
metadata: German (GER) Languages and Literatures of Europe and the Americas (LLEA)

subject: GER
title: Contemporary Topics in Media (3)
desc: Development of listening and speaking, reading and writing skills through analysis and discussion of media: newspaper articles, radio, and television programs and online sources. Pre: 202 or consent.

subject: GER
title: Business German (3)
desc: Advanced German conversation, reading, and writing with a special emphasis on the vocabulary and cultural context of the German business world. Pre: 202 or consent.

title: Reading and Writing (3)
desc: Further development of reading and writing skills through the study of short texts, focusing on modern German short stories, fairy tales, poems and song lyrics. Pre: 202.

desc:
Nerve cells, their signaling capabilities and the developmental organization of nervous systems, both invertebrate and vertebrate, for sensory reception, integration, behavioral command and learning;insights from on-going research using molecular, 
genetic, biophysical, and imaging methods. Pre: BIOL 275 or consent. (Spring only)

subject: GER
title: Phonetics and Pronunciation Practice (3)
desc: Analysis of the German phonological system and practice in pronunciation. Pre: 202 (or concurrent with consent) or 260.

desc: Intensive course of formal instruction on the second-year level in German language and culture in Germany. Pre: 102.

title: Intermediate German (3)
desc: Conversation, grammar, reading and writing. Pre: 201.

title: Intermediate German (3)
desc: Conversation, grammar, reading and writing. Pre: 102.

title: Intensive Elementary German (6)
desc: Combined content of 101 and 102 covered in one intensive course. (Summer only)

subject: GER
title: Elementary German (3)
desc: Conversation, grammar and reading. Pre: 101.

title: Elementary German (3)
desc: Conversation, grammar and reading.

subject: GERI
title: Medical Student Training in Aging Program (2)
desc: Introduces medical students to clinical, research, and academic experiences in geriatrics, under the mentorship of faculty members. MD majors only. CR/NC only. Pre: MDED 554 or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: Geriatric Medicine (GERI) John A. Burns School of Medicine

subject: GERI
title: Geriatric and Palliative Medicine Elective (V)
desc: F\Provides an overview of geriatric and palliative medicine in the outpatient, inpatient, homecare, and long-term care settings. Various instructional methods are utilized, including clinical experiences, workshops, and case discussions using a range of interdisciplinary teachers. CR/NC only.
metadata: Geriatric Medicine (GERI) John A. Burns School of Medicine

subject: GERI
title: Geriatric Medicine Research (V)
desc: Medical students will have the opportunity to complete a research project in the field of epidemiology of aging, and present an abstract at a local meeting. Basic principles of epidemiology and statistics will be taught. Repeatable one time. CR/NC only. Pre: departmental approval.
metadata: Geriatric Medicine (GERI) John A. Burns School of Medicine

subject: GERI
title: Geriatric and Palliative Care (V)
desc: Provides an overview of geriatric and palliative medicine in the outpatient, inpatient, homecare, and long-term care settings. Various instructional methods are utilized, including clinical experiences, workshops, and case discussions using a range of interdisciplinary teachers.
metadata: Geriatric Medicine (GERI) John A. Burns School of Medicine

subject: ERTH
title: Dissertation Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: MGeo Professional Project (V)
desc: Practical hands-on professional experience, typically with a local company or agency, and involving a final written report and an oral presentation. A grade of credit is assigned when the internship presentations are satisfactorily completed. Repeatable up to six credits. MGEO majors only. CR/NC only.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: MGeo Seminar (1)
desc: Seminar to improve student awareness of trends and practices in geoscience professions, and develop ability to prepare, deliver, and evaluate a professional scientific presentation. Targets abstract writing, oral presentation, and technical criticism. Repeatable two times. A-F only. (Spring only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Special Topics in Earth and Planetary Sciences (3)
desc: Content to be announced. Repeatable eight times. Pre: consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Selected Topics in Earth and Planetary Sciences (2)
desc: Content to be announced. Repeatable eight times. Pre: consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Fractures and Faults (3)
desc: Lecture on elasticity theory, fracture mechanics and boundary element modeling, with application to faults and fractures in the Earth. Pre: consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Physics of the Earth’s Interior (3)
desc: Interpretation of geophysical and laboratory data to understand elastic and anelastic properties, composition, phase relationships, temperature distribution in the Earth. Pre: consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Directed Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times. CR/NC only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Bayesian Data Analysis (3)
desc: Linear and nonlinear techniques for model selection, parameter estimation, simulation and forecasting, from Bayesian principles with particular attention to large data sets and sparse noisy data. Pre: 600 or 691. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Data Exploration and Processing (3)
desc: Time- and frequency analysis, filtering, factor and cluster analysis, interpolation, quantitative map analysis, and introduction to wavelets and fractals. Pre: 413 or consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH

desc: Introduction to the Generic Mapping Tools (GMT). Processing of scientific data and the automated preparation of maps and illustrations using GMT on UNIX workstations, with introduction to UNIX and the C shell environment.

subject: ERTH

desc: Study of the paleoceanographic and paleoclimate evolution of the Earth’s oceans, atmosphere and biosphere. Repeatable one time. Pre: consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as OCN 674)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: (Alpha) Extraterrestrial Material (3)
desc: Mineralogical and compositional characteristics of extraterrestrial matter and the implications for the origin and history of the solar system. The subject is treated in two full-semester courses: (B) meteorites; (C) petrology of the Moon and Mars. Pre: consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Seminar in Tectonics (3)
desc: Evolution of ocean basins, margins, foldbelts, and platforms, from plate tectonics and regional syntheses of structure, petrology, geophysics, and stratigraphy. Repeatable eight times. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: (Alpha) Remote Sensing (3)
desc: Spectroscopic, radar, thermal, and other methods for remote sensing applied to geologic problems; instrumental design and data analysis. (B) planets; (C) volcanoes. Pre: 666 or consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Cosmochemistry (3)
desc: Formation and evolution of planets as astrophysical objects, geologic bodies, and abodes of life; current understanding from studies of the Solar System, star formation, meteorites, exoplanets; theory of formation and dynamics; atmospheres, oceans, habitability, biosignatures. Pre: 325 or CHEM 351 (or equivalent); or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Planetary Surfaces (3)
desc: Comparative geology of terrestrial planets (moon, Mars, Mercury, Venus, and Earth); impact cratering, volcanism, geomorphology; remote sensing; manned and unmanned space exploration. Pre: 601, ASTR 630; or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Astrochemistry–A Molecular Approach (3)
desc: Formation of astrobiologically important molecules and their precursors in the interstellar medium and in our solar system: first principles and latest trends. Pre: consent. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as ASTR 657 and CHEM 657)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Groundwater Modeling (3)
desc: Introduction to the finite-difference method; steady-state and transient groundwater flow in saturated and unsaturated media; applications to groundwater recharge and aquifer evaluation. A-F only. Pre: CEE 627 or consent. (Cross-listed as CEE 623)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Groundwater Contamination (3)
desc: Principles of groundwater chemistry; chemical evolution in natural groundwater flow systems; sources of contamination; mass transport processes; hydrochemical behavior of contaminants. Pre: 455.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geomagnetism and Cosmic Magnetism (3)
desc: Magnetic fields of Earth, planets, stars, and galaxies; dynamo theories; paleomagnetism; terrestrial and lunar rock magnetism; planetary, regional, and local geomagnetic sounding. Pre: consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Sedimentary Geochemistry (3)
desc: Geochemical thermodynamics and kinetics and their use in interpreting the origin of sediments, sedimentary rocks, and natural waters over a range of pressure-temperature conditions. Pre: CHEM 171, or CHEM 161 and CHEM 162; PHYS 152; and MATH 242 or MATH 252A; and consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as OCN 644)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Elemental Composition Changes (2)
desc: Changes in the chemical composition of meteorites, bulk Earth, Earth’s mantle and crust, sedimentary rocks, hydrosphere and biosphere, and underlying principles. Pre: consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as OCN 642)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Origin of Sedimentary Rocks (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Environment of deposition and subsequent diagenesis of modern and ancient sediments. Petrogenesis of siliciclastic, carbonate and orthochemical rocks. Sedimentology, sedimentary petrography and geochemistry. Repeatable one time. Pre: consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as OCN 641)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Coastal Geochemistry (3)
desc: Geochemistry at the land-ocean interface: coastal hydrology, subterranean estuaries and coastal mixing and their importance in governing the distribution of selected radiotracers, trace metals and nutrients. Combined lecture-lab with field trips and group projects. Pre: CHEM 162, and MATH 241 or MATH 251A; or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Stable Isotope Biogeochemistry (3)
desc: Stable isotope geochemistry applied to questions of biogeochemical cycling in the oceans, sediment diagenesis, paleoceanography, environmental geochemistry and ecology. Pre: 325 or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Earth System Science and Global Change (3)
desc: Global view of the planet and how it functions as an integrated unit. Biogeochemical processes, dynamics, and cycles, and analysis of natural and human-induced environmental change. Chemical history of ocean-atmospheric-sediment system and co-evolution of the biota. Repeatable one time. Pre: BS in environmentally related science or one year of chemistry, physics, and calculus; or consent. (Cross-listed as OCN 638)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Seismology (3)
desc: Elasticity, wave equations, body waves, surface waves, free oscillations, seismometry, seismogram interpretation, tectonics, inversion, source theory, and waveform modeling. Pre: 600 or consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geophysics–Gravity, Magnetics, and Heat Transfer (3)
desc: Fundamental theory and practical applications of the use of gravity, magnetics, and heat conduction to probing the structure of the Earth; heat transfer via mantle convection is a major control on Earth’s internal structure. Pre: (with a minimum grade of B-) for PHYS 170, PHYS 272, and MATH 307 or ERTH 312 (or equivalent). (Spring only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geophysics–Solid, Fluid, and Wave Mechanics (3)
desc: Continuum mechanics in geophysics, as applied to the deformation of Earth materials (elastic, viscous, viscoelastic, and plastic deformations) and seismic wave propagation (body waves, surface waves, anisotropy, and attenuation). Pre: (with a minimum grade of B-) for PHYS 170, PHYS 272, and MATH 307 or ERTH 312 (or equivalent). (Fall only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Numerical Modeling of Physical Systems (3)
desc: Finite difference, finite element, and other modeling techniques applied to geological and geophysical problems. Physical modeling of heat flow, molecular diffusion, solidification and melting, deformation, fluid flow, wave propagation, and other phenomena. Repeatable one time. A-F only. (Once a year)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Advanced Environmental Geochemistry (3)
desc: Theory and applications of contaminant/pollutant distribution in the hydrosphere-geosphere-biosphere-atmosphere system and remediation methods. Topics include aqueous geochemistry, organic, inorganic, gas phase and isotope chemistry of environmental contaminants. Pre: 325 or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Electron Microprobe Analysis (2)
desc: Combined lecture-lab on the principles of geochemical analysis by electron microprobe and X-ray fluorescence. Hands-on experience with the electron microprobe. Required to operate the UH electron microprobe. Pre: 301 or consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Coastal Geology (3)
desc: Geological history and geologic framework of the Hawaiian shoreline. Modern climate change, paleoclimate, focus on sea level change. Modern coastal management and problems in the coastal environment. Coastal planning. Repeatable one time, credit earned one time. (Spring only) (Cross-listed as SUST 627)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: How to Write a Scientific Paper (3)
desc: Designed for students who have collected data and want to know how to publish their work in a scientific journal. Covers the essential parts of paper preparation and submission. ERTH students only. A-F only. Pre: consent. (Alt. years: fall)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Literate Programming With R and RStudio (3)
desc: Literate programming with R, RStudio, and R Markdown for data analysis and research. Introduction to Matlab for rapid modeling. Emphasis on the preparation of research papers for scholarly publication in the Earth and environmental sciences. Pre: competence in basic differential and integral calculus. (Fall only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Advanced Field Study (V)
desc: Shipboard and land-based projects. Repeatable eight times. Pre: consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Introduction to Statistics and Data Analysis (3)
desc: Exploratory data analysis, error propagation, probability theory and statistics, curve fitting, regression, sequence and spectral analysis, multivariate analysis, and analysis of directional data. Credit earned only one time for either 413 or 613. Pre: 250 and MATH 242 (or concurrent), or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Accelerated Introduction to Earth Sciences I (3)
desc: Lecture presenting a rapid-paced survey of earth sciences for graduate students. Includes origin of the Solar System, tectonics, volcanology, whole-earth composition, phase transformations, petrology (igneous, metamorphic, and sedimentary), historical geology, and hydrology. Saturday field trips. (Fall only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Graduate Seminar (1)
desc: Seminar in which students present a 15- to 20-minute talk on their research or a related topic. Meets once a week with two to three talks per meeting. Graduate students are required to register for this course once per year. Repeatable eight times.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Graduate Teaching Geology (V)
desc: For ERTH graduate students who lead, under faculty supervision, a scheduled class in Geology and Geophysics. The instructor will define the student’s responsibilities when offering ERTH 609, and these responsibilities must be met for a passing grade. As the consent to take the class must also be granted by the department chair, the chair will also review the responsibilities required by the instructor. ERTH graduate students only. CR/NC only. Pre: consent of instructor and department chair.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Isotopes and Trace Elements (3)
desc: Principles of radiogenic and stable isotope, and trace element geochemistry as applied to igneous petrology, mantle dynamics, plate tectonics, and terrestrial evolution. Pre: 302 and 325. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Submarine Volcanoes (3)
desc: Seminar exploring different aspects of submarine effusive and explosive volcanism, hydrothermal activity, and volcano-hosted ecosystems. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 300 or consent. (Alt.years: fall)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Current Events in Volcanology (1)
desc: Discussion of active areas of volcanism and new publications on volcanology. Repeatable four times. Pre: 300 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Lava Flow Rheology and Morphology (3)
desc: Effusion eruptions: from eruption to final flow form. Includes: rheology, effusion rate, heat loss, and field measurements, followed by inflation, flow forms, lava lakes, domes, flow hazard and modeling. Field trips to Kilauea and Makapuu. A-F only. Pre: 300 or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Disaster Science: Understanding Hazards and Disasters (3)
desc: Combined lecture/ discussion focusing on the scientific understanding of the forces and processes underlying natural hazards; and human attempts to respond to these through mitigation and planning. Pre: PLAN 670 or consent. (Once a year) (Cross-listed as PLAN 671)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Petrology of Ocean Lithosphere (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Petrogenesis of the oceanic lithosphere, including mantle processes and rocks from mid-ocean ridges, seamounts, oceanic hotspots, back-arc basins, and intra-oceanic arcs. Pre: 302 or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Theoretical Petrology (3)
desc: Derivation of phase diagrams from basic thermodynamics principles. Equilibria of natural silicate systems. Crystal chemistry, kinetics, diffusion, etc., Applied to igneous and metamorphic petrology. Pre: 302, 325, and CHEM 351 (or concurrent); or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Explosive Volcanism (3)
desc: Explosive volcanic eruptions: from causes to consequences. Review of current physical volcanology including ascent and fragmentation of magma, transport and deposition processes in pyroclastic eruptions, volcanic crisis management and volcanic eruption scenarios. Seven-day field trip. A-F only. Pre: 300 or consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Equations of Geophysics (3)
desc: Least-square approximation of functions by orthogonal series; potential, wave heat flow equations; boundary value problems; Bessel Hankel functions, spherical harmonics, potential theory, plane waves, spherical waves; emphasis on geophysics application. Pre: MATH 244 or MATH 253A, PHYS 400, or consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Earth and Planetary Sciences Workshops (V)
desc: Designed for in-service school professionals to learn new approaches and concepts in the fields of earth and planetary sciences. Repeatable for credit. Credits earned in these courses cannot be applied for graduate degrees.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Undergraduate Thesis (3)
desc: Directed research in which the student carries out a scientific project of small to moderate scope with one or more chosen advisors. The student must complete a document in the style of a scientific journal article. Repeatable one time. Pre: consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Planetary Geology (3)
desc: Comparative geology of the terrestrial planets (moon, Mars, Mercury, Venus, and Earth); impact cratering, volcanism, tectonism, geomorphology, weathering; manned and unmanned space exploration. Pre: any 100-level ERTH course.
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geospatial Information (3)
desc: Combined lecture/lab covering the collection, analysis and use of geospatially registered field data. Pre: (200 or 201) or equivalent. (Fall only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geological Remote Sensing (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Combined lecture-lab on the concepts behind, geologic uses for, and techniques of satellite and airborne remote sensing. Lab work will consist of computer image processing. Field trips. Open to non-majors. Pre: 200 or 201 or consent. (Alt. years: Spring)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Hydrogeology (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Occurrence, characteristics, movement, quality, development, and contamination of water in the Earth’s crust.
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Engineering Geology (3)
desc: Solutions of geotechnical problems by geologists and engineers through recognition, characterization, evaluation, and assessment of geologic processes that impact people, engineering structures, and engineering operations. Group format. ERTH, GEOL, and CEE majors only. Junior standing and higher. Pre: consent. (Spring only)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Earthquakes and Crustal Deformation (3)
desc: Earthquakes and crustal deformation through modern seismological and geodetic observations; elastic properties of rocks, seismic waves, causes, detection, and location of earthquakes; crustal motions of the earthquake cycle; tsunami generation, liquefaction, and planetary observations. Pre: MATH 241 and PHYS 170, or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Plate Tectonics (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Quantitative geometrical analysis techniques of plate tectonics theory; instantaneous and finite rotation poles; triple-junction analysis; plate boundary stresses. Pre: 200 or consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as OCN 444)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Environmental Geochemistry (3)
desc: Theory and applications of contaminant/pollutant distribution in the hydrosphere-geosphere-biosphere-atmosphere system, remediation methods, prevention, industrial/agricultural best practices. Topics include aqueous geochemistry, organic, inorganic, gas phase, and ecosystem impacts of environmental contaminants. Pre: CHEM 161 and CHEM 162, or consent. (Spring only) (Cross-listed as SUST 425)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Marine Geology (3)
desc: Sediments, structure, geophysics, geochemistry, history of ocean basins and margins. Pre: 200 and 302 or consent. (Cross-listed as OCN 423)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Beaches, Reefs, and Climate Change (3)
desc:
Global and local aspects of climate change and paleoclimate; beach and reef processes and response to climate change; management of coastal environments; field study local sites. Repeatable one time. Junior standing or higher, or consent. (Cross-listed as SUST 
427)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Introduction to Statistics and Data Analysis (3)
desc: Exploratory data analysis, error propagation, probability theory and statistics, curve fitting, regression, sequence and spectral analysis, multivariate analysis, and analysis of directional data. Pre: 250 and MATH 242 (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Undergraduate Seminar (2)
desc: Gain professional training and practical experience giving scientific presentations emphasizing Earth and planetary sciences, including analysis of associated ethical issues. Grading is distributed 60/40 between three oral communication assignments and related ethics content. Pre: 200 or 201 or consent
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Energy and Mineral Resources (3)
desc: Lecture and discussion on the origin, distribution and exploitation of fossil fuels, renewable energy resources and ore deposits. Coverage and detail will depend partly on student interest and background. Pre: consent.
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Natural Disasters: Geoethics and the Layman (3)
desc: Evaluates ethical practice of geoscience as it relates to studies of natural disasters that result from geological and meteorological phenomena and the means that earth scientists interact with the laymen. Pre: 101, 103, 104, or 170. (Once a year)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Remote Compositional Analysis: Spectroscopy, Mineralogy, and Geochemistry of Planetary Surfaces (4)
desc: Essential techniques for remote compositional analysis of planets; understanding spectroscopy, mineralogy, and geochemistry of planetary surfaces. Comparative studies of fundamental planetary science phenomena. Planetary surface science discoveries. Sustainability of planetary environments. Repeatable one time. Pre: (101 or 105 or 107 or ASTR 150; and CHEM 161; and MATH 241 and 242 and PHYS 272) with a minimum grade of C+; or consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Hawaiian Geology (3)
desc: Consists of lectures, discussions, and field trips on the geologic processes and geologic history of the Hawaiian islands, with emphasis on writing communication. Pre: 302 and 303; or consent.
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Introduction to mineral Physics (3)
desc: Scientific study of the materials that make up the Earth. Properties of minerals on micro- and macro-scales; their properties and behavior. Pre: 302 and PHYS 272, or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Directed Reading (V)
desc: Directed reading in earth sciences. Repeatable up to six credits. Junior/ Senior standing only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Undergraduate Internship (V)
desc: Experiential approach to earth science; students serve as interns to field professionals; responsibilities include supervised field work. Open to undergraduate SOEST majors. Repeatable one time. CR/NC only. Pre: junior/senior standing and consent.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geochemistry (3)
desc: Theory and applications of chemical principles and chemical analysis to Earth, ocean and environmental sciences; chemistry of hydrosphere-geosphere-biosphere system, origin/ differentiation of Earth/Solar system, volcanic processes, natural radioactivity, organic/inorganic chemistry. Pre: 200 or 201, and MATH 241 or MATH 251A, and CHEM 162 (or concurrent); or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Advanced Mathematics for Scientists and Engineers I (3)
desc: Advanced mathematical methods with emphasis on application to the earth and ocean sciences and engineering. Topics include linear algebra, vector calculus, ordinary differential equations, and numerical methods. Pre: MATH 242 or consent. (Cross-listed as OCN 312)
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Sedimentary Processes and Environments (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Modern and past terrestrial and oceanic processes and environments that form sediments and sedimentary rocks, and their interpretation in Earth history. Incorporates properties, principles and applications of sedimentology, sedimentary petrology, geochemistry and stratigraphy.  Repeatable one time. Pre: 200 or 201 or consent, and 333 or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: DP DY Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Work of Water (3)
desc: Physical properties of water, geological aspects of surface water and ground water occurrence, surface water and groundwater resources, use, and problems. Pre: 200 or 201, or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: DP DY Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geological Field Methods (3)
desc: Methods used in geological investigations in the field. Eight hours on Saturday in the field. Pre: 333; or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Physics of Earth and Planets (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Essentials of geophysics: application of physics understanding Earth, planetary, and solar dynamics. Topics include heat flow, gravity, geodesy, electromagnetism, seismology. Applications to core and mantle dynamics, plate tectonics, volcanoes, hydrology, environmental concerns, and archaeology. Pre: 250, 303, 313, MATH 242, and PHYS 272, PHYS 272L; or consent.
metadata: DP DY Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Natural Hazards & Geomechanics (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Dynamic behavior of Earth’s surface, physical processes driving geohazards, and the risks posed to society. Theory, practical techniques, and data visualization to measure, analyze, and interpret hazards and implications.  Pre: ERTH 101 or 103 or 104 or 106 or 130, MATH 215 or MATH  241 or MATH 251A, and PHYS 151 or PHYS 170; or consent.
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Igneous Petrology (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Survey of composition, classification, and occurrence of igneous rocks. Hand-specimen identification and optical petrography of igneous rocks. Development of critical thinking and writing skills. Pre: 301 or consent.
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Mineralogy (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Introduction to the chemistry, crystalline structure, geologic occurrence, and physical properties of minerals. Development of critical thinking and writing skills. Pre: 200 or 201 and (CHEM 162/162L or CHEM 171/171L). or consent.
metadata: DP DY Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Physical Volcanology (3)
desc: Volcanic eruptions and their consequences. Includes models for volcanic eruptions including explosive eruptions and lava flows, monitoring of active volcanoes, evaluation and impacts of volcanic hazards, and mitigation of volcanic risk. Field trips. Normally fall. ERTH and GEOL majors or consent. Pre: (200 or 201) with a minimum grade of B+ or consent
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Scientific Programming (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Introduction to solving scientific problems by computer programming. Overview of the MatLab programming language and environment. Emphasis placed on good style, logical reasoning, and applied mathematics. Pre: MATH 241 (or concurrent).
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geological Inquiry (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Origin and age of the solar system and earth: interior of the earth; plate tectonics and records of biological evolution and past environments. Development of critical thinking and writing skills. Pre: 101L and one of 101, 103, 104, 106, or 130; or consent. 101L may be taken concurrently. ERTH and GEOL majors only. Consent required for all non-majors.
metadata: DP DY Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Introduction to Directed Research (V)
desc: Lower division reading and research in any area of ERTH under the direction of a faculty member. Repeatable four times or up to six credits. CR/NC only.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Physical Geology (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Structure, composition and evolution of Earth; processes responsible for formation, deformation and transformation of rocks; plate tectonics. Emphasis on quantitative methods, problem solving and critical thinking to geology. Laboratory and field trips required.
metadata: DP DY Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Introduction to Quantitative Earth and Environmental Science (3)
desc: Introduction to pre-calculus math and physics applied to Earth and environmental science. Students work on real-world problems and engage in participatory learning. Preparatory for classes in calculus and physics. Pre: MATH 134, 161, or MATH assessment exam (with score required for MATH 140X). (Fall only) (Cross-listed as ATMO 150 and OCN 150)
metadata: FQ Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Natural Disasters and Human History (3)
desc: Examines how natural hazards have affected the course of human culture and societies from pre-history to the present in Hawai‘i/Oceania, Asia, Africa, Europe, and the Americas. A-F only. (Spring only)
metadata: FGC Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geological Hazards (3)
desc: Introductory course covering the causes of, and effects from, earthquakes, tsunami, volcanic eruptions, landslides, rockfalls, and other natural geologic phenomena. Open to non-majors. Field trips. (Alt. years)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Introduction to Volcanoes (3)
desc: Examines the origin and classification of volcanoes, volcanic eruptions, and volcanic deposits. Includes the history of volcanic studies, myths, and legends. Emphasis on volcanic eruptions, eruptive products, volcanic hazards, and risk management. (Spring only)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Solar System Studio (4)
desc: Explore the wonders of the Solar System through hands-on experience of science. Will study satellite images, evaluate planetary surface observations, analyze data of objects in our Solar System, conduct experiments, and communicate their findings. Repeatable one time. A-F only.
metadata: DP DY Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Humans and the Environment (3)
desc: Prepares students to make decisions such as where to build/buy a house, sustainable use of natural resources, and what environmental actions relevant to society and Earth’s ecosystem are appropriate on a local and global scale. A-F only. (Cross-listed as SUST 116)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Voyage through the Solar System (3)
desc: An illustrated voyage through the Solar System based on recent scientific results. The class highlights the origin, evolution, and current knowledge of the eight planets, their moons, asteroids, comets, and one star, the Sun. Field trip. (Cross-listed as ASTR 150)
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Volcanoes in the Sea (3)
desc: Lecture with field trips covering the manner in which geological conditions, resources, and events have affected past and present circum-Pacific societies.
metadata: Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Geology of the Hawaiian Islands (3)
desc: Hawaiian geology and geologic processes: origin of Hawaiian islands, volcanism, rocks and minerals, landforms, stream and coastal processes, landslides, earthquakes and tsunamis, groundwater, geologic and environmental hazards. Field trip.
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Quantifying Global and Environmental Change (3)
desc: Introductory mathematical approaches to quantifying key aspects of global and environmental change. Includes data analysis, graphical representation and modeling of population growth, greenhouse gas emissions and fate, sustainable resource utilization, and sea level change. A-F only. (Spring only) (Cross-listed as SUST 113)
metadata: FQ Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Dynamic Earth Laboratory (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Hands-on study of minerals, rocks, and topographic maps. Examine volcanism, hydrology, coastal processes and hazards, geologic time and earthquakes. Field trips to investigate landslides, beaches and O‘ahu geology. A-F only.
metadata: DY Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: ERTH
title: Dynamic Earth (3)
desc: The natural physical environment; the landscape; rocks and minerals, rivers and oceans; volcanism, earthquakes, and other processes inside the Earth; effects of human use of the Earth and its resources. Field trip. (Cross-listed as SUST 101) DP
metadata: DP Earth Sciences (ERTH) School of Ocean and Earth Science & Technology

subject: GEO
title: Dissertation Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Society and Space (3)
desc: Advanced seminar on social production of space. Topics include spatial metaphor in social theory; western spatiality from the renaissance through the enlightenment, modernity and post modernity; and geography of the body, home, landscape, and nation. Pre: graduate standing or consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Research Seminar: Social Geography (3)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Research Seminar: Agricultural Geography (3)
desc: (Cross-listed as SUST 763)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Research Seminar: Remote Sensing (3)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Research Seminar: Cartography (3)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Research Seminar: Conservation (3)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Research Seminar: Cultural Geography (3)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Research Seminar: Resource Management (3)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Research Seminar: Biogeography (3)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Seminar: Political Geography (3)
desc: Topics vary; may include borders, boundaries, geopolitics, homelands, identity politics, nations and nationalism, social categorization, the sovereign state system, territoriality. Repeatable one time. Pre: graduate standing or consent. (Once a year)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Seminar: Resource Management in Asia-Pacific (3)
desc: Examination of resource management problems in Asia and the Pacific. Problems of resource use—agriculture, forestry, energy, minerals, ocean, air quality. Pre: graduate status.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: (Alpha) Special Topics (V)
desc: Study and discussion of significant topics, problems. (B) regional and locational analysis; (C) geography, environment, and culture; (H) Multi-objective decision analysis. Repeatable two times.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Geomorphology (3)
desc: Current understanding of geomorphological concepts, processes, and the dynamic relationship between human landscape modification and system response. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Directed Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times. CR/NC only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Research Design/Methods in Geography (3)
desc: Elements of research design, practical field experience, exposure to research and ideologies, broad exposure to heritage and ethos of the discipline. Pre: 695.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Concepts and Theories in Geography (3)
desc: Concepts, theory, models. Geographic approaches to spatial and environmental problems. Required of entering graduate students unless waived by department. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Technology and Natural Risks Methods of Analysis (3)
desc: Survey of tools for evaluating risks to human health from technological and natural hazards. Historical and international context of methods.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Faculty Seminar Series (1)
desc: Graduate seminar required of all department MA students and PhD students. Single credit course in which faculty present ongoing research in their fields. Pre: consent. Co-requisite: 695.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Geospatial Analysis of Natural Resource Data (3)
desc: The application of geostatistics to estimate spatial dependence to improve soil and regional sampling; provide insight into underlying soil, geographic, and geologic process, and to provide quantitative scaling up of point measurements to fields, regions, and watersheds. State-space modeling also will be included. A-F only. Pre: 388 or ZOOL 631; or consent. (Cross-listed as TPSS 680)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Seminar in Geography of the Pacific (3)
desc: Investigation of geographic problems of Melanesia, Micronesia, Polynesia. Repeatable with consent of instructor. Pre: consent
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Seminar in Geography of Southeast Asia (3)
desc: Repeatable with consent of instructor. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Community-based Natural Resource Management (3)
desc: Concepts and theories of community, resource access, and governance. Practical challenges to CBNRM in contemporary political economy. Graduate students only. (Cross-listed as PLAN 639)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Environment and Development (3)
desc: Theories and practice of development; how changing development paradigms shape different ideas concerning the environment and the management of natural resources; emerging debates in development and environment in post-modern era. (Cross-listed as PLAN 637)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Seafood in Southeast Asia (3)
desc: Seafood production in Southeast Asia, including both regional fisheries and aquaculture. Case studies used to illustrate challenges to the implementation of sustainable seafood production and emerging approaches, such as community supported seafood. (Cross-listed as ASAN 633)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Advanced Environmental Impact Assessment (3)
desc: Theory and practice of environmental impact assessment. Policy and planning frameworks supporting environmental assessment in the U.S. and abroad. Cumulative environmental effects and strategic environmental assessment. (Cross-listed as PLAN 622)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Coastal Planning and Management (3)
desc: Theory and practice of coastal planning and management in the U.S. and abroad. Case studies investigate topics such as coastal land conservation, marine protected areas, coastal hazards, fisheries, and aquaculture. Repeatable one time with consent. (Crosslisted as PLAN 623)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Theories and Policies of Development (3)
desc: Will critically examine what constitutes progress, advancement, or betterment in this highly uneven world, where inter-regional, inter-class, inter-group, and inter-gender differences in development are expanding. Graduate standing only. A-F only. (Fall only)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Human Environment Systems (3)
desc: Role and potential of systems science in analysis of human environment interaction, especially resource management. Framework and methodology for problem structuring; overview of techniques. Pre: graduate standing or advanced undergraduate standing with consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Cultural Geographies of Tourism (3)
desc: Social and cultural analysis of tourism practices, with emphasis on Hawai‘i, Asia and the Pacific. Tourism in relation to consumer culture, transnational flows of people and images, post-colonial politics, performance and identity formation. (Cross-listed as ANTH 610)
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Seminar in Climatology (3)
desc: Methods of determining energy budget and water balance; applications in agriculture, hydrology, climatic classifications. Theory of climatic change. Bibliography. Pre: 300 or 400 or 401 or 402 or 405 or ATMO 303 or ATMO 310 or ATMO 320; or consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Directed Research (V)
desc: Geography majors conduct research under faculty supervision on a topic of their choice. Minimum GPA of 3.0 and consent. Repeatable two times, up to six credits. GEO majors only. Senior standing only.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Capstone Undergraduate Seminar (3)
desc: Current and historical geographic literature provides a background for local and global issues. Through discussion, written reviews, and research reports, the geographic perspective in modern life will be explored. Pre: senior GEO major.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Practicum in Geography (V)
desc: Internship in applied geography under professional and faculty supervision. Field placement integrated with academic study. Repeatable up to six credit hours maximum. Pre: senior major and consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Senior Thesis (3)
desc: Preparation of research paper under individual faculty supervision. Recommended for admission to graduate program. Pre: senior GEO major and consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: GIS for Environmental Sciences (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 2-hr lab) Applications of GIS technologies to solve real-world problems in natural and environmental sciences. Research project, lab. Pre: 388 or consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Web Mapping (3)
desc: (3 2-hr Lab) Introduction to interactive web mapping techniques for sharing and visualizing various forms of geospatial data. Requires basic knowledge about GIS. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Field Mapping (3)
desc: Techniques for field measurement and recording of cultural and physical data. Field sketching, Brunton surveying, plane table mapping, oblique photo compilation, topographic mapping, and representation of field data. Pre: junior standing or higher, or consent. (Cross-listed as ANTH 471)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: 3D Mapping and Analysis (3)
desc: Environmental mapping and analysis using 3-dimensional geographical data acquired from high resolution remote sensing systems. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. (Spring only)
metadata: DY College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Remote Sensing (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Introduction to the principles of remote sensing and image processing skills. Topics include electromagnetic spectrum, sensors, aerial photo and satellite imagery interpretation, geometric and radiometric correction, digital image processing. Research project, lab. Pre: 370 or consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Topics in Geography (3)
desc: Selected topics in geography not offered in the regular geography curriculum. Pre: 101 or 102 or 151, or consent.
metadata: College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Environment and Society in China (3)
desc: Explores the relationship between environment and society in the Chinese society, including both traditional nature-culture connections and modern human-environmental issues. Examines China’s long-range cultural change, environmental transformations, and modern development challenges. Pre: 102 or 151, or consent.
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Geography of Peace and War (3)
desc: Geographical factors underlying conflict in the world. Pre: sophomore standing or higher, or consent. (Cross-listed as PACE 436)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Political Geography of Oceans (3)
desc: The geopolitics of the oceans and the law of the sea as applied to regions of conflict and cooperation in marine resource development and preservation. Focus on Indo-West Pacific, South China Sea, Arctic Ocean. Pre: junior standing or higher, or consent.
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Tea and Culture (3)
desc: Examines cultural practices of tea in different parts of the world, focusing on history and culture of tea in China, Japan, and England. Also includes changing technologies and economies of tea worldwide. Junior standing or higher.
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Environment, Resources and Society (3)
desc: Human interaction with the environment. How market, property institution, and technological change affect the environment. Epistemological basis of environmental policies. Debates on controversial environmental issues. Pre: 102, 151, or consent. (Cross-listed as SUST 426)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Geographies of Popular Culture (3)
desc: Examines contemporary geographical debates related to concepts of discourse, identity, space/place, power, representation, and popular culture. Considers various landscapes of popular culture and how popular culture mediate a sense of place, geopolitics, and identity formation. Pre: junior standing or higher, or consent.
metadata: DH College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Regional Analysis (3)
desc: Spatial dynamics and environmental implications of urban and rural development. Concepts of regions, process of regional development, patterns of spatial interaction, and theoretical bases for development strategies; emphasis on Hawai‘i. Pre: junior standing or higher, or consent.
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Marine Policy (3)
desc: Introduction to the law and policies concerning the marine environment, commerce and security. Role of science, law and politics in historical and current policies for maritime trades, navigation safety, marine resources, and marine exploration. Pre: junior standing or higher, or consent.
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Agriculture, Food and Society (3)
desc: Examines historical and contemporary development of the global agro-food systems. The impacts of technological, political and economic changes to food security, environment and development. Open to non-majors. Pre: junior standing or higher, or consent. (Cross-listed as SUST 423)
metadata: DS College of Social Sciences Geography and Environment (GEO)

subject: GEO
title: Urban Geography (3)
desc: Origins, functions, and internal structure of cities. Problems of urban settlement, growth, decay, adaptation, and planning in different cultural and historical settings. Dynamics of urban land use and role of policies and perceptions in shaping towns and cities. Pre: 102 or 151 or 330, or consent. (Cross-listed as PLAN 421)
