desc: Introduction to career development as it pertains to engineering and business industry; client relations, networking, job skills, career assessment and direction. Repeatable one time. (Fall only)
metadata: College of Engineering Engineering (ENGR)

subject: ENGR
title: Sophomore Vertically Integrated Project (V)
desc: Team-based research project for sophomore-level students. Project topic varies by instructor. Students are expected to continue working in this project as a junior (ENGR 396). Sophomore standing or higher. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as ECE 296)
metadata: College of Engineering Engineering (ENGR)

subject: ENGR
title: Personal Development for Effective Teams (3)
desc: Exploration and application of basic leadership theories and processes which foster personal and interpersonal development via cognitive experiential classroom methods and mentoring relationships with experienced peer leaders. (Cross-listed as IS 250)
metadata: College of Engineering Engineering (ENGR)

subject: ENGR
title: Freshman Vertically Integrated Project (V)
desc: Team-based research project for freshman-level students. Project topic varies by instructor. Students are expected to continue working in this project as a sophomore (ENGR 296). Repeatable one time, up to six credits. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Engineering (ENGR)

subject: ENGR
title: Introduction to Technology-Based Innovation and Entrepreneurship (3)
desc: Introduces modern tools for launching technology-based new ventures. Teams of students engage in term projects to learn design thinking, business model generation, product development, rapid prototyping, customer validation, and pitching to investors. ENGR and BUS majors only. Freshmen only. A-F only. (Spring only) (Cross-listed as BUS 102)
metadata: College of Engineering Engineering (ENGR)

subject: ENGR
title: Introduction to Engineering (3)
desc: Topics include the engineering disciplines, the development of problem solving and technical communication skills, the design process and analysis methods using a team design project, and introduction to programming in Matlab for engineering applications. ENGR majors only. Freshman standing only.
metadata: College of Engineering Engineering (ENGR)

subject: ENGR
title: Engineering Freshman Seminar (1)
desc: Overview of the engineering field, the different disciplines, and opportunities. Success strategies for studying engineering. Repeatable one time. Engineering majors only. CR/NC only.
metadata: College of Engineering Engineering (ENGR)

subject: ECE
title: Dissertation Research (V)
desc: Research for doctoral dissertation. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: candidacy for PhD in electrical and computer engineering.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Directed Instruction (V)
desc: Student assists in classroom instruction under direction and close supervision of faculty member. CR/NC only. Pre: admission to PhD candidacy.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Research for master’s thesis. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: candidacy for MS in electrical and computer engineering.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Directed Reading or Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times. CR/NC only. Pre: graduate standing and consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: (Alpha) Special Topics in Electrical Engineering (3)
desc: Content will reflect special interests of visiting/permanent faculty. (B) artificial intelligence; (C) circuits; (D) communications; (E) computer hardware; (F) computer software; (H) control; (I) devices; (J) fields; (K) power. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Biomedical Signal Processing and Analysis (3)
desc: Biomedical signals, digital filters and filter banks, spike train analysis, time-scale and time-frequency representations, nonlinear techniques, Lomb’s algorithm and the Hilbert transform, modeling, Volterra series, Wiener series, Poisson-Wiener series, multichannel data, causality. CE, ECE, ME, ICS majors only and any graduate student in JABSOM who has a suitable technical background. Pre: 415 or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Biomedical Microdevices (3)
desc: Design and fabrication of micro- and nanodevices for biomedical applications. Topics include micro- and nanoscale physics, microfluidic physics and microfluidic devices, and micro- and nanoscale fabrication techniques. ENG majors only. A-F only. Pre: 324 or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Biosensors and Bioelectronics (3)
desc: Advanced topics in the design of biological detection technologies. Topics include fundamentals of electrochemistry, electrochemical biosensors, DNA and protein biochips, and bioelectronics for bio-signal conditioning and processing. Pre: 324 and 326, or consent. (Once a year)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Biomedical Engineering Systems (3)
desc: Systems analysis and electronic instrumentation methods in biomedicine. Network and control-loop modeling, computer simulation, biological transducers, and analysis of electronic and physiological systems. Pre: 326, 326L, and 371; or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Computational Techniques in Electromagnetics (3)
desc: Develop comprehensive understanding of computations techniques for solving engineering electromagnetic problems formulated in terms of integral or differential equations. Eigenvalue problems, radiation, and electromagnetics scattering problems will be discussed and computer programming is required. ECE, BE, and CENG majors only. A-F only. Pre: 471 (with a minimum grade of B) or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Microwave Engineering (3)
desc: Advanced RF and microwave circuit design for wireless applications. Pre: 473 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Electromagnetic Theory and Applications (3)
desc: Solutions of Maxwell’s equations and applications to radiation and propagation of electromagnetic waves. Pre: 372 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Telecommunication Networks (3)
desc: Telecommunication-network architecture; switching, broadcast, and wireless networks; protocols, interfaces, routing, flow- and congestion-control techniques; intelligent network architecture; service creation capabilities; multimedia, voice, data, and video networks and services. Pre: 468 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer Systems (3)
desc: Modern operating system software, process communication, distributed systems, device drivers. Software development and maintenance, integration of software packages. Projects reflecting special interests of faculty. Pre: 461 and 468.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer Architecture I (3)
desc: Models of computation, high-performance processors, pipelined machines, RISC processors, VLIW, superscalar and fine-grain parallel machines. Data-flow architectures. Hardware/software tradeoffs. CECE, ECE, and ME majors only. Pre: 461. (Cross-listed as ICS 660)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Robust Control (3)
desc: Multivariable frequency response design, signals and systems, linear fractional transformations, LQG Control, Full Information H-infinity Controller Synthesis, H-infinity filtering, model reduction, the four-block problem. Pre: 453 and 650.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Optimal Control Systems (3)
desc: Optimal controls introduced through parametric optimization, calculus of variations, Euler-Lagrange and Hamilton-Jacobi equations, Pontryagin’s maximum principle, minimum-time and minimum-fuel problems, dynamic programming, applications. Pre: 650 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Nonlinear Control Systems (3)
desc: Digital simulations, phase-plane analysis, limit cycles and amplitude bounds, Lyapunov’s theorem, circle criterion of stability, lure systems, Popov’s stability theorem. Pre: 650.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Linear System Theory (3)
desc: State space theory of linear systems, controllability, observability, stability, irreducible realizations. Pre: 452.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Error-Control Coding II (3)
desc: Convolutional codes, Viterbi algorithm, coded modulation, multistage decoding, concatenated coded modulation, probabilistic decoding, turbo codes, low density parity check codes and iterative decoding. Pre: 648.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Error-Control Coding I (3)
desc: Linear block codes, soft and hard decision decodings, correction of random errors, cyclic codes, BCH codes, Reed-Solomon codes, majority logic decodable codes, burst-error correcting codes, concatenated codes. Pre: MATH 311 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Source Coding (3)
desc: Theory and applications of source coding, rate-distortion theory, companding, lattice coding, tree coding, trellis coding, entropy-constrained coding, asymptotic theory, predictive and differential encoding, combined source/channel coding, vector quantization. Pre: 640.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Information Theory (3)
desc: Measure of information, coding for discrete sources, discrete memoryless channels and capacity, the noisy channel coding theorem, source coding with fidelity criterion, rate-distortion theory, multiuser channels. Pre: 640.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Machine Learning (3)
desc: Learning theory, pattern recognition and regression; gradient based algorithms and least square algorithms; Kernel methods; Bayesian learning algorithms; ensemble learning and boosting; principal component analysis; independent component analysis, and clustering; reinforcement learning and approximate dynamic programming. ECE, ME, ICS, MATH majors only. Pre: 342.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer Communication Networks (3)
desc: Fundamentals of computer communication networks including modeling, performance evaluation, routing, flow control, local area networks, distributed algorithms, and optimization algorithms. Pre: 342, MATH 471; or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Communication System Performance (3)
desc: Fundamental performance limits, signal detection and estimation, modulation, intersymbol interference, equalization adaptive filtering, sequence detection, synchronization, fading multipath channels, spread spectrum. Pre: 640.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Detection and Estimation Theory (3)
desc: Fundamentals of signal detection and estimation theory. Hypothesis testing, parametric and nonparametric detection, sequential detection, parametric estimation, linear estimation, robust detection and estimation, and applications to communication systems. Pre: 640.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Queueing Theory (3)
desc: Poisson, Markov, and renewal processes, M/G/1 queue, G/M/1 queue, queueing networks, simulation, and performance evaluation of computer systems and communication networks. ECE, ICS, MATH majors only. Pre: 342, 640 (or concurrent), or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Applied Random Processes (3)
desc: Random variables, multivariate distributions, random sequences, stochastic convergence, stationary and nonstationary processes, spectral analysis, Karhunen-Loeve expansion, Markov processes, mean square estimation, Kalman filters. Pre: 342 or MATH 471 (or equivalent).
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Smart Grids and Renewable Energy Integration (3)
desc: Challenges and solutions for integrating intermittent renewable energy sources into the power system, with a focus on “smart grid” approaches and demand-response. Using linear programming and other modeling techniques to answer policy-relevant questions. Graduate students only. Pre: 435. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Analysis and Design of Integrated Circuits (3)
desc: Fabrication constraints and design guidelines for integrated circuits. Nonlinear model of integrated circuit transistor. Design and analysis of integrated logic circuits and linear circuits. Pre: 323.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Topics in Physical Electronics (3)
desc: Recent developments in phenomena and devices of physical electronics. Pre: 327.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Rapid Prototyping of Electrophysical Devices (3)
desc: Hands on experience in designing, fabricating, testing, and iterating according to rapid-prototyping principles. Students learn state-of-the-art equipment for making their designs, software for simulating designs, and working in design teams. ECE majors only. Graduate students only. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Microsensors and Microactuators I (3)
desc: Technology methods and physical principles of microsensors and microactuators. Vacuum technology, thin film deposition and characterization techniques, solid mechanics, micromachining, acoustics, piezoelectricity and principles of current microtransducers. Pre: 327 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Optical Electronics II (3)
desc: Electro-optics, noise detection, light and sound dielectric waveguide phenomena, lasers, optics, phase conjugation. Pre: 622 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Optical Electronics I (3)
desc: Fundamentals of optical radiation, including stimulated and spontaneous processes. Optical electronics including optical resonators, lasers, optical detectors, light-guiding, and applications. A-F only. Pre: 327 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Solid-State Devices (3)
desc: Advanced physical principles and design of modern solid-state electronic devices. Heterostructures, photodetectors, LED, junction lasers, and other devices of current importance identified from the current literature. A-F only. Pre: 327.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Electronic Circuits (3)
desc: Electronic circuits for precision measurement, computation, and signal processing. Low noise and interference reduction techniques. High-frequency and high-speed techniques. Micro-processor and biomedical applications. Pre: 422.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Dynamic Programming and Stochastic Control (3)
desc: Sequential decision-making via dynamic programming. Optimal control of stochastic dynamic systems. Applications in linear-quadratic control, inventory control, resource allocation, scheduling, and control of queues. Rollout and other suboptimal methods. Value and policy iteration. Pre: 342 or MATH 371 or MATH 471, or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Linear and Convex Optimization (3)
desc: Algorithms for linear, nonlinear, and convex optimization. Emphasis is on methodology and the underlying mathematical structures. Topics include simplex method, network flow methods, optimality conditions, duality, Newton’s method and interior point methods. ECE, ME, MIS and MATH majors only. Pre: MATH 311 or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Digital Image Processing (3)
desc: Human visual perception, image formation, sampling and quantization, enhancement and restoration, color image processing, wavelets and multiresolution representations, image and video compression. Pre: 415 or equivalent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Digital Signal Processing (3)
desc: An advanced course in digital processing. Topics include fast DFT algorithms, multirate systems and filter banks, power spectrum estimation, linear prediction, optimum linear filters, and adaptive filtering. A-F only. Open to nonmajors for CR/NC only. Pre: 415 or 640, or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer and Network Security (3)
desc: Basic security theory, current practices, and emerging research issues. First covering the fundamentals of computer and network security, then will work on research projects on computer and network security.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Optical Networks (3)
desc: Propagation of signals in fibers, components, modulation and demodulation, transmission system engineering, network systems and architectures, network design, control and management and packet switching. Pre: 342, 367, and 371; or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Network Algorithms (3)
desc: Network algorithms, protocols, and packet switching systems for the internet including TCP/IP, routing algorithms, transmission scheduling, link management, buffer management, and simple network management. Pre: 367 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Intelligent Autonomous Agents (3)
desc: Theory, methods and practical applications of autonomous agent systems, including common applications of both software and hardware (robotic) agents. In-depth practical experience with autonomous agents through programming assignments and projects. Pre: 467 or ICS 313 (or equivalent), graduate standing; or consent. (Once a year) (Cross-listed as ICS 606)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Artificial Intelligence (3)
desc: LISP for machine intelligence applications, or related constraint object and logic-oriented languages. Pre: 467 or knowledge of LISP/PROLOG.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Algorithm I (3)
desc: Design and evaluation of machine representations, techniques and algorithms for sorting, pattern processing, computational geometry, mathematical computations, and engineering applications. Introduction to computational issues of time, space, communication, and program correctness. Pre: 367 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Graph Theory and Its Applications (3)
desc: Graphs and subgraphs, trees and treelike graphs, planar graphs, connectivity and edge-connectivity, applications. Pre: MATH 311 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Directed Reading (V)
desc: Investigation of advanced engineering problems. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: senior standing and consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Capstone Design Project (V)
desc: Significant project integrating the design content of previous courses and incorporating engineering standards and realistic constraints. Written report must document all aspects of the design process: reliability, safety, economics, ethics. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only. Pre: 396 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Ethics in Electrical Engineering (1)
desc: Equip electrical engineers with the necessary background for ethical reasoning, as it pertains to technology, society, workplace issues, and the environment. ECE majors only. A-F only. Pre: senior standing or consent. (Once a year)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Provisional Topics (3)
desc: Upper division course with subject matter to be announced.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: (Alpha) Special Topics in Electrical Engineering (3)
desc: Content will reflect special interests of visiting/permanent faculty; to be oriented toward juniors and seniors. (B) artificial intelligence; (C) circuits; (D) communications; (E) computer hardware; (F) computer software; (G) computer vision; (H) control; (I) devices; (J) fields; (K) power. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Biomedical Instrumentation (3)
desc: (2 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Principles, applications, and design of biomedical instrumentation. Transducers, IC and microcomputer applications, patient safety. Pre: 326, 480; or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Bioelectric Phenomena (3)
desc: Study of electrical phenomena in living systems. Mechanisms underlying bioelectric activity. Membrane and transepithelial potentials, skin impedance, electrocardiography, neuroelectric signals, diagnostic considerations, laboratory demonstrations. Pre: 480 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Biomedical Engineering Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Measurement of bioelectrical signals, computer and electronic simulation of biological systems, design and evaluation of electronic circuits for biomedical measurements, evaluation of instruments for patient safety. Pre: 323 and 323L. Co-requisite: 480.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Biomedical and Clinical Engineering (3)
desc: Application of engineering principles and technology to biological and medical problems. Introduction to human anatomy, physiology, medical terminology, clinical measurements. Systems modeling, physiological control systems, computer applications, health-related problems. Pre: 213 and either MATH 244 or MATH 253A.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Fundamentals of Radar, Sonar, and Navigation Systems (3)
desc: Discussion of basic radar detection and position- and velocity-measurement principles. Applications to various types of radar and sonar systems. Modern navigation aids. Pre: 371 (or equivalent), and familiarity with waveguides or waveguide theory.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Optical Communications (3)
desc: Principles and applications of optical fibers and waveguides. Fundamentals of optical communication systems (optical links, high-speed systems, wavelength-division-multiplexing networks, and network elements) and optical components (guided-wave circuits, lasers, detectors, and optical amplifiers). System and network integration issues. A-F only. Pre: 372 or consent.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Antennas (3)
desc: Electromagnetic wave propagation in free space and ionized media. Geomagnetic and solar effects on the ionosphere. Absorption and dispersion. Antenna arrays, apertures, horns, impedance. Design of antenna systems. Pre: 371.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Microwave Engineering (3)
desc: Passive and active microwave devices and circuits for RF and wireless applications. Scattering parameters, signal-flow graphs, and computer-aided design. Pre: 371.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computational Techniques in Electromagnetics (3)
desc: Introduction to computational methods used to simulate/solve engineering design problems focusing on electromagnetics. Finite difference,   method of moments, and finite elements methods will be described; students will write computer programs in each. A-F only. BE, ECE, ENGR majors only. Pre: 371 or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Physical Optics (3)
desc: Fundamentals of classical physical optics emphasizing linear systems theory, including optical fields in matter, polarization phenomena, temporal coherence, interference and diffraction (Fourier optics). Specialized applications include Gaussian beams, laser resonators, pulse propagation, and nonlinear optics. Pre: 372 (or concurrent with a minimum grade of C-) or PHYS 450 (or concurrent with a minimum grade of C), or consent. (Cross-listed as PHYS 460)
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Wireless Data Networks (3)
desc: Mobile agent’s platforms and systems, mobile agent-based service implementation, middleware, and configuration, wireless local area networks, wireless protocols, network architecture supporting wireless applications, routing protocols in mobile and wireless networks, handoff in mobile and wireless networks. Pre: 344 and 367, or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Operating Systems (3)
desc: Computer system organization; multiprocessor systems, memory hierarchies, assemblers, compilers, operating systems, virtual machine, memory management, processor management; information management. Emphasis on written communication through written assignments on relevant topics. Pre: 361 (or concurrent) and 367 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Object-oriented Software Engineering (3)
desc: Introduction to advanced techniques for designing, implementing, and testing computer software with a particular focus on using object-oriented design, analysis, and programming to produce high-quality computer programs that solve non-trivial problems. A-F only. Pre: 367 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer Architecture (3)
desc: Structure of stored program machines, data flow machines, pipelining, fault-tolerant computing, instruction set design, effects of compilation on architecture, RISC vs. CISC architecture, uses of parallelism. Pre: 361.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Design of Intelligent Robots (3)
desc: Study of the design principles of computer-controlled, intelligent robots such as roving vehicles, hand-eye systems. Pre: 351 and 367.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Modern Control Theory (3)
desc: Analysis and synthesis of nonlinear control systems by means of Lagrange’s equation, state space techniques, maximum principle. Lyapunov’s theorems, the phase plane, and Z-transform techniques. Optimization and adaptation by means of gradient methods, calculus of variations, dynamic programming. Pre: 351.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Digital Control Systems (3)
desc: Sampling/reconstruction, Z-transform, DT transfer function. Reachability/observability. State and output feedback, observer design, input-output models, diophantine equations. Implementation procedures. Pre: 315 and 351, or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer Communication Networks (3)
desc: ISO Reference Model. Physical Layer, Data Link Layer, Network Layer and Transport Layer protocols. Wired and wireless local-area networks. Structure and operation of the Internet including routing, congestion control and flow control. Pre: 315 and one of 342, or MATH 371 or MATH 471; or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Information Theory and Coding (3)
desc: Models of communication systems. Channel noise, measurement, and coding of information. Intrinsic limits of performance of communication systems. Pre: 342 and 343, or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Machine Learning (3)
desc: Foundation for algorithms, practice, and theory behind common machine-learning applications. Includes projects, statistical programming, and an introduction to the unique challenges of high-dimensional problems. ECE, CENG, CEE, ME, MATH, ICS majors only. A-F only. Pre: 342 (or equivalent) and MATH 307 (or equivalent).
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Digital Communications (3)
desc: Baseband transmission, intersymbol interference and pulse shaping, partial response signaling, equalization, bandpass modulation and demodulation, channel coding, synchronization, multiplexing and multiple access, spread spectrum techniques. Pre: 342 and 343, or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Renewable Energy (3)
desc: Fundamentals of power, electric power grid and conventional electricity generation. Wind and solar power systems. Photovoltaic materials and systems. Distributed generation and energy storage. ENGR majors only. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. Pre: 213 or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Electric Power Systems (3)
desc: Design/operation of “the grid.” History of electric power systems, three-phrase power, real and reactive power, transformers, transmission, distribution, circuit analysis, protection, load flow, load frequency control, optimal power flow, and renewable energy integration. Pre: MATH 243 (or concurrent) or MATH 253A (or concurrent). (Fall only)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer-Aided Circuit Design (3)
desc: Application of the computer to the analysis, design, simulation, and construction of analog and digital circuits. Pre: 326 and 326L, or consent.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Advanced Si IC and Solid State Devices (3)
desc: State of the art Si-based devices including advanced bipolar and MOS devices, heterojunction devices, new device trends. Topics from the most current literature included. Pre: 327 and either MATH 243 or MATH 253A, or consent.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Electronic Instrumentation II (3)
desc: Instrumentation systems and circuits for measurement, control, signal processing, transmission, and detection. Noise and interference, ADC/DAC, modulation demodulation, high-frequency and high-speed techniques, IC applications. Pre: 422 and 422L, or consent.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer-Aided Analysis and Design (3)
desc: Algorithms and techniques used in computer-aided analysis and design of electronic circuits. Circuit simulation with interactive computers. Pre: 326 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Instrumentation Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Laboratory for 422. Co-requisite: 422.
metadata: DY College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Sensors and Instrumentation for Biological Systems (3)
desc: Design course focused on fundamentals of electronic interfacing, control and automation, including biological processes. Topics include sensor physics, basic instrumentation, digital communication, and programming of microcontrollers and other portable computer systems. Pre: (160, 211, and BE 350 or MATH 302 or MATH 307 or ECE 326) with a minimum grade of C; or consent. (Cross-listed as BE 420 and MBBE 422)
metadata: DY College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Optimization (3)
desc: Application of linear, nonlinear and integer optimization models and algorithms to communications, control, signal processing, computer networking, financial engineering, manufacturing, production and distribution systems. CE, ECE, ME, or CBA majors only. Pre: MATH 307 or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Digital Image Processing (3)
desc: Digital image representation, intensity transformations, spatial filtering, filtering in the frequency domain, image restoration, color spaces and transformations, the fast wavelet transform, image compression. Pre: 315 (or equivalent) or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Digital Signal Processing (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Discrete-time signals and systems, sampling, Z-transform, transform, transform analysis of linear time-invariant systems, filter design, discrete Fourier transform, and computation of discrete Fourier transform. Pre: 315 and 342 (or concurrent), or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Computer and Network Security (3)
desc: Review basic network mechanisms, introduce basic cryptography concepts, and study algorithms and protocols used in computer and network security. Discuss practical security mechanisms. A-F only. Pre: 361 or ICS 312 or ICS 331 or instructor consent. (Once a year)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Junior Project (V)
desc: Junior level individual or team project under ECE faculty direction and guidance. The project provides design experience and develops practical skills. It may be a continuation of ECE 296 or a new project. Repeatable unlimited times. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. Pre: 296 or consent. (Cross-listed as ENGR 396)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Engineering Electromagnetics Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Experiments illustrating the basic principles of electromagnetics and optics. Pre: 371 and PHYS 274 (or concurrent), or consent. Co-requisite: 372.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Engineering Electromagnetics II (3)
desc: Solution of Maxwell’s equations under various boundary conditions. Introduction to radiation, guided waves, and principles of optics. Pre: 371 and PHYS 274 (or concurrent); or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Engineering Electromagnetics I (3)
desc: Transient and steady-state waves on transmission lines. Plane wave solutions of Maxwell’s equations. Application of Maxwell’s equations under static and time-varying conditions. Pre: 213.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Cyber-Physical Systems and the Internet of Things (3)
desc: Topics include General Purpose Input/Output (GPIO), serial communications, sensors, actuators, low-power wireless communications. TCP/IP networking, dynamic service discovery, distributed network messaging, machine-to-machine communication and cloud-computing interaction. A-F only. Engineering majors only. Pre: 205.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer Data Structures and Algorithms Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Laboratory for 367. Includes an emphasis on instruction in writing laboratory reports. Pre: 367 (or concurrent).
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Computer Data Structures and Algorithms (3)
desc: Design and analysis of data structures and algorithms, including correctness and performance. Topics include time complexity, hash tables, sorting, search trees, self-balancing trees, greedy algorithms, dynamic programming, and graph algorithms. Pre: (205 or ICS 212) and (362 or ICS 241).
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: CMOS VLSI Design (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Introduction to the design of very large scale integrated (VLSI) systems and use of CAD tools and design languages. Lab includes hands-on use of CAD tools and experiments with field programmable logic devices. Pre: 260.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Discrete Math for Engineers (3)
desc: Logic, sets, number theory, properties of functions, properties of relations, methods of proofs, recursion, counting, probability, trees, graphs, analysis of algorithms, finite state autonoma. Pre: 160 and 260 and MATH 242.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Digital Systems and Computer Design Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Laboratory for 361, experiments on digital systems and interfacing. Includes an emphasis on instruction in writing laboratory reports. Co-requisite: 361.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Digital Systems and Computer Design (3)
desc: Design methodology, processor design, control design, memory organization, system organization. Pre: 205 and 260, or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Linear Feedback-Control Systems Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Provides experience in applying theoretical tools to analyze linear systems. Extensive use is made of computer-aided analysis and design packages study system performance. Pre: 315. Co-requisite: 351.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Linear Feedback-Control Systems (3)
desc: Analysis/design of feedback systems. Compensator design via root locus and Bode analysis. Routh/Nyquist stability. State space representation and introduction to MIMO formulation. Controllability/observability. Application to physical dynamic systems such as industrial robots. Pre: 315 or ME 375 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Networking I (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Covers 4 semesters from the Cisco Networking Academy plus supplementary material; hands-on experience with routers and switches; prepares students for the CCNA. Topics include TCP/IP, LANs, WANs, routing protocols, network security; PPP; ISDN, frame relay. A-F only. Pre: 160 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Communication Systems Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Experiments illustrating the basic principles of communication systems. Includes an emphasis on instruction in writing laboratory reports. Pre: 315. Co-requisite: 343.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Communication Systems (3)
desc: Signal representation, Fourier analysis; amplitude and angle modulated systems; sampling theorems, pulse and digital modulation systems; carrier modulation by digital signals. Pre: 342 (or concurrent) and 315.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Probability and Statistics (3)
desc: Probability, statistics, random variables, distributions, densities, expectations, limit theorems, and applications to electrical engineering. Pre: 315 (or concurrent) and either MATH 244 or MATH 253A; or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Microcircuit Fabrication Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Hands-on laboratory where students make various electronic and electromechanical micro-devices using IC technology. Devices are also tested and analyzed. Pre: 324 or consent. Co-requisite: 328.
metadata: DY College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Microcircuit Fabrication (3)
desc: Technology principles, materials, and methods for the design and fabrication of semiconductor devices, integrated circuits, and microelectromechanical systems. Pre: 327 or consent. Co-requisite: 328L.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Theory and Design of IC Devices (3)
desc: Band structure models and carrier transport physics review. Theory and design of semiconductor IC devices: Schottky diodes, bipolar devices (PN junction diodes, BJTs), FETs (MOSFETs, JFETs, and MESFETs). Pre: 324 and either MATH 243 or MATH 253A; or consent.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Microelectronic Circuits II Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Laboratory for 326, experiments on linear and analog electronics. Includes an emphasis on writing laboratory reports. Pre: 323L. Co-requisite: 326.
metadata: DY College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Microelectronic Circuits II (3)
desc: Principles and design of linear electronic circuits including differential, operational, feedback, and tuned amplifiers; integrated circuits, current mirrors, signal generators, filters, and stability. Pre: 323.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Physical Electronics (3)
desc: Review of quantum mechanics fundamentals, H-atom, and chemical bonding. Introduction to band structure models and materials. Semiconductor doping, charge carrier statistics and charge transport, including ambipolar transport. Metal-semiconductor and PN junctions. Pre: MATH 243 or MATH 253A, and PHYS 274; or consent.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Microelectronic Circuits I Lab (1)
desc: (1 3-hr Lab) Experiments on linear and logic properties of diodes and transistor networks. Pre: 213. Co-requisite: 323.
metadata: DY College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Microelectronic Circuits I (3)
desc: Semiconductor structures, operating principles and characteristics of diodes and amplifying devices. Their application as circuit elements in building basic digital, analog, and integrated circuit subsystems. Pre: 213.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Signal and Systems Analysis (3)
desc: Discrete-time and continuous time signals and systems, linear systems, convolution, Fourier series, Fourier transform, sampling. Pre: 213 and either MATH 244 or MATH 253A; or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Sophomore Project (V)
desc: Sophomore level individual or team project under ECE faculty direction and guidance. The project provides design experience and develops practical skills. Repeatable unlimited times. CENG, ECE, and PREN majors only. Sophomore standing or higher. A-F only. (Cross-listed as ENGR 296)
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Digital Design (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Introduction to the design of digital systems with an emphasis on design methods and the implementation and use of fundamental digital components. Pre: 160 or 110 or ICS 111 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Basic Circuit Analysis II (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Laplace transforms and their application to circuits, Fourier transforms and their applications to circuits, frequency selective circuits, introduction to and design of active filters, convolution, and state space analysis of circuits. A-F only. Pre: 211, and MATH 244 (or concurrent) or MATH 253A (or concurrent); or consent.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Basic Circuit Analysis I (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Linear passive circuits, time domain analysis, transient and steady-state responses, phasors, impedance and admittance; power and energy, frequency responses, resonance. BENG, CE, CENG, ECE, ME, PREN, and ENGS majors only. A-F only. Pre: MATH 243 (or concurrent) or MATH 253 (or concurrent), and PHYS 272 (or concurrent); or consent.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Object Oriented Programming (4)
desc: Second programming for computer engineers. System programming language, such as C. Object-oriented programming paradigm, definition and use of classes, fundamentals of object-oriented design, such as C++. Common data structures. Common searching and sorting algorithms. CEE, ECE, ME, PREN majors only. A-F only. Pre: 160 or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Freshman Project (V)
desc: Freshman level individual or team project under ECE faculty direction and guidance. This project provides early student entry into ECE hands-on project activity providing practical skills, ECE subject exposure and experience. Second semester freshman standing required. Repeatable unlimited times. CENG, ECE, and PREN majors only. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Programming for Engineers (4)
desc: (3 Lec, 1 3-hr Lab) Introduction to computer programming and modern computing environments with an emphasis on algorithm and program design, implementation, and debugging. Includes a hands-on laboratory to develop and practice programming skills. BENG, CE, CENG, ECE, ME, PREN, CNST, and ENGS majors only. A-F only. Pre: MATH 241 (or concurrent) or MATH 251A (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Introduction to Engineering Computation (3)
desc: Engineering problem solving using MATLAB. Basic programming concepts include input/output, branching, looping, functions, file input/output, and data structures such as arrays and structures. Matrix operations for solving linear equations. Engineering computations and visualization. ECE and CENG majors only. A-F only. Pre: MATH 241 (or concurrent) or MATH 251A (or concurrent) or consent.
metadata: College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: ECE
title: Electrical Engineering Skills (3)
desc: Electrical engineering subjects in a skill acquisition context at the freshman level. Learning, creative problem solving, brainstorming, technical information assimilation, and presentation skills development. Repeatable two times. A-F only.
metadata: DP College of Engineering Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE)

subject: EDEP
title: Dissertation Research (V)
desc: Research for doctoral dissertation. Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: (Alpha) Seminar in Educational Psychology (3)
desc: Current issues and problems in the context of education: (B) general; (C) learning; (D) measurement; (E) statistics; (F) psycho-social development; (G) educational evaluation; (H) research methodology. Repeatable nine times. Pre: consent. Seminar may be repeated for credit as topics vary.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Creative Learning Strategies for Adults (3)
desc: Analysis of psychology of adult learner; forces that affect learning in dynamics of individual, group, and organizational behavior; concept of lifelong learning vis-à-vis development of creative strategies that assist maturing, self-directed persons to develop their potentialities. (Cross-listed as EDEA 745 and NURS 745)
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Practicum in Educational Psychology (V)
desc: Supervised practicum in teaching or program evaluation as each is reflected by professional activities of the members of the faculty. Repeatable six times. Pre: consent of supervisory professor.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Educational Research Methods (3)
desc: Research techniques and thesis development.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Research for master’s thesis. Repeatable seven times.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Directed Reading and/or Research (V)
desc: Individual reading and/or research. Repeatable ten times. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Capstone Project in Educational Psychology (V)
desc: To be taken in the final semester or the second to last semester to complete the certificate. Students are expected to integrate, extend, critique and apply knowledge learned in the certificate program. Repeatable three times, up to 12 credits.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Social Cognition and Competence (3)
desc: Systematic analysis of social reasoning abilities conjunctive with or prerequisite to effective social interaction in educational settings.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Instructional Psychology (3)
desc: Application of learning theory and cognitive skills training in instructional settings.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Models of Cognitive Learning (3)
desc: Cognitive models of knowledge acquisition, organization, and utilization; theory and research relating learning and cognition to interactive instructional models.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Social Context of Learning (3)
desc: Analysis of the social context in the learning process and education, including peer, family, community, and cultural influences.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Development and Learning (3)
desc: Theories and research on learning and development and their educational applications. Analysis of how learning and development are interrelated.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Introduction to Program Evaluation (3)
desc: Introduction to concepts and issues related to program evaluation. Topics include preparing for an evaluation, formative and summative uses, and qualitative and quantitative design approaches. A-F only. Pre: 608 (or equivalent).
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Adolescence and Education (3)
desc: Discussion-based course presenting an overview of educational psychology applied to teaching adolescents, including theory and research on human learning, adolescent development and its social context, and student assessment.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Psychometric Methods (3)
desc: Theories and applications of modern psychometrics. Topics include item response theory, detecting biased items, measurement invariance, and current issues in psychometrics. Pre: 604 (with a minimum grade of B+) or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Structural Equation Modeling (3)
desc: Theories and applications to test models with manifest and latent variables. Topics include path analysis, factor analysis, latent variable model, multi-group analysis, latent means model, and other advanced topics in SEM. Pre: 606, PSY 610, PSY 614, or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Categorical Data Analysis (3)
desc: Theories and methods for data analysis with categorical and discrete variables; analysis of contingency tables, loglinear models, introduction to generalized linear models for binary, nominal, ordinal, and count outcomes in cross-sectional and longitudinal data sets. Pre: 604, PSY 610, or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Measurement in Education and Social Sciences (3)
desc: Measurement and psychometric theories and applications using psychometric programs. Topics include classical test theory, reliability, validity, exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis, item bias, and item response theory. Pre: 604 or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Qualitative Research Methods in Education (3)
desc: Introduction to methods of qualitative research in education. (Meets PhD common core requirement.) (Cross-listed as EDEA 604)
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Multilevel Modeling for Cross-Sectional and Longitudinal Data (3)
desc: Theories and applications of multilevel model to analyze cross-sectional and longitudinal data. Topics include two-level and three-level models, growth models, and multilevel logistic regression. Pre: 604, PSY 610, 612 (with a minimum grade of B or higher), or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Graduate Introduction to Educational Psychology (3)
desc: Graduate level introduction to educational psychology theories, research, and topics.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Introduction to Educational Research (3)
desc: Fundamental design and evaluation procedures in educational research. Topics include an introduction to qualitative and quantitative research, the review of literature, developing research questions, research design, instrumentation, data collection, and writing a research proposal. Pre: 601 (or concurrent) (with a minimum grade of B or higher) or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Nonparametric Methods for Behavioral Science (3)
desc: Conditions for valid applications of nonparametric statistical techniques in education and behavioral sciences; theoretical and methodological perspectives.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Multivariate Methods (3)
desc: Builds on prior knowledge of multiple regression and will include applications of MANOVA, canonical correlation, logistic regression, discriminant function analysis, cluster analysis, multidimensional scaling, and mixture models. Pre: 604 or PSY 610, or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Applied Regression and Analysis of Variance (3)
desc: Introduction to linear statistical models as principle of data analysis. Topics include multiple regression models with continuous and categorical predictors. ANOVA with multiple factors, ANOVA with repeated measures, and ANCOVA. Pre: 601 or EDEA 629 (with a grade of B+), or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Design and Analysis of Psychological Experiments (3)
desc: Analysis of variance and other models of assessing results of experiments. Relation of analysis to design.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Survey Research Design and Analysis (3)
desc: Survey study designs, survey sampling, questionnaire construction, interviewing, pre-tests, pilot studies, logic of measurement and association, table construction, and elaboration models. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as EDEA 608 and SOC 608)
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Introduction to Quantitative Methods (3)
desc: Introductory graduate-level statistics in education and social sciences. Topics on descriptive and inferential statistics including central tendency, variability, sampling distribution, z-test, t-test, correlation, simple linear regression, and one-way ANOVA. (Meets PhD common inquiry methods requirement or elective.)
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Human Motivation and Education (3)
desc: Application of motivation theory and research to understanding and increasing human motivation for education.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Introductory Statistics (3)
desc: Introduction to concepts and logics of statistical reasoning and statistical literacy. Topics include descriptive statistics, sampling distribution, and inferential statistics such as z-test, t-tests, correlation, and one-way ANOVA.
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Student Assessment (3)
desc: Introduction to basic concepts and issues in assessment and measurement, development of formative and summative assessment procedures, descriptive statistics, scales of measurement, and standardizing testing.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Seminar in Contemporary Perspectives in Educational Psychology (3)
desc: In-depth analysis of contemporary issues in education from the theoretical and methodological perspectives of the faculty in educational psychology. Focuses on oral communication and intensive writing skills. Repeatable one time.
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Fundamentals of Research in Education (3)
desc: Introduction to the methodology of systematic study of problems in education: principles of research design, data processing, technical writing, and evaluation of research proposals and reports.
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Directed Reading (V)
desc: Individual reading or research. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Self-Regulated Learning (3)
desc: Theory and use of self-regulated learning strategies in academic contexts.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Introduction to Educational Psychology (3)
desc: Psychology applied to education, including cognitive, sociocultural, and multicultural approaches to teaching, learning, development, and research. Develops knowledge and written communication skills through an introduction to classroom, assessment, instruction, motivation, classroom management, and standardized testing. (Cross-listed as PSY 301)
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEP
title: Introduction to Teaching as a Career (3)
desc: An experience-based introduction to teaching as a career. Repeatable one time.
metadata: College of Education Educational Psychology (EDEP)

subject: EDEF
title: Seminar on the Educational System (3)
desc: Examination of the structure and dynamics of educational system. Particular focus on how educational policy interacts with principles that explain educational system behavior. A-F only. Pre: 675 or EDEA 675, or consent. (Cross-listed as EDEA 767)
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Seminar in History of Education (3)
desc: Aspects of the history of education. Application of historiography to educational problems and policy. Repeatable with different content. A-F only. Pre: 651 or 652, or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Advanced Seminar in Philosophy of Education (3)
desc: Advanced studies in philosophical inquiry. Examination of philosophically based methods of analysis and interpretation and their influence in educational research and practice. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Seminar on the Social and Cultural Contexts of Education (3)
desc: Examination of social, political, and cultural issues affecting educational policy with special emphasis on methods of inquiry and theoretical constructs. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Research for master’s thesis. Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Directed Reading and/or Research (V)
desc: Individual reading and/or research. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: consent of department chair.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Environmental Education (3)
desc: Focuses on the development of an ecological consciousness through a cultural and environmental approach to teaching and learning in schooling and everyday life.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: International Development Education (3)
desc: Introduction to international development education in Asian and Pacific nations. Students explore links between education and development. Emphasis is on cross-cultural perception of development.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Education and World Order (3)
desc: Focuses on the challenges educators face in identifying appropriate pedagogical frameworks and practices in global education that address the impact of globalization in our society today. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Social and Cultural Contexts of Education (3)
desc: Focuses on the interplay of class, race, gender and ethnicity in school and community settings. Social praxis, educational reform and policy are considered. A-F only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Seminar on Race, Law, and Education (3)
desc: Introduction to educational law and the way it relates to issues of race and ethnicity. Particular focus on how the U.S. courts have dealt with the question of educational inequality in a multiracial/multiethnic society. A-F only. Pre: graduate standing or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Approaches to Educational Inquiry (3)
desc: Overview of different research methods in educational inquiry with an opportunity to explore through practice one or more methods (ex: case study, interviewing, narrative construction, practitioner inquiry. Preparation for MEd or PhD proposals.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: The Politics of Education (3)
desc: Examination of the ways in which education can be viewed as political, arising from its connection to the larger political system including local, state, and federal governments. A-F only. Pre: 675, EDEA 675, or consent. (Cross-listed as EDEA 676)
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Introduction to Educational Policy Studies (3)
desc: Examines theories and models of educational policy and policy-making and the contribution of policy analysis to the policy-making and change processes. A-F only. Pre: consent. (Crosslisted as EDEA 675)
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Topics in Comparative Education (3)
desc: Educational institutions, structures, processes, policies, and problems viewed within the context of political, social, and cultural milieus. Geographic region or theme focus. Repeatable three times. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Introduction to Comparative/ International Education (3)
desc: Introduction to basic methods of comparative studies, focusing on schooling, but also treating broader educational issues. A-F only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: (Alpha) Seminar in Educational Foundations-Selected Topics (3)
desc: Multi-disciplinary (historical, philosophical, social/cultural and comparative/international focus on topical issues in education. (B) general; (C) leadership and governance in education; (D) educational reform; (E) foundations of teaching; (F) foundations of curriculum; (G) globalization in education; (H) moral political education. Repeatable one time for (H). A-F only for (H). Pre: graduate standing and departmental approval.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Philosophy of Education (3)
desc: Readings of the original texts of major philosophers impacting American education. Considerations about the conditions of knowing and their extension in everyday practices in education. A-F only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Introduction to Higher Education (3)
desc: Salient historic, social, and organizational aspects of higher education; history, philosophy, purposes, governance, administration, structures, financing, faculty and student selection, curricula, legal and social issues.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: History of Education in Hawai‘i (3)
desc: From pre-contact, ancient Hawai‘i to the present. Social and intellectual influences on the development of national, local, and indigenous educational institutions; emphasis on multicultural as well as monocultural directions in Hawai‘i’s schools. A-F only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: History of Education in America (3)
desc: History of educational thought and practice from European colonialism to revolutionary nationalism to the present. A-F only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Field Studies in Educational Foundations (V)
desc: Field-based participant research projects, including analysis of educational problems and issues. Repeatable unlimited times. A-F only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Cultural Diversity and Education (3)
desc: Examines issues, theories, perspectives and practices in multicultural education and promotes awareness, encourages knowledgeable reflection and develops skills necessary for multicultural practitioners. A-F only. (Cross-listed as EDCS 630)
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Foundations of Educational Theory (3)
desc: An in-depth review of social, philosophical, and historical views underlying various theories of education and their applications in teaching and learning. A-F only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Anthropological Applications (3)
desc: Education as cultural and cross-cultural learning; universal aspects of the process. Ethnographic study. Applied anthropological theory and practice for educators. A-F only.
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Ethnic Groups and Education in Hawai‘i (3)
desc: Identity and learning within and among Hawai‘i ethnic groups; study of prejudice and inter-ethnic hostilities as these impact education and teaching. College of Education majors only. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Gender Issues in Education (3)
desc: Examines historical and current gender issues in education as they intersect with ethnicity and class. We pay close attention to the writing process and the skills needed to compose a well-written research paper. Pre: WGSS 151 or consent. (Cross-listed as EDCS 453 and WGSS 453)
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Sociology of Education (3)
desc: Introduction to sociological frameworks of analysis of the institutional, cultural and social dynamics of schooling, classroom management, school reform, social group and individual role behavior. A-F only.
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Community and Culture (3)
desc: Theoretical and practical approaches to understanding the constitution of community life. A focus on the social construction of normative values, social dynamics of organizations, and school-community relations. A-F only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Directed Reading (V)
desc: Individual reading or research. Pre: senior majors with a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.7 or a minimum GPA of 3.0 in education, and consent of instructor and department chair.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Introduction to Multicultural Education (3)
desc: Concepts and methods to develop sensitivity and awareness of cultural influences on behavior as these relate to the schooling process. A-F only.
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: The History of Education in Hawai‘i From Pre-contact to Statehood (3)
desc: History of educational though and practices from pre-contact Hawaii through statehood. Social, intellectual, political, and cultural influences on indigenous, territorial, and state educational institutions; emphasis on white-settler colonialism, multiculturalism, assimilation, resistance, indigenous, and immigrant experiences. Repeatable one time. A-F only. (Spring only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEF
title: Education in American Society (3)
desc: Interrelated historical, philosophical, and sociocultural contexts of education with an emphasis on identifying, analyzing, and deliberating on contemporary ethical issues, problems, and applications. Students enrolled in colleges other than the College of Education are asked to confer with the College of Education director of student services before enrolling in 310. A-F only.
metadata: DS College of Education Educational Foundations (EDEF)

subject: EDEA
title: (Alpha) Seminar (3)
desc: Study in trends, research, and problems. (B) policy formulation; (C) organizational change; (D) evaluation and research management (meets PhD common required advanced methodology course); (G) school governance; (H) college student affairs administration; (I) higher education administration; (J) administrative theories; (K) administrative problems and issues; (M) engaging diverse student populations; (N) exploring Indigeneity in higher education. (K) is repeatable two times in different topics. EDEA majors only for (I) and (K). A-F only for (M). Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Seminar on the Principalship (3)
desc: Series of planned seminar experiences on problems and issues confronting school principals, such as contract administration, program planning and budgeting systems (PPBS), teacher evaluation. Topic to be announced. Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Seminar on the Educational System (3)
desc: Examination of structure and dynamics of the educational system. Particular focus on how educational policy interacts with principles that explain educational system behavior. A-F only. Pre: 675 or EDEF 675, or consent. (Cross-listed as EDEF 767)
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Creative Learning Strategies for Adults (3)
desc: Analysis of psychology of adult learner; forces that affect learning in dynamics of individual, group, and organizational behavior; concept of lifelong learning vis-a-vis development of creative strategies that assist maturing, self-directed persons to develop their potentialities. (Cross-listed as EDEP 745 and NURS 745)
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Internship in Education (V)
desc: Supervised intern experience in school and university administration. Emphasizes the development of leadership skills through program and project management. A-F only. Pre: approval of cooperating agencies and department.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Advanced Qualitative Research (3)
desc: Study in trends, research, and problems. Pre: 604 or comparable, or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Research master’s thesis. Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Directed Reading and/or Research (V)
desc: Individual reading and/or research. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: consent of instructor and department chair.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Capstone Project in Educational Administration (3)
desc: Required for higher education Plan B option. 3 credits required for program completion. Taken in final semester or second to last semester in program. A-F only. Pre: 602 and 657, and consent of instructor and chair.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Curriculum Administration (3)
desc: Master’s level course in curriculum administration and leadership, focusing on fundamental theories underlying curriculum development, as well as the implementation of curriculum policy at the school level. Pre: consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: The Politics of Education (3)
desc: Examination of the ways in which education can be viewed as political, arising from its connection to the larger political system including local, state, and federal governments. A-F only. Pre: 675, EDEF 675; or consent. (Cross-listed as EDEF 676)
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Introduction to Educational Policy Studies (3)
desc: Examines theories and models of educational policy and policy-making and the contribution of policy analysis to the policy-making and change processes. A-F only. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as EDEF 675)
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Teacher Development and Evaluation (3)
desc: The role of teacher evaluation in the development of teachers and learning communities and to support effective teaching. Repeatable one time.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Community College Leadership (3)
desc: Development and changing missions of community colleges; in-depth study of emerging leadership issues: planning, financial management, decision-making, governance, and student personnel. Repeatable one time. Pre: 660 or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Curriculum in Higher Education (3)
desc: Traditional and contemporary curriculum issues. Development of performance competencies in curriculum design and evaluation using systems and design theory as central paradigms. Repeatable one time. Pre: 657 or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Leadership in Student Affairs (3)
desc: Philosophy, history, organization, and administration of student personnel services at college and university levels, including admissions, housing, student activities, financial aids, placement, counseling, health services. Repeatable one time. Pre: 657 or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Leadership in Higher Education (3)
desc: Trends, research, and problems in college and university management. Repeatable one time. EDEA majors only. Pre: 657 or consent.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Introduction to Higher Education (3)
desc: Salient historic, social, and organizational aspects of higher education; history, philosophy, purposes, governance, administration, structures, financing, faculty and student selection, curricula, legal and social issues. Repeatable one time.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Intercultural Interactions (3)
desc: Theory-based frameworks and training methods of intercultural interaction and their applications to educational administration situations. Repeatable one time.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Conflict Management for Educators (3)
desc: Conflict resolution theory and practice for administrators, faculty and staff in educational organizations. K-12, community colleges and universities. Application and theory of negotiation, mediation, facilitation and hybrid ADR processes. Repeatable one time. Pre: 601 or 650, or consent. (Cross-listed as PACE 652)
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Organizational Leadership in Education (3)
desc: Analysis of the nature of organizations, human nature and needs, and their relationship to leadership, staffing, and staff development. Implications of group structure and human conflict, communications, and supervision and evaluation considered. Repeatable one time.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: College Student Development Theory (3)
desc: Study of psycho-social characteristics of the American college student and college environment, from viewpoint of student personnel work. Repeatable one time. EDEA majors only.
metadata: College of Education Educational Administration (EDEA)

subject: EDEA
title: Principles of School Leadership (3)
