desc: Focus on Japanese anime, manga, and films with an emphasis on oral communication. What can one learn about Japanese issues of gender, national identity, and race? A-F only. (Summer only)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: K-pop and J-pop: Korean and Japanese Popular Music and Society (3)
desc: Examines modern Japan and South Korea through popular music. Examines genres from early popular music, today’s K-pop and J-pop music. A-F only. (Summer only)
metadata: Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Gender Issues in Asian Society (3)
desc: Construction of gender identities in contemporary Asia. How these interface with other aspects of social difference and inequality (e.g., with class, religion, ethnicity). (Cross-listed as WGSS 463)
metadata: DS Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Contested Issues in Contemporary Japan (3)
desc: Familiarizes students with public discourse in Japan by analyzing key current issues widely debated in the Japanese media and in public forums in light of their political, historical, cultural, social and economic contexts. A-F only. Previous course work related to Japan or Asia will be helpful.
metadata: DS Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Asian Cities: Evolution of Urban Space (3)
desc: Reviews the evolution of Asian urban space. Political history, migration, culture, and production are the determinants of urban changes. Uses visual material to illustrate the change in Asian cityscape. Pre: 310 or PLAN 310 or ASAN 312, or consent. (Cross-listed as PLAN 449)
metadata: Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Sustainable Asian Development: Impact of Globalization (3)
desc:
Investigates the impact of globalization on sustainable development in Asia. 
Globalization and sustainability often contradict, raising serious planning issues. Examines how these issues affect Asian development policies and urban planning. Pre: 310 or 312 or PLAN 310, or consent. (Cross-listed as PLAN 438)
metadata: DS Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Contested Issues Korea and Japan (3)
desc: In-depth understanding of Korean-Japanese relations in the past and present by examining conflicting views and interpretations by Japanese, Korean, and Western scholars on important issues that divide the people of East Asia. A-F only.
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Korean Cinema (3)
desc: Develop an understanding of Korean culture and society through visual, narrative, and contextual analysis of Korean films. Topics include post-Korean War experience, compressed modernity, authoritarianism, and postauthoritarian transformation. Special attention to independent films. A-F only.
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Comparative Muslim Societies in Asia (3)
desc: Will compare Muslim societies and cultures in Asia with each other and with the so-called “core” Middle Eastern Muslim societies. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. (Alt. years)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Gender and Politics in U.S.-Okinawa Relations (3)
desc: Examines gender in Okinawa in relation to historical dynamics in the Asia-Pacific region with attention to issues such as militarism and violence, colonialism and memory, and tourism and commodification of indigenous culture. A-F only. Pre: WGSS 151 or consent. (Cross-listed as WGSS 410)
metadata: Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Peace Processes in Philippines and Hawai‘i (3)
desc: History of Philippine Islam and the Moro struggle, the peace process in Mindanao and sovereignty movement for Hawaiian nation. 75 min. Lec, 75-min. joint online discussion with Philippine students. Junior standing only. A-F only. Pre: consent. (Fall only) (Cross-listed as PACE 407)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Modern Philippines (3)
desc: Survey of major developments from pre-colonial through Spanish and American colonial periods, the revolution, Japanese occupation, and post-war republic. (Cross-listed as HIST 406)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: (Alpha) Field Study in Asia (3)
desc: Students may submit proposals to have academic course work, field research, or work experience in Asia. See specific center for guidelines and procedures. (C) China; (I) South Asia; (J) Japan; (K) Korea; (P) Philippines; (S) Southeast Asia; (Z) Other. Repeatable one time. A-F only for (C), (I), (J), (S), and (Z).
metadata: Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: 20th-Century Chinese Women Writers (3)
desc: A survey and critical examination of contemporary Chinese women writers from China, Taiwan, and Hong Kong. Traces a genealogy of women’s writing from the early 1920s up until now through novels, poetry, drama, and film. Pre: one DH or DL course, or consent. (Crosslisted as EALL 364 and WGSS 346)
metadata: DL Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Southeast Asian Literature in Translation (3)
desc: Survey in English traditional and modern literatures of Southeast Asia. A-F only. (Cross-listed as IP 361)
metadata: DL Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Buddhist Philosophy (3)
desc: Survey of central thinkers and schools. (Cross-listed as PHIL 360)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Geography of Southeast Asia (3)
desc: An investigation of the development context of Southeast Asia including socioeconomic, cultural, and environmental resources. Problems and prospects for change. Sophomore standing or higher. (Cross-listed as GEO 356)
metadata: DS Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Chinese Film: Art and History (3)
desc: Study and analysis of Chinese film; its history and relationship to cultural, social, philosophical, and aesthetic contexts. (Cross-listed as EALL 330)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: (Alpha) Japanese Film: Art and History (3)
desc: Study and analysis of Japanese film; its history and relationship to cultural, social, philosophical, and aesthetic contexts. (B) 1900-1960; (C) 1960-present; (D) special topics. Pre: upper division standing or consent. (Cross-listed as EALL 325)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Chado-the Way of Tea Practicum (2)
desc: Actual practice of the tea ceremony as history and culture of Japan. Repeatable one time.
metadata: DA Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: The Way of Tea in Japanese History and Culture (3)
desc: History and culture of Japan as revealed in study and practice of the tea ceremony: Zen, aesthetics, calligraphy, architecture, ceramics, gardens, politics. Includes an emphasis on Oral Communication skills. (Cross-listed as HIST 323)
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: (Alpha) Asia Past and Present (3)
desc: Multidisciplinary examination of major Asian countries; cultural, social, economic, and political lives of their peoples. (C) China; (I) South Asia; (J) Japan; (K) Korea; (O) Okinawa; (P) Philippines; (S) Southeast Asia; (Z) Other. Repeatable three times in different alphas.
metadata: DS Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Contemporary Asia (3)
desc:
Multidisciplinary examination of problems and issues affecting peoples and institutions of 
contemporary Asia: ethnic, language, religious, and cultural differences; population growth; public health; economic development; political and social change; environmental problems; etc. Pre: 201 and 202 are recommended, but not required.
metadata: DS Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Studying Asia Culturally (3)
desc: Multidisciplinary. Classics of literature, philosophy, and religion shaping Asian beliefs and values. Pre: 201 and 202 are recommended, but not required.
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Chinese Political Economy (3)
desc: Interdisciplinary review and analysis of the social and political issues in contemporary China, the interchange between state and society in national policies, the relationship between cultural tradition and technological modernization in the social transformation process. A-F only. Sophomore standing or higher. Pre: consent.   (Cross-listed as POLS 308)
metadata: DS Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Introduction to Asian Studies: South/ Southeast Asia (3)
desc:
Understanding South and Southeast Asia through multidisciplinary approaches. 
Examines the interrelationship of policies, economy, literature, religion, the arts, and history as the basis for such an understanding.
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Introduction to Asian Studies: East Asia (3)
desc: Understanding East Asia through multidisciplinary approaches. Examines the interrelationship of policies, economy, literature, religion, the arts, and history as the basis for such an understanding.
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASAN
title: Introduction to Asian Studies (3)
desc: Introductory course focuses on change and continuity in the history, culture, values, and political institutions of South, East, and Southeast Asia, and the region’s interrelationships with the rest of the world. A-F only.
metadata: DH Asian Studies (ASAN) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: UNIV
title: ACE Mentoring: Facilitating Student Development (4)
desc: Theoretical foundations in student learning and holistic development. Practical leadership skills acquisition and application through the facilitation of a seminar for new freshmen. Emphasis on developing proficiency in writing and public speech. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: consent. (Fall only)
metadata: Office of Student Success University (UNIV)

subject: UNIV
title: University Experience (1)
desc: An introduction to the university community; topics include critical thinking, the value of higher education, cultural and transition issues. A-F only.
metadata: Office of Student Success University (UNIV)

subject: ART
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Directed Work (V)
desc:
Advanced individual projects; advanced tutorial. Maximum: 3 credit hours per semester; total 6 for MA Plan A, 9 for MA Plan B, MFA students must petition OGE for permission 
to apply toward degree requirement. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: consent of instructor and department chair.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Graduate Studio Teaching Practicum (3)
desc: Observation, analysis and participation in teaching a lower division course under the direction of an instructor in the student’s area of concentration. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 690, admitted to candidacy for MFA in art, and consent.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Graduate Studio Seminar in Art (6)
desc: Selected topics in art. A critique-based course with emphasis on the development of critical analysis, artistic research, and practice. Repeatable six times. ART majors only. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Museum Interpretations (3)
desc: Studies the interpretive strategies and methods used by museums to communicate with visitors in museums, art galleries, historic sites, parks, and related places. Considers how interpretations contribute to cultural knowledge. Repeatable one time. Pre: consent. (Crosslisted as AMST 457)
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: BFA Capstone Seminar/Studio (3)
desc:
In conjunction with the production of art for the BFA annual exhibition, this seminar will examine, critique, and evaluate the student’s art within the context of contemporary art, professional practices, exhibition theory, and integrate theoretical and practical issues in 
the life of an artist. BFA majors only. A-F only. Pre: BFA major or consent. (Spring only)
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Graduation Portfolio (BA) (0)
desc: Required graduation portfolio for BA Art History and Art Studio students. BA ART majors only. Undergraduates only. CR/NC only. To be taken during the semester prior to expected graduation.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Professional Practice in the Arts: Creative, Career, and Leadership (3)
desc: Examination of the role of the artist in society, the artist as self, as community member, as teacher. Professional Practice skills in the arts; planning, grantsmanship, fundraising, budgeting, marketing, outreach, and media relations. ART majors only. Senior standing or graduate students only. A-F only.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Special Topics (V)
desc: Intensive and specialized work at advanced level in fields of special interest of visiting or resident faculty; (B) studio art; (C) art history. Repeatable three times per alpha, up to 12 credits. Junior standing or higher and instructor consent only.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Directed Work (V)
desc: Individual projects; tutorial. Maximum: 3 credit hours per semester; total 3 for BA, 6 for BFA. Pre: two 200-level or above art courses in area of directed work, as well as consent of instructor and department associate chair
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Study Abroad-Art History (3)
desc: Intensive study of advanced topics in art history at a UH Mānoa-approved study abroad institution. (B) introductory; (C) upper-division. Repeatable one time per alpha. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Study Abroad-Studio Art (3)
desc: Intensive study of topics in studio art at a UH Mānoa approved study abroad institution. (B) introductory; (C) upper-division. Repeatable one time per alpha. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art Museums and Preservation Practices (3)
desc: Introduction to collections management and preservation techniques, incorporating both theoretical and practical approaches, and including hands-on work with the collections of the John Young Museum. Junior standing or higher. A-F only.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Exhibition Design and Gallery Management (3)
desc: Design theory and techniques for presentation of artworks and mounting exhibitions. Pre: junior standing.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Hawaiian Art (3)
desc: Integrated beginning studio art course, which offers students the opportunity to understand and express Hawaiian cultural perspectives through contemporary art practice. A-F only.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Sculpture—Contemporary (3)
desc: Contextualization of late 20th/early 21st century sculptural practice, including stylistic and theoretical frameworks, with references to influences of various historical Western and Asian traditions and applying this knowledge in the creation of sculpture. Pre: 116 and 176, or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Utilitarian Sculpture (3)
desc: The design and construction of objects intended for use/interaction. Emphasis on wood and synthetic materials. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Sculpture—Small-Scale (3)
desc:
Fabrication and casting of forms on a small scale such as jewelry. The development of related practices, concepts, and historical references. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 or 
consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Sculpture—Metal Fabrication (3)
desc: Metal fabrication and development of associated practices, concepts, and historical references. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Kinetic Sculpture (3)
desc: The design and construction of objects incorporating movement as an integral element of their content. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Sculpture—Figure Modeling (3)
desc: Figure modeling, mold making, and casting. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Sculpture—Carving, Mixed Media (3)
desc: Investigations of traditional and contemporary carving concepts and methods. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Sculpture—Metal Casting (3)
desc: Metal casting and development of associated practices and concepts. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Intermediate Printmaking (3)
desc: Intermediate level specialization in either intaglio, lithography, screenprinting, or relief printmaking. Concentration on the techniques and formats of color printing and sequential image development. Repeatable two times. Pre: (with a minimum grade of B) two of 215, 217, 218, or 316.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Lithography (3)
desc: Studio practice in concepts and techniques of making prints from lithographic limestone and plates. Pre: (with a minimum grade of B) 215 or 217 or 218.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Relief Printmaking (3)
desc: Studio practice in the techniques and concepts of woodblock, linoleum cut, monotype, and calligraph printmaking. Emphasis on both traditional and contemporary practices. A-F only. Pre: 113.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Screenprinting (3)
desc: Studio practice in screenprinting on paper. Copy camera and basic photo-stencil techniques introduced. A-F only. Pre: 113.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Intaglio Printmaking (3)
desc: Studio practice in concepts and techniques of making prints from metal plates including etching, engraving, aquatint, and drypoint. A-F only. Pre: 113.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Printmaking (3)
desc: Foundation explorations in the processes of relief, intaglio, and stencil printmaking. Direct workshop studio experience in the basic techniques and concepts of wood cut, linoleum cut, drypoint, monotype, and basic stencil processes.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Advanced Photographic Techniques (3)
desc:
Emphasis on aesthetic and critical analysis. (B) digital color photography and printing; (C) 
hand-applied emulsion. Each alpha is repeatable one time with consent. Pre: 107D and 202 with a minimum grade of B for (B); 202 and 207 with a minimum grade of B for (C).
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Advanced Lighting (3)
desc: Emphasis on aesthetic and critical analysis. Techniques covered include continuous light, strobe and handheld flash. Repeatable one time with consent. Pre: 107D and 202 with a minimum grade of B.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Intermediate Photo (Black and White Darkroom) (3)
desc: Black and white photography emphasizing communication and self-expression. Lectures, demonstrations, and projects. Student must supply camera and material. Pre: 107B (with a minimum grade of B).
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Introduction to Photography (3)
desc: Studio/lecture combining history, theory and practice of photography. (B) film and darkroom, students must have 35mm film-based camera with adjustable shutter speed, aperture, and light meter; (D) digital, students must have digital camera with manual control and image editing software.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Advanced Studio (3)
desc: Individual and team investigations of complex problems in graphic design. Emphasis on projects with actual clients (when available) and/or independent investigations addressing advanced and current questions in the graphic design field. BFA majors only. ART majors only. A-F only. Pre: with a minimum grade of B- for (465 and 466) and credit for 465L. (Spring only)
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Production Techniques Lab (1)
desc: Advanced study of digital media for graphic designers. Focuses on skills and specific technical information to complement material covered in 467. BFA majors only. CR/NC only. Pre: 465 and 465L and 466. Co-requisite: 467. (Spring only)
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Production Techniques (3)
desc: Advanced techniques in design production from printed and digital media. BFA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 465, 465L, and 466; or consent. Co-requisite: 467L. (Spring only)
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Typography III (3)
desc: Advanced typographic design. Exploration of 2D, 3D, electronic, and intermedia. Emphasis on contemporary typographic models. BFA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 365, 365L, and 366; or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Studio III Lab (1)
desc: Advanced instruction in the Macintosh computer environment, including software and peripheral devices. Instruction in image manipulation and editing still video images for the web, CD, DVD, and portable interface devices. BFA majors only. CR/NC only. Pre: 365, 365L, and 366; or consent. Co-requisite: 465.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Studio III (3)
desc: Advanced graphic design. Emphasis on postmodernist theory, context, audience, and alternative media. BFA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 365, 365L, and 366; or consent. Co-requisite: 465L.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Typography II (3)
desc: Intermediate typographic design, exploration of word and text composition in the context of multiple-page structures. A-F only. Pre: 113, 116, 175, 176, 265, 266; or consent. Co-requisite: 365 and 365L.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Studio II Lab (1)
desc: Intermediate instruction in the Macintosh computer environment, software, and peripheral devices, including intermediate layout. Introduction to graphic design industry standard multi-media and web design programs. CR/NC only. Pre: 265, 265L, and 266; or consent. Co-requisite: 365.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Studio II (3)
desc: Intermediate graphic design. Emphasis on communication problems involving process and analysis. Introduction to modernist precedents and information theory. A-F only. Pre: 113, 116, 175, 176, 265, 266; or consent. Co-requisite: 365L and 366.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Typography I (3)
desc: Introduction to typography. Exploration of letterform and word compositions in the context of single-page structures. ART 176 is recommended as a prerequisite. A-F only. Pre: 113 or consent. Co-requisite: 265 and 265L.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Studio I Lab (1)
desc: Beginning instruction in the Macintosh computer environment, including hardware, software, and lab networking as it relates to graphic design production. ART 176 is recommended as a prerequisite. CR/NC only. Pre: 113 or consent. Co-requisite: 265 and 266.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Design: Studio I (3)
desc:
Introduction to graphic design. Explorations of rhetorical and semiotic structures and their relationship to visual form and content. ART 176 is recommended as a prerequisite. 
A-F only. Pre: 113 or consent. Co-requisite: 265L and 266.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Advanced Glass (3)
desc: Glass as an expressive medium. Individual problems; construction of studio equipment. Readings and discussions of contemporary glass issues. Repeatable one time. Pre: Two of the following: 230, 234, 303, 306.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Lost Wax Glass Casting (3)
desc: Glass kiln casting techniques, lost wax fuse casting, pâte de verre. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 and 130.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Kiln-Formed Glass (3)
desc: Expressive explorations in the use of kiln-formed, fusible-sheet glasses and enameling on glass. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 and 130.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Cold Glass Fabrication (3)
desc: Expressive explorations using architectural sheet glass. Development of 2D and 3D forms using engraving, sandblasting, and cold joinery techniques. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 and 130.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Glass Casting: Sand and Metal Molds (3)
desc: Expressive explorations in glass casting with wet sand, bonded sand, and metal molds. Repeatable one time. Pre: 116 and 130.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Glass (3)
desc: Basic techniques of working with cold and molten glass. Theory of glass studio operation and introduction to glass theory.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Installation/Performance–Material in Context (3)
desc: Studio investigation of the transformation of space (ecological, social, political, psychological) through artist intervention. Experiments in non-object based interventions and into the evocative potential of materials. Engages writing and oral expression as significant analytical tools. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 116 or consent. (Cross-listed as SUST 439)
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Use, Re-use, and Radical Re-use (3)
desc: Explores the related concepts of use, re-use, and radical re-use through an exploration of new applications of traditional fiber techniques and contexts of making. Engages writing as a significant tool for art-making and analysis. A-F only. Pre: 116 or consent. (Cross-listed as SUST 436)
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Fiber Sculpture—Endurance and Impermanence (3)
desc: Studio exploration in contemporary dimensional fiber using both conventional and nonconventional materials and processes. Emphasis on concept development, sensitivity to the evocative potential of materials, context, surface treatment and its relationship to concept and structure. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 116 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Papermaking (3)
desc: Studio emphasis on handmade papermaking techniques, conceptual exploration in two and three dimensions. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 116 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Inter-woven Structures (3)
desc: Studio investigation of threads under tension. Thematic lens of environmental vulnerability and resiliency. Explores art practice as embodied knowledge. Specific attention to weaving as meaning and place-making. Engages writing as a significant tool for analysis. A-F only. Pre: 116 or consent. (Cross-listing as SUST 338)
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Advanced Electronic Arts Studio (3)
desc: Tutorial studio that encourages exploration in combined and new media through independent work within an environment of theoretical and critical discourse. Repeatable one time. Pre: 301 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Electronic Arts Studio (3)
desc: (6 Lec/ Lab) Combined theory and practice studio course(s) that investigate language, processes, and personalized composing systems related to the use of technological media and its application to a variety of contemporary art areas and related disciplines. (B) imaging systems; (C) sound; (D) interactive systems. Pre: 201 and one 200-level studio; or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Electronic Arts (3)
desc: Theory and practice course investigating language common to all arts activity particularly as related to the contemporary arts. Pre: any studio art course; or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Painting from Life (3)
desc: Painting from the model; a survey of the figurative tradition. Repeatable one time. Pre: 123 or 223, and 214.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Advanced Painting I (3)
desc: Studio practice in painting emphasizing contemporary developments in art. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 223 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Advanced Color (3)
desc: Theory and application of color as related to studio practice. Pre: 113.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Intermediate Life Drawing (3)
desc: Further investigations of the figure concerning anatomical and diagramatic construction, light, space, and thematic content. Repeatable one time. Pre: 214 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Advanced Drawing (3)
desc: Studio practice in drawing emphasizing contemporary developments in art. Repeatable one time. Pre: 213 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Painting/Water-Based Media (3)
desc: An introduction to water-based media. Traditional transparent color, gouache and acrylics. Pre: 113 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Approaches to Painting (3)
desc: Theory and practice of painting; contemporary conceptual and expressive approaches. Pre: 113.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Life Drawing (3)
desc: Investigations of the figure concerning anatomical construction, light, space, diagramatic analysis, and thematic content. Pre: 113 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Intermediate Drawing (3)
desc: Extension of the observational foundation established in 113 to address contemporary conceptual and expressive approaches to drawing. Pre: 113 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Painting (3)
desc: Theory and practice of painting; material and technical procedures. A standalone course aimed at non-majors. ART majors should start with ART 223 after taking ART 113.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Digital Imaging: Alternative Printing (3)
desc: Combined theory and practice. Merges digital printing, mark-making, photography, and traditional printmaking. Includes image transfers, lifts, precoating techniques, as well as printing on alternative substrates such as watercolor papers, metals, and cloth. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 202 (with a minimum grade of B).
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Digital Imaging: Professional Printing (3)
desc: Combined theory and practice. Investigates industry standard methods for archival pigment printing. Techniques include: device calibration and profiling, black and white, coating techniques, mounting and adhesive techniques, professional portfolio presentation. A-F only. Pre: 202 (with a minimum grade of B).
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Digital Imaging (3)
desc: Combined theory and practice examining major techniques, concepts, and aesthetics in contemporary digital image production. Direct studio experience in essential software, printing techniques and hardware necessary in producing the gallery quality inkjet print. A-F only. Pre: 113.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Technical Ceramics (3)
desc: Clay body development, glaze development, empirical and calculation methods. Emphasis on glaze maturity, surface, and color. A-F only. Pre: 242, and one of 343, 344, or 345; or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: History of Western Ceramics (3)
desc: Western ceramics history from chronological, developmental, contextual, and theoretical standpoints; influence of Asian ceramics. Pre: 242, with 175 and 176 recommended; or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Ceramics—Low Temperature (3)
desc: Form and surface problems related to earthenware clay bodies and low-temperature glazes; mold-making for ceramics. Repeatable one time. Pre: 242 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Ceramics—Vessels (3)
desc: Exploration of the ceramic vessel as function, metaphor, and expression. Advanced hand-building, throwing, glazing, and firing techniques. Repeatable one time. Pre: 242 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Ceramics—Sculpture (3)
desc: Sculptural concepts and techniques specifically related to the medium of clay; advanced hand-building, throwing, glazing, and firing techniques. Repeatable one time. Pre: 242 or consent.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Ceramics (3)
desc: Three-dimensional concepts in clay; hand-building and wheel-throwing techniques. Projects, lectures, and demonstrations.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Orientalism and Visual Culture (3)
desc: Investigates artistic representations, appropriations, and exchanges constructed on the basis of East/Orient vs. West/Occident differences. Includes analysis of: Orientalizing artistic traditions throughout history, history and concept of Orient, post-colonial critique of Orientalism. A-F only. Pre: graduate standing or consent. (Alt. 2-3 years) (Cross-listed as ASAN 792)
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Seminar in South/Southeast Asian Art History (3)
desc: Selected topics in South and/or Southeast Asian art and architectural history with an emphasis on Hindu and Buddhist traditions. Repeatable unlimited times. Pre: consent, repeatable with consent.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Seminar in Japanese Art (3)
desc: Selected topics in Japanese art history. Pre: consent.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Seminar in Western Art History (3)
desc: Selected topics in European and American art history. Pre: consent.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Seminar in Global Contemporary Art (3)
desc: Selected topics in global contemporary art history. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Seminar in Contemporary Critical Theory (3)
desc:
Research and discussion seminar supporting advanced critical theory in the context 
of contemporary art and other creative practice. Pre: consent.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Topics in the Art of China (3)
desc: Research topics in the history of Chinese sculpture, ceramics, bronzes, jade, and textiles. A-F only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of Oceania (3)
desc: Arts from Polynesia, Melanesia, Micronesia explored in context of issues involving belief systems and cultural change. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 475C or consent.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art Historical Methodology (3)
desc: An introduction to art historiography, analytical techniques, and research methods and materials. Pre: consent and graduate standing.
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Topics in the History of Cinema (3)
desc: Specific period or national style of cinema studied in its historical context. Repeatable two times. A-F only. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: History of Modern Design (3)
desc: Major design movements in Europe and America from late 19th century to present; arts and crafts movement, art nouveau, modernist trends of the 20th century. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Photography: Critical Issues (3)
desc: Seminar on theoretical, ethical and aesthetic issues relating to the practice of photography, past and present. A-F only. Pre: 396B or 396C, or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of Islam (3)
desc: Major developments in art and architecture. Pre: 175 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Hindu Visual Culture (3)
desc: Art and architecture of South Asia in historical and cultural context. Hindu visual culture. Pre: 175 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Art of Southeast Asia (3)
desc: Critical analysis of the historical and cultural development of Buddhist and Hindu art in Southeast Asia; (B) island Southeast Asia; (C) mainland Southeast Asia. Repeatable one time for different alphas. Pre: 175 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Special Topics in Southeast Asian Art History (3)
desc:
Focused study of particular periods, regions and critical themes in Southeast Asian art 
and architectural history. (B) Angkor & art of Khmer civilization; (C) art & architecture of Thailand; (D) monuments & nationalism in Southeast Asia. Repeatable one time for up to two different alphas. A-F only. Pre: 175, or consent. (Once a year) (D Cross-listed as ANTH 491)
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Modern and Contemporary Art of China (3)
desc: Introduction to the arts of China in the modern and contemporary periods, in all media and genres, from 1840 to the present. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Traditional Chinese Painting (3)
desc: Stylistic and historic development of two-dimensional arts; painting and calligraphy from prehistory through 18th century. Pre: 175 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Contemporary Art in Hawai‘i (3)
desc: History of contemporary art in Hawai‘i: the institutions, artists, critics, and historians that have shaped it. Strong focus on oral history of Hawai‘i artists. A-F only. Pre: 176.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Contemporary Art and Ecology (3)
desc: Explores the recent history of environmental and ecological art; provides a critical framework for the contemporary image politics of environmentalism, ecology, sustainability, and climate change with an emphasis on writing and ethical reasoning. A-F only. Pre: 176 or consent.(Cross-listed as SUST 484)
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Applied Art of Japan (3)
desc: Ceramics, metalwork, lacquer, and textiles throughout Japanese history. Pre: 175 and 176; or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of Hawai‘i (3)
desc: Stylistic and aesthetic characteristics of art of ancient Hawai‘i; relationship to art from other parts of Polynesia. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of Indonesia (3)
desc: Architecture, sculpture, and textile traditions of indigenous Indonesia in cultural context. A-F only. Pre: 176.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Topics in Contemporary Art (3)
desc: Thematic approaches to contemporary art and visual culture. Course themes may include identity, local/global issues, and appropriation. Repeatable one time. A-F only. Pre: 176 or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of Tribal Africa (3)
desc: Visual form and function of arts in cultural context. Mali, Burkina Faso, Ivory Coast, Liberia, Guinea, Nigeria, Ghana, Cameroon, Congo, Zaire. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Art of the Pacific (3)
desc: Visual form and function of the arts in cultural context: (B) Melanesia and Australia; (C) Polynesia and Micronesia; (D) North Pacific coast Indian, Eskimo. Repeatable one time for different alphas. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Art Since 1945 (3)
desc: Art since 1945, with a focus on the global expansion of the avantgarde; (B) contemporary art 1945-2000; (C) global contemporary art since 2000. A-F only. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of the First Half of 20th Century (3)
desc: Development of modern art in Europe 1900–1939. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of the United States (3)
desc: Emphasis on the 18th and 19th centuries. Pre: 176 or AMST 202 or consent. (Cross-listed as AMST 456)
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Baroque and Rococo Art (3)
desc: Architecture, sculpture, and painting of Europe in the Baroque and Rococo periods. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) Renaissance Art (3)
desc: Painting, sculpture, and architecture: (B) early Renaissance in Italy; (C) northern Europe; (D) High Renaissance and mannerism in Italy. Repeatable one time for different alphas. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Early 20th Century American Art (3)
desc: American art in the first half of the 20th century and its impact on American culture. Junior standing or higher. Pre: 176 or consent. (Alt. years: fall) (Crosslisted as AMST 460)
metadata: Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: (Alpha) History of Photography (3)
desc: History of photography from its beginnings to the present; emphasis on the evolution of photography as an art form; (B) nineteenth century, from the invention of photography through pictorialism; (C) twentieth century, from World War I to the present. Repeatable one time for different alphas. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of Africa, Pacific, North America (3)
desc: Contextual study of art from selected areas in Africa, the Pacific, and North America. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Sculpture of China (3)
desc: Thematic introduction to sculpture in China from the Neolithic period through the present day. A-F only. Pre: 175.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art and Culture of Late China (3)
desc: A culturally oriented study of Chinese visual arts; emphasis on the rise of literati painting and theory individualism in art and theory, garden, and architecture, and the Chinese pursuit of modernity and post-modernity in art. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art and Culture of Early China (3)
desc: A culturally oriented study of Chinese visual arts; emphasis on jade, bronze, secular and religious sculptures, and paintings from prehistory to the 9th century. Pre: 175 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of Korea (3)
desc: Ceramics, sculpture, painting, and architecture; neolithic through Yi periods. Pre: 175 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Philippine Visual Art from Burial Jars to Burning Effigies (3)
desc: Introduction to the arts and material culture of the Philippines from the pre-colonial to the contemporary period through the examination of sculpture, metalwork, ceramics, textiles, and painting from various ethnolinguistic groups. Sophomore standing or higher. (Cross-listed as IP 382)
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Later Art of Japan (3)
desc: Major developments, Muromachi to modern period; painting, sculpture, architecture. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Early Art of Japan (3)
desc: Major developments, prehistoric through Kamakura; architecture, painting, sculpture. Pre: 175 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of the 19th Century (3)
desc: Architecture, sculpture, and painting of Europe. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art of Greece and Rome (3)
desc: Minoan and Mycenaean arts; Greece and Rome. Pre: 175 or consent. (Cross-listed as CLAS 373)
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Medieval Art (3)
desc: Arts of Europe from early Christian era to Renaissance. Pre: 175 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Art Historical Methodology (3)
desc: Introduction to the methods and approaches of art history. Students will develop skills in perception and comprehension of visual art forms, and a critical understanding of the methods used by art historians to analyze them. A-F only. Pre: 175 and 176 and consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Contemporary Critical Theory (3)
desc: Examination of the significant themes and issues in contemporary critical theory as they relate to the production and reception of art. Pre: 176 or consent.
metadata: DH Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Survey of Global Art II (3)
desc: Art produced in Asia, Africa, Native America, Europe, and the Pacific Islands, from the 15th century to the present. Religious and philosophical ideas expressed in architecture, painting, prints, sculpture, applied art, body art, and textiles. (Spring only)
metadata: FGB Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Survey of Global Art I (3)
desc: Art produced in Asia, Africa, Native America, Europe, and the Pacific Islands, from prehistory to the 15th century. Religious and philosophical ideas expressed in architecture, painting, prints, sculpture, applied art, body art, and textiles. (Fall only)
metadata: FGA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Three-Dimensional Composition (3)
desc: Basic concepts, elements, and principles of art.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to Drawing (3)
desc: Descriptive, expressive, and formal aspects of visual language through drawing practice.
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ART
title: Introduction to the Visual Arts (3)
desc: Nature of the world’s visual arts and their influences on personal expression. Lectures, demonstrations, and studio practice. (Not for art majors or minors)
metadata: DA Art & Art History (ART) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ARCH
title: Doctorate Project II Extension (3)
desc: Extension of the development of a doctorate project with an approved committee that advances architectural knowledge through research, scholarship, design, and engages theoretical and architectonic propositions. Repeatable one time. ARCH majors only. CR/NC only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: (Alpha) Doctorate Project II (6)
desc: Individual development of a doctorate project with an approved chair and doctorate project committee that advances architectural knowledge through analysis, research, scholarship, design, and engages theoretical and architectonic propositions; (H) Hawaii; (T) Tongji. Repeatable one time for (H). ARCH majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 784H for (H); 784T for (T).
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: (Alpha) Doctorate Project I (6)
desc: Individual development of a doctorate project with an approved chair and doctorate project committee that advances architectural knowledge through analysis, research, scholarship, and design; (H) Hawaii; (T) Tongji. Repeatable one time for (H). ARCH majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 747C or 747P or 747E for (H); 750C or 750G for (T).
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Case Study and Analysis (3)
desc: Individual development of a case study project that advances architectural knowledge through analysis, research, scholarship, design, and engages theoretical and architectonic propositions. ARCH majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: instructor consent.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Advanced Research Methods and Design Inquiry (3)
desc: Individual development of a Doctorate Project or MArch Capstone proposal that advances architectural knowledge through analysis, research, scholarship, and design. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: 739.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture History (3)
desc: Investigation of architectural history and theory in the world from antiquity to present. Examining social, political, technological, material, and environmental forces. ARCH majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: (Alpha) Capstone Studio (V)
desc: Advanced landscape architectural design inquiry and applied research investigation. Serves as a capstone experience, synthesizing theory, values, and practice. Limited to MLA students under Plan B. (D) design (6 credits); (R) research (3 credits). Repeatable one time per alpha, up to 18 credits. LAND majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 743 and 763.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Advanced Project Design Studio: Comprehensive (6)
desc: Design and programming for a complex, medium-scale, multi-layered urban landscape architecture project. Iterative, advanced design inquiry and materials exploration. Production of in-depth, comprehensive design development and partial construction documents. LAND majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 634, 635, 743, and 761.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Ecology, Community, and Design (6)
desc: Exploration of the interaction of landscape and community necessities in urban ecological design. Studio problems, design research projects, lectures, and discussion applied to the integration of ecological and social factors in urban contexts. LAND majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 483 and 652.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Advanced Global Practice (3)
desc: Comprehensive study of architectural practice investigating architect’s response to global forces, including entrepreneurial practice, office organization, project delivery, compensation, and construction law. A-F only. Pre: 745.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Research Seminar (3)
desc: Varied topics furthering knowledge and ability needed for professional design practice emphasizing communication methods for collaborative and integrated design using digital technologies. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: 739.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: (Alpha) Architecture Studio (6)
desc: Urban design focused on investigating social, cultural, political, and technological factors; study of historical precedents, building/block typology, circulation, infrastructure, and context response. (C) China; (G) design research. A-F only. ARCH Global Track only. Graduate standing only. Pre: 744 for (C); 739 and 743 for (G).
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: (Alpha) Research Studio in Professional Setting (6)
desc: Scholarly and research activity combined with professional experience occurring in an off campus location. (C) China; (G) global. ARCH majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 743 for (C).
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: (Alpha) Professional Studio (V)
desc: Scholarly and research activity combined with professional experience occurring in an off-campus location. (B) business; (C) community design; (E) alternative experience; (G) global; (H) Hawai‘i; (P) practicum; (T) China. Repeatable one time per alpha. ARCH majors only. Graduate standing only for (G), (H), and (T). A-F only. Pre: 744, and 750C or 750G for (B), (G), and (T); 744 and 745 for (H); 726, 744, 745, 750G, and 781 for (C), (E), and (P).
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Advanced Practice (3)
desc: Comprehensive study of architectural practice investigating architect’s response to global forces, including entrepreneurial practice, office organization, project delivery, compensation, and construction law. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: 739 and 743.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture Studio V: Comprehensive Design (6)
desc: Design and programming for a moderately complex building and site. Production of design development and partial construction documents describing sustainable building assemblies and construction cost. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: 724, 725, 733, and 743. Co-requisite: 726.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture Studio IV: Urban Design (6)
desc: Urban design focused on Asian cities investigating social, cultural, political, and technological factors; study of historical precedents, building/block typology, circulation, infrastructure, and context response. ARCH and LAND majors only. A-F only. Pre: 733 and 742, or 761.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture Studio III (6)
desc: Design of complex, large scale building and site engaging social, cultural, code, sustainable systems, and acoustic issues. Production of schematic and design development documents. ARCH majors only. Graduate standing only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture Studio I: Intro to Design (6)
desc:
Design theories and systematic analytic and synthetic methodologies applied to creation of 
building and site spaces responsive to environmental and human needs. Several individual projects. ARCH majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Research Methods Seminar (3)
desc: Comprehensive assessment of objectives and function of research in architecture and landscape architecture. Lecture, seminar, independent work with emphasis on research project topic and proposal development. ARCH and LAND majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 715 or 761.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Advanced Design Communications III (3)
desc: Interdisciplinary investigation of design theory as connected to architectural presentation techniques, particularly oral and written, to current developments in architectural practice. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Forms and Frames of Practice (3)
desc: Comprehensive study of architectural practice within the global context with emphasis on the Asia Pacific region. Exploration of information technology systems, materials and design process research, construction technology, computer aided manufacturing, and entrepreneurial approaches. ARCH majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Advanced Design Communication II (3)
desc: (Lec, Lab) An interdisciplinary investigation of design theory as connected to digital technology and its applications to current developments in practice and research within architecture and design. ARCH majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Advanced Design Communication I (3)
desc: (Lec, Lab) Exploration of digital technologies, their relationship to design, and their application to architectural analysis, conceptualization, design processes, communication, representation, and construction. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: departmental approval.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture Systems V: Building Systems Integration (3)
desc: Properties, evolution, and range of building m aterials, assemblies, and systems and their applications in integrated high-performance building design with a focus on the role of detail and systems in the design process. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: 724, 725, and 733. Co-requisite: 744.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture Systems IV: Environmental Technology, Sustainability, and Analysis (3)
desc: Application and analysis of highperformance building design principles. Emphasis on climate-appropriate passive design, energy-efficient lighting and conditioning strategies, innovative water systems, and renewable energy production. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: 723.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture Systems III: Quantitative Structural Analysis and Design (3)
desc: Introduction to procedures and wood, steel, concrete, and masonry material properties used for structural analysis and design of individual structural elements and building structural systems. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: 723.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture Systems II: Qualitative Bioclimatic and Structural Performance (3)
desc: Introduction to the theory of bioclimatic principles and structural systems and the ability to analyze, assess, select, design, and integrate them as initial determinants into the building design. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: graduate status.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture Systems I: Introduction to Systems (3)
desc: Study of building materials, assemblies, and integrated design including structural, environmental, life-safety, and building envelope systems. Development of ability to design, analyze and assess appropriate systems. ARCH majors only. A-F only. Pre: MATH 140X.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Architecture and Urban Design Theory (3)
desc: Detailed investigation of major theories in architecture and urban design and examination of their impact on contemporary architectural practice in varied geo-political contexts. Open to non-majors. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Asia-Pacific Architectural History and Theory (3)
desc: Study of the history and theory of culture and the built environment with particular focus on the Asia-Pacific region. ARCH majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: MLA Thesis (V)
desc:
Landscape architectural thesis research and design inquiry. Limited to MLA students under Plan A. Repeatable unlimited times. LAND majors only. Graduate students only. 
Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Directed Work (V)
desc: ARCH and LAND majors only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Special Topics in Landscape Architecture (3)
desc:
Seminar on a wide range of landscape architectural topics to be directed by both 
visiting and regular faculty. Repeatable three times. ARCH and LAND majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Applied Theories of Landscape Architecture (3)
desc: Graduate seminar on discussion of central ideas and theories in landscape architecture and environmental design, drawing on primary literature and speculative or built design work over many decades of thought. ARCH and LAND majors only, or consent. Graduate students only. A-F only. (Cross-listed as SUST 695)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Special Topics in Architecture and Design (3)
desc: Intensive work on specialized topics in the fields of architecture and design. May include research and/or studio experiences in architecture, interior architecture, computer-aided design, professional practice, advanced visual design, and architectural graphics. Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Special Topics in Architectural Technology (3)
desc: Specialized investigation at an advanced level of technological developments in structural systems, environmental control systems, or materials and methods of construction. Repeatable unlimited times.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Special Topics Seminar (3)
desc: Seminar on a wide range of architectural topics to be directed by both visiting and regular faculty. Repeatable three times. ARCH and LAND majors only. Pre: consent
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Culture & Urban Form in Asia (3)
desc: Cultural and historical impact on urban form, contention of tradition and modernity in urban space, spatial expression of state and society, perception and utilization of urban design, evolution of urban form in selected Asian capitals. Pre: 341, ASAN 312, PLAN 310 or PLAN 600. (Cross-listed as ASAN 636 and PLAN 636)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Building Well-Being: Health and the Built Environment (3)
desc: History, concepts, and theories behind the relationship between health and the built environment stressing transdisciplinary understanding and collaboration through readings, discussion, and real world-based exercises. LAND, ARCH, and PLAN majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. (Crosslisted as PLAN 682)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Elements of Style (3)
desc: The manifestations, visual characteristics, and social/ cultural meaning of “style” in American architecture and decorative arts from the early settlement period through the present. (Cross-listed as AMST 679)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Environmental Landscape Technologies and Systems (3)
desc: Understanding the science and art of green landscape technologies, with a comprehensive understanding of LID (low impact design) principles and practices; to increase knowledge to help produce more viable and enduring built landscapes. LAND majors only. A-F only. (Crosslisted as TPSS 658)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Environmental and Cultural Landscape Studio (4)
desc: Exploring, understanding, and implementing Hawaiian and Western cultural and environmental landscape design principles. A concentrated look at how to think about creating and respecting a sense of place through landscape design. LAND and TPSS majors only. A-F only. (Cross-listed as TPSS 656)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Site Design Studio (6)
desc: Landscape project design at the site scale; from concept development through detailed design. Synthesis of foundational skills into more complex, layered spatial, and functional problems. Emphasis on site research and design methods. LAND majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Fundamentals of Landscape Design Studio (6)
desc: Theory and application of foundational landscape design principles, programming, and physical analysis to site-based design problems. Visual, formal, spatial, and functional design principles are applied to ecological and cultural influences in landscape design. LAND majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Vernacular Architecture (3)
desc: Methods and approaches in the study of vernacular architecture, cultural landscapes and material culture, with an emphasis on traditions and innovations in the Americas. (Cross-listed as AMST 681)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Land Use Planning (3)
desc: Issues and methods of urban land use planning practice and plan making. A-F only. Pre: PLAN 640 or consent. (Crosslisted as PLAN 645)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Landscape Architectural Professional Practice (3)
desc:
Introduction of practices and core methods of the landscape architecture profession. 
Subjects include business and governmental organization, elements of contract law, business management, professional relationships, marketing, professional licensure, and ethics. LAND majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 634 and 635.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Landscape Materials and Construction (3)
desc: Examination of materials and methods of landscape construction from source, extraction, and manufacturing, to use and reuse. Assignments include drawing standard construction details and a report on the history of material use, properties, and qualities. LAND majors only. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: 381.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Landscape Plants: Identification and Use (3)
desc: Introduction to the identification, recognition, and use of plants in landscape design and built environment applications. Students will be introduced to a variety of landscape plants commonly used in Hawai‘i and the tropics. LAND majors only. A-F only. (Cross-listed as TPSS 634)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Computer Applications in Landscape Architecture (3)
desc: Introduction to the use of computers in landscape architecture, emphasizing two- and three dimensional computer-aided drawings and graphics suitable to landscape architectural design and practice. LAND majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Design Communication for Landscape Architects (3)
desc:
Theory and application in design communication, including drawing and presentation 
skills; emphasis on the design process and critical thinking through analog and digital media, diagramming, three-dimensional modeling, and various other presentation techniques. LAND majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Preservation: Theory and Practice (3)
desc: History and philosophy of historic preservation movement. Analysis of values and assumptions, methodologies and tactics, implications for society and public policy. (Cross-listed as PLAN 675)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Special Topics in Architecture and Writing (V)
desc: Reading, research, and work on topics in architecture and design. Includes an intensive writing component. May include specialized research and/or studio experience in architecture, design, and the history and theory of architecture and design. ENVD majors only. Pre: 100 and 101.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Special Topics in Architecture and Design (3)
desc: Work on specialized topics in the fields of architecture and design. May include research and/or studio experiences in architecture, interior architecture, computer-aided design, professional practice, advanced visual design, and architectural graphics. Repeatable unlimited times. ARCH and ENVD majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Special Topics in Architectural Technology (3)
desc: Specialized investigation of technological developments in structural systems, environmental control systems, or materials and methods of construction. Repeatable unlimited times. ARCH and ENVD majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Special Topics in Architecture History (3)
desc: Specialized work on the history and theory of architecture. Repeatable unlimited times. ARCH and ENVD majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Special Topics (3)
desc: Selected topics in any aspect of architecture. Content to be announced. Repeatable four times. ARCH and ENVD majors only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Plants in Design (3)
desc: Introduction to the use of plants as design elements in the built environment across diverse scales. Examination of the spatial, sensory, ecological, and performative qualities of vegetation through analysis of historic and contemporary examples. ENVD and LAND majors only. A-F only. Pre: 381.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Urban Ecological Analysis and Design (3)
desc: Applied urban and landscape ecology principles and strategies for analysis, design, and management of urban regions and sites; emphasis on structure, functions, and processes that form urban landscapes at multiple scales and in diverse contexts. ENVD and LAND majors only. A-F only. Pre: 381.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Preservation: Hawai‘i, Asia, and the Pacific (3)
desc:
Lectures and discussions on historic preservation issues in Hawai‘i, Asia, and the Pacific. 
Emphasis on indigenous and national expressions. ARCH and ENVD majors only. Pre: junior standing or consent. (Cross-listed as AMST 474)
metadata: DH Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: History of American Architecture (3)
desc: History of American architecture in terms of style, techniques, and symbolic meaning. ARCH and ENVD majors only. (Cross-listed as AMST 423)
metadata: DH Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Documentation of Historic Architecture (V)
desc: Study and documentation of existing buildings, structures, and sites of historic and/or cultural significance, including field measurements and drawings, historical research, photo documentation, and preparation of archival drawings to be deposited in the Library of Congress. Documentation conducted according to standards of the Historic American Buildings Survey/Historic American Engineering Record (HABS/HAER). Repeatable three times, up to 24 credits. ARCH, ENVD, and AMST majors only. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as AMST 475)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Design Exchange (3)
desc: Seminar centered on academic and cultural exchanges, focused on advanced topics related to the design of built environments. ARCH majors only. A-F only.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Digital Design Synthesis (3)
desc: Investigation of processes for generating architectonic form using current digital technologies. Making advanced geometric models including investigation of morphological transformations. Study of design optimization, digital fabrication, information modeling, and generative algorithms. ARCH and ENVD majors only. A-F only. Pre: 235.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Professional Practice Law and Ethics (3)
desc: Knowledge of professional standards and a broad understanding of the practice of architecture, including professionalism; ethical conduct; public, client, consultant, contractor, and government relations; project administration, contracts, procedures, and compensation; land use and construction law. ENVD majors only. A-F only. Pre: 341.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Construction Project Management (3)
desc: Introductory treatment of the management of construction. Construction supervision, contract documents, estimating and bidding, organization, planning and scheduling, administration, business methods, safety, and labor. ARCH and ENVD majors only. A-F only. (Cross-listed as CEE 472)
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Concentration Design Studio (6)
desc: Professional experience combined with scholarly and research activity occurring in an off-campus location with a focus on architectural concentration areas. ARCH and ENVD majors only. A-F only. Pre: 342.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Directed Work (V)
desc: ARCH and ENVD majors only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Landform and Water (3)
desc: Essential topographic site design concepts and skills needed to reshape the land for human use, circulation, water management, and resilience. Topics will be reinforced through problem sets and analytical, computational, graphical, and technical exercises. ENVD and LAND majors only. A-F only. Pre: 201 and 220.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Design Theory (3)
desc:
Examination of theories, movements, and periods in architectural history focusing on contemporary issues. Requires a minimum of 4,000 words of writing, and three oral 
communication assignments. ARCH and ENVD majors only. A-F only. Pre: 201, 220, 271, and 272.
metadata: Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Tropical Landscape Planting Design Studio (4)
desc:
Students will develop basic skills of residential landscape graphic and design processes in 
order to clearly articulate the ability to think, analyze, and extend a physical solution in the proper scale. Repeatable one time. ARCH and ENVD majors only. A-F only. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as TPSS 354)
metadata: DA Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Landscape Graphics Studio (4)
desc: Basic skills of landscape graphic communication through a creative process model. Learning free hand and technical drafting techniques to creative effective landscape graphics. ARCH and ENVD majors only. Pre: consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as TPSS 353)
metadata: DA Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Landscape Architecture History (3)
desc: Survey of the history of landscape architecture from Mesopotamia to present. Review of the physical, cultural, social, economic, and political factors, as well as the environmental concerns, horticultural techniques, and technological innovations of historic landscapes. ENVD and LAND majors only. A-F only. (Spring only) (Cross-listed as TPSS 352)
metadata: DH Architecture (ARCH) School of Architecture

subject: ARCH
title: Intermediate Design Studio II (4)
