desc: Survey of major critical works in fields of performing arts and public culture (e.g., dance, theater, music, commemoration). Topics include: theoretical application for the discipline of American studies, and the impact of social movements and labor migration on the performing arts. (Cross-listed as WGSS 614)
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Advanced Topics: American West (3)
desc: Examination of the U.S. colonization of the American West. Topics include: European-indigenous relations, migration and labor, regional literature, frontier ideology, ethnic conflict, and new community formation. A-F only. Pre: graduate standing and consent. (Cross-listed as HIST 639F)
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Women in American Culture (3)
desc: Historical/contemporary status of women in the U.S.; women’s roles as defined by legal, educational, political, economic, and social institutions; implications for social science method. (Cross-listed as WGSS 612)
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Asian America (3)
desc: The Asian American experience from an interdisciplinary and humanities perspective. Asian American history, literature, media, and theater arts. Comparative study of Hawai‘i and the Continental U.S.
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Early America (3)
desc: Interdisciplinary approach to understanding early American culture and history. Repeatable one time. Pre: graduate standing or consent. (Alt. years) (Cross-listed as HIST 632B)
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Advanced Research and Professional Development (3)
desc: Prepares advanced graduate students to present original research findings to colleagues, write for peer review, design undergraduate classes in their areas of expertise, and participate actively in their fields. Graduate students only. A-F only. Pre: (600 and 601) with a minimum grade of B-.
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Patterns of American Cultures (3)
desc: American cultural origins and development.
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Approaches to American Studies (3)
desc: Introductory survey of methodological issues underlying research in American studies.
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Readings in American Studies (V)
desc: Directed readings and research for majors. Pre: consent.
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: (Alpha) Topics in American Studies (3)
desc: Themes, problems, and issues not addressed in other American studies undergraduate courses, focused within these areas: (B) social structure and interaction; (D) arts and environment. Repeatable one time. Pre: junior standing or consent for (D).
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: World Maritime History (3)
desc: Survey of world maritime history from earliest times to the present, with emphasis on the evolution of nautical technology, motives from maritime enterprises, and the impact of cross-cultural encounters between oceanic peoples. (Cross-listed as HIST 489)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Senior Capstone Project (3)
desc: Capstone course for American studies students to undertake a major research-based project. AMST majors only. Pre: consent.
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Documentation of Historic Architecture (V)
desc: Study and documentation of existing buildings, structures, sites of historic and/or cultural significance, including field measurements and drawings, historical research, photo documentation, and preparation of archival drawings to be deposited in the Library of Congress. Documentation conducted according to standards of the Historic American Buildings Survey/ Historic American Engineering Record (HABS/ HAER). Repeatable three times, up to 24 credits. AMST, ARCH, and HIS majors only. Pre: consent. (Cross-listed as ARCH 472)
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Preservation: Hawai‘i, Asia, and the Pacific (3)
desc: Lectures and discussions on historic preservation issues in Hawai‘i, Asia, and the Pacific. Emphasis on indigenous and national expressions. Pre: junior standing or consent. (Cross-listed as ARCH 474)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Religion, Sex, and Gender in the U.S. (3)
desc: Examines religious and ethical conflicts about sexuality and gender nonconformity in contemporary America. Students gain knowledge, practical wisdom, and communication skills to negotiate moral disagreement in a pluralistic society. Pre: junior standing or consent.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Experience in Asia (3)
desc: Examination of various forms of U.S. engagement with Asia, with particular attention to the role of Hawai‘i as the site, agent, and object of engagement. Emphasis on developing critical reading and expository writing skills.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: America and Africa (3)
desc: American attitudes toward Africa, as well as how Africa has functioned within the dynamics of American culture and history.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: America’s World Role (3)
desc: Examination of America’s role in modern world affairs, against the background of history, perceptions, and values.
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Early 20th Century American Art (3)
desc: American art in the first half of the 20th century and its impact on American culture. Junior standing or higher. Pre: ART 176 or consent. (Alt. years: fall) (Cross-listed as ART 460)
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Sports in America (3)
desc: Sports as reflected in literature, films, and TV. Focus on ethical dimensions of sports and sporting cultures; writing emphasis.
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Film in American Culture (3)
desc: Comprehensive survey of varieties of film experience from historical and contemporary points of view.
metadata: DL American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Museum Interpretations (3)
desc: Studies the interpretive strategies and methods used by museums to communicate with visitors in museums, art galleries, historic sites, parks, and related places. Considers how interpretations contribute to cultural knowledge. Repeatable one time. Pre: consent. (Crosslisted as ART 481)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Art of the United States (3)
desc: Emphasis on the 18th and 19th centuries. Pre: 202 or ART 176, or consent. (Cross-listed as ART 472)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: U.S. Women’s Literature and Culture (3)
desc: Reading of selected works of U.S. women’s literature and cultural texts (such as art and film). Emphasis on historical and cultural context and diverse expressions of women’s gendered identities. (Cross-listed as ENG 455 and WGSS 445)
metadata: DL American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Fashioning America (3)
desc: Examines linkages between American identity, representation, labor and capital through fashion theory, clothing discourses and other practices of textile production over history. Pre: junior standing or consent.
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Culture, Society, and Literature (3)
desc: Literary and non-fictive exploration of the intellectual and moral response of Americans to institutions and culture of 20th-century marketplace economy.
metadata: DL American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: The ’20s and ’30s (3)
desc: Novelists, painters, poets, jazz musicians as examples of culture of the 1920s and 1930s in America.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Popular Culture (3)
desc: Major themes, modes, and media of popular or mass culture in the U.S.; emphasis on cultural trends and social implications.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Victims, Virtue, and Violence (3)
desc: Examination of the history and significance of melodrama as a dominant mode of American cultural production from the early republic to the present, with a focus on issues of race, gender, and national identity.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Gender in Action Cinema (3)
desc: Investigates gender representation in the evolving genre of American action cinema through combined stylistic and cultural analysis, with special attention to the relationship of gendered action to categories of morality, race, class, and nation. Junior standing or consent. (Cross-listed as WGSS 466)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Racism, American Culture and Film/ Media (3)
desc: An exploration of the critique of racial ideologies in American film. The course also examines how aggrieved communities develop cultural sensibilities, aesthetic choices and politicized identities through film, video and media work.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Social Movements (3)
desc: Examination of mass mobilization in U.S. history from the Revolution forward, including abolitionism, feminism, civil rights, labor, and more. Concludes with analysis of various community organizing efforts today.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Race and Racism in America (3)
desc: Racial ideas and ideologies, and their effects throughout American history. (Cross-listed as HIST 476)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Women and Globalization in Asia (3)
desc: History, culture, and contemporary reality of Asian women in Asia and the U.S. Includes critical analysis of American feminist methodology and theory. Pre: one of 310, 316, 318, 373, 455, POLS 339, WGSS 360, WGSS 361, WGSS 439; or consent. (Cross-listed as POLS 372 and WGSS 462)
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Gender, Justice and Law (3)
desc: Exploration of landmark U.S. Supreme Court cases related to sex and gender. Topics may include sex discrimination, sexual orientation discrimination, privacy, and reproductive freedom. A-F only. Pre: one of WGSS 151, WGSS 175, WGSS 176, WGSS 202, WGSS 360, WGSS 381, or consent. (Cross-listed as POLS 368 and WGSS 436)
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: History of Crime and Punishment (3)
desc: History of American crime and punishment from 18th century to the present. Topics: changing crime patterns, evolving punishment methods, penal reform movements, convict resistance, growth of prison industrial complex, racism, class, and gender. Pre: junior standing or consent.
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Politics in Hawai‘i (3)
desc: Discussion of modern politics against the background of recent history and major contemporary issues.
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Islands, Empires, and the Arts (3)
desc: Colonialism, neocolonialism, and cultures of resistance in the Caribbean and its North American diaspora through literature, film, and the arts. Focus on political dissent; nation building; historical memory; construction of gender, race. Writing emphasis. Junior standing or higher. A-F only
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Slavery and Freedom (3)
desc: Examines the history of slavery, race, and abolition in the Americas from a comparative, global perspective, and traces the legacy of slavery in the post-emancipation societies of the New World. (Cross-listed as HIST 473)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: History of American Workers (3)
desc: Conditions of labor in major phases of American development; response of labor and community to changing work environment. Capitalism, unionism, race, gender, law, etc. Emphasis on 20th century. (Cross-listed as HIST 477)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Environmental History (3)
desc: Survey history of the complex relations between American societies and diverse U.S. ecosystems, from European contact and colonization to the present. (Cross-listed as HIST 480 and SUST 481)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: History of American Architecture (3)
desc: History of American architecture in terms of style, techniques, and symbolic meaning. (Cross-listed as ARCH 473)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Ideas of Nature (3)
desc: The natural world in American thought from Native Americans to modern ecologists.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Hawai‘i’s Multiculturalism (3)
desc: A multidisciplinary examination of the dynamics of the Hawaiian Islands’ racial and cultural diversity from the perspectives of historical trends, social processes, and contemporary political, social, and economic issues as they impact interracial relations.
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Regionalism: The South (3)
desc: Definition of a Southern identity and its relation to the larger U.S. culture, using literary and polemical works of 19th- and 20th-century.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Japanese Americans: Research Topics (3)
desc: Research and thematic seminar on Japanese American culture, issues, and history. Pre: junior standing or consent.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Asian American Music Cultures (3)
desc: An exploration of how Asian American music making is related to community formation, labor migration, and cultural sensibilities throughout the 20th century.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Indigenous Literature and Film (3)
desc: Interdisciplinary, comparative course examining native literary texts (novels, short fiction, poetry), films, etc. that address issues of representation and how native peoples actively resist colonial ideology.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Filipino Americans: Research Topics (3)
desc: A research seminar on the study of Filipino Americans. Special themes in film/video/media, the performing arts, or literature may be offered. Pre: junior standing or consent. (Cross-listed as ES 443)
metadata: American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Critical Research Methods (3)
desc: Overview of methods and methodologies drawn from various fields (including history, politics, literature, art, law and race, Indigenous, gender, and sexuality studies) for conducting interdisciplinary research. Models of writing from AMST faculty; emphasis on writing.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Filipino Americans: History, Culture and Politics (3)
desc: An introduction to the study of Filipino Americans in the U.S. and the diaspora. The course pays special attention to labor migration, cultural production and community politics. Pre: sophomore standing. (Cross-listed as ES 373)
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Empire (3)
desc: Examines the interplay between an “American culture of empire” and the rise of the U.S. as a superpower. Topics: imperialism and political culture, social movements and international affairs, race, gender and class relations. (Cross-listed as HIST 379)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Cinema (3)
desc: Introductory history of American cinema from the silent to the digital era, with an emphasis on criticism, genre and style, as well as cultural and sociopolitical context.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Travel Writing (3)
desc: Survey examines the roles that travel writing plays in American identity- and nation-formation, from early colonial history to the present. A-F only. Pre: 110, 150, 201, 202, 211, or 212. (Alt. years)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Indigenous Lands and Waters (3)
desc: Examines indigenous practices born of and located in Indigenous places. Analyzes how indigenous knowledge of place informs Indigenous cultural, linguistic, intellectual, and political survivance and sovereignty, and resistance.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Screening Asian Americans (3)
desc: Survey of Asian and Asian American representations in American film and television from the silent era to the present, with an emphasis on Orientalism and multiculturalism, as well as performance and spectatorship. SCA majors: A-F only. Pre: junior standing or consent. (Cross-listed as CINE 352)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Culture and the Arts in America (3)
desc: Study of the role of the arts in American society and diverse cultural practices in historical and contemporary contexts.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Contemporary American Design (3)
desc: Investigates design in contemporary American culture. Graphic, industrial, urban, and user-interface design practices are situated within broader social and economic forces. Modes of design practice, production, and consumption studied as reflection of American society today. Open to all class standings. A-F only. (Alt. years)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Design: An Historical Survey (3)
desc: Examination of design in American culture over the last century. Readings in industrial, graphic, interior, architectural, landscape, and user interface design used to study issues of gender, race, and class in the U.S. Open to all class standings. A-F only. (Alt. years)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Religion and Conflict in American History (3)
desc: Analyzes selected historical examples of religious conflicts in America, discerning characteristic patterns of American religious discourse, and identifying the social structures, interests, and ethical principles at stake in conflicts about religion. Sophomore standing or higher. (Fall only) (Crosslisted as REL 345)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Thought and Culture: 20th Century (3)
desc: Continuation of 343: 20th century. Pre: 150 or 201 or 202 or 211 or 212 or HIST 151 or HIST 152; or consent. (Cross-listed as HIST 374)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Thought and Culture: To 20th Century (3)
desc: Politics, family, philosophy, technology, etc.; their interrelationship with the total society. Pre-Colonial to end of Reconstruction. (Cross-listed as HIST 373)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: War and Media (3)
desc:
Examination of a range of media, including photography, film, print journalism, television, video games, and the internet, as they have shaped popular representations and 
experiences of war in America from the Civil War through the present. A-F only. (Alt. years)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Religions in America (3)
desc: Examination of American religious traditions, both historical and contemporary, with an emphasis on the principles of religious liberty, non-establishment, and pluralism. Pre: sophomore standing or consent.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Digital America: Online Communities and Virtual Worlds (3)
desc: Seminar on the impact of the digital revolution and virtual communities on American culture and society, with an emphasis on questions of identity and participatory democracy. Open to non majors. Pre: one DH, DA, or DL course, sophomore standing, or consent.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Folklore and Folklife (3)
desc:
Examination of the history and ethics of folklore studies and the dynamics and social functions of traditional culture in diverse communities through topics such as ritual, storytelling, games, gossip, belief, music, and cultural tourism. Junior standing or higher. 
(Cross-listed as ANTH 326)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Religion and Law in the U.S. (3)
desc: Surveys church-state jurisprudence since the 1940s, with special attention to difficulty of defining religion, and applies the religion clauses to current issues. A-F only. Sophomore standing or higher. Pre: consent. (Once a year)  (Cross-listed as POLS 325)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Environments: Survey (3)
desc: Survey of social, political, and cultural relations in diverse, contemporary American environments, including: island societies, urban centers, suburbs, Indian reservations, farming communities, and national parks. Special emphasis on contemporary environmental issues in Hawai‘i.
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: America, Hawai‘i and World War II (3)
desc: Examines WWII as a watershed in American and Hawai‘i history and culture. Topics  include: Pearl Harbor, Japanese American internment, sex and racial tensions, Anti-Semitism and the Holocaust, and the dawn of the Atomic Age.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Asian America (3)
desc: History of selected Asian immigrant groups from the 19th century to the present. Topics include: immigration and labor history, Asian American movements, literature and cultural productions, community adaptations and identity formation. Pre: junior standing or higher. (Cross-listed as ES 318)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Music and Culture (3)
desc: Analysis of a variety of American musical genres and histories through focused writing assignments (record and performance reviews, personal narratives, interviews, research proposals, research papers). Pre: second year standing or consent. (Alt. years)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: U.S. Women’s History (3)
desc: History of U.S. women and gender relations. Topics include women’s work in and outside the household, women’s involvement in social movements, changing norms about gender and sexuality, and shared and divergent experiences among women. (Cross-listed as HIST 361 and WGSS 311)
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: African Americans: Issues, Culture, History (3)
desc: Traces the history and culture of African Americans and outlines contemporary issues. Topics include: slavery and racism, community formation and resistance, cultural expression, African American diversity, civil rights, gender and class relations.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Japanese Americans: History, Culture, Lifestyles (3)
desc: Explores experiences of Japanese Americans in Hawaiʻi and the U.S.: historical and cultural heritage, biographical portraits, changing family ties, ethnic lifeways, gender relations, local identity, and the future of island living. Emphasis: oral communication skills. DH
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Justice and Asian America: Social Movements and the Law in American History (3)
desc: Examination of demands for and the changing nature of justice, historical and contemporary, through court cases, legislation, presidential orders, and social movements that address legal, social, and political definitions of Asian America. Sophomore standing or higher
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Hip-Hop and American Culture (3)
desc: Survey tracing hip-hop from its Afro-Carribean musical beginnings to contemporary adaptations and interpretations. Students will analyze various materials and will pay attention to the relationships between hip-hop and contemporary social forms. Pre: sophomore standing or consent.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Art and Social Change (3)
desc: Will analyze examples from the visual and performing arts, including murals, digital art, film, poetry, and music, paying particular attention to the connections and influence upon social and political movements, both historically and today. A-F only
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Introduction to Indigenous Studies (3)
desc: Interdisciplinary survey that examines the histories, politics, popular representations, self-representations, and contemporary issues of the indigenous peoples of the U.S. and its territories, including Native Americans, Alaska Natives, Kanaka Maoli, Chamorro, and Samoans.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Contemporary American Global Issues (3)
desc: Interdisciplinary and transnational perspectives on global issues including international law and diplomacy; war, diaspora, and refugees; economic underdevelopment and environmental racism; globalization, race, and the feminization of poverty. Writing emphasis
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Contemporary American Domestic Issues (3)
desc: Current debates in the U.S. over individual rights and nationalism; civil rights, citizenship, and sovereignty; sexuality, law, and religion; economic, racial, and gender equality; public health and environmental justice. Writing emphasis, interdisciplinary perspectives.
metadata: DS American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Experience: Culture and the Arts (3)
desc: Literature and modern media; visual and performing arts; material culture and architecture; foodways and ritual as meaning-making processes that have shaped the diverse identities, spaces, and communities of the Americas. Writing emphasis, interdisciplinary perspectives. DH
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: American Experience: Institutions and Movements (3)
desc: Emergence and transformation of laws, ideologies, institutions, and social movements from the 17th-21st centuries. Emphasis on relationships among structures of power, representational practices, belief systems, and social action. Writing emphasis, interdisciplinary perspectives. DH
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: America and the World (3)
desc: Examines America’s role in world history and the influence of world affairs on U.S. culture and society. Focuses on U.S. interdependence with African, European, Native American, Asian, and Polynesian civilizations, from 1492 to present.
metadata: FGB American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Introduction to American Studies Writing (3)
desc: Introduction to different types of college level writing and information literacy with a focus on American culture and society. A-F only.
metadata: FW American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: AMST
title: Introduction to American Studies (3)
desc: Introduction to different types of college-level writing through analyses of contemporary American culture and to the main themes and approaches used in American studies and the humanities.
metadata: DH American Studies (AMST) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ASL
title: Intermediate American Sign Language II (3)
desc: Continued development of receptive and expressive conversational skills in American Sign Language; linguistic structure introduced inductively through mix of lectures and discussion; includes discussion of history and culture of Deaf community in the U.S. Pre: 201.
metadata: HSL American Sign Language (ASL) College of Arts, Languages & Letters Linguistics (LING)

subject: ASL
title: Intermediate American Sign Language I (3)
desc: Continued development of receptive and expressive conversational skills in American Sign Language; linguistic structure introduced inductively through mix of lectures and discussion; includes discussion of history and culture of Deaf community in the U.S. Pre: 102 (or equivalent).
metadata: HSL American Sign Language (ASL) College of Arts, Languages & Letters Linguistics (LING)

subject: ASL
title: Elementary American Sign Language II (3)
desc: Continued development of basic receptive and expressive conversational skills in American Sign Language; linguistic structure introduced inductively through mix of lectures and discussion; discussion of history and culture of Deaf community in the U.S. Pre: 101 (or equivalent).
metadata: HSL American Sign Language (ASL) College of Arts, Languages & Letters Linguistics (LING)

subject: ASL
title: Elementary American Sign Language I (3)
desc: Development of basic receptive and expressive conversational skills in American Sign Language; linguistic structure introduced inductively through mix of lectures and discussion; includes discussion of history and culture of Deaf community in the U.S.
metadata: HSL American Sign Language (ASL) College of Arts, Languages & Letters Linguistics (LING)

subject: AREC
title: Econometrics II (3)
desc: Specification, statistical estimation, inference, and forecasting of economic models. Includes advanced topics for single-equation models, pooled models, qualitative dependent variables, simultaneous systems, distributed lags, and time series. Pre: 626 and ECON 628, or consent. (Cross-listed as ECON 629)
metadata: Agricultural and Resource Economics (AREC) College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources

subject: AREC
title: Econometrics I (3)
desc: Review of probability, estimation, small sample and asymptotic properties. Bivariate and multiple regression and matrix algebra formulation. Regression diagnostics. Introduction to heteroskedastidity, autocorrelation, simultaneity, dichotomous variables, advanced topics. Pre: NREM 310 or ECON 321, and MATH 241; or consent.
metadata: Agricultural and Resource Economics (AREC) College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources

subject: AREC
title: Biosystems Modeling (3)
desc: Introduction to system thinking, procedures for developing system models, characteristics of important agricultural system modes, computer approach to evaluation and optimization of system models. Pre: one of MATH 215, MATH 241, MATH 251A; or consent. (Crosslisted as BE 638)
metadata: Agricultural and Resource Economics (AREC) College of Tropical Agriculture & Human Resources

subject: AS
title: Senior Cadet Leader II (1)
desc:
Laboratory consists of providing prospective Air Force officers 
opportunities to continue to develop leadership, managerial, and supervisory skills. Instruction will include preparation for active duty. CR/NC only. Pre: must have completed 301 and 302L; or consent.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: National Security Affairs (3)
desc: Continuation of 401. A-F only. Pre: 401 or consent.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Senior Cadet Leader I (1)
desc:
Laboratory consists of providing prospective Air Force officers opportunities to continue to develop leadership, managerial, and supervisory skills. Instruction will include preparation for 
active duty. CR/NC only. Pre: must have completed 301 and 302L; or consent.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: National Security Affairs (3)
desc:
Study of the national security process, regional studies, advanced leadership, ethics, and Air Force doctrine. Special focus placed on preparation for active duty and current issues 
affecting professionalism. A-F only. Pre: must have completed 301 and 302; or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Intermediate Cadet Leader II (1)
desc: Continuation of 301L. CR/NC only. Pre: must have completed AFROTC Field Training; or consent.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Air Force Leadership Studies II (3)
desc: Continuation of 301. Focuses on an examination of Air Force leadership and management concepts. Continued emphasis is given to the refinement of both written and oral communicative skills. A-F only. Pre: must have completed 301.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Intermediate Cadet Leader I (1)
desc: Laboratory consists of demonstration of leadership and management skills needed to successfully function as an Air Force officer. Instruction will include lessons covering planning, organizational and communication skills, and the ability to use available resources to complete an assigned task. CR/NC only. Pre: must have completed AFROTC Field Training; or consent.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Air Force Leadership Studies (3)
desc: Focuses on an examination of ethical Air Force leadership and management concepts. Continued emphasis is given to the refinement of ethical thought through writing and debate. A-F only.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Leadership Laboratory II (1)
desc: Continuation of 251L. Repeatable unlimited times, but credit earned one time only. Sophomore standing or higher. Open to all majors. CR/NC only. Co-requisite: 102 and 202. (Spring only)
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Leadership Laboratory (1)
desc: Laboratory on the basic skills of leadership and followership. Lab includes application of leadership/followership skills, various field trips to military installations, group projects, and physical training. Repeatable one time. CR/NC only. Co-requisite: 101 and 201; or consent. (Fall only)
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Field Training Preparation II (1)
desc: Continuation of 201L. CR/NC only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Evolution of USAF Air and Space Power (2)
desc: Continuation of 201. A-F only.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Field Training Preparation I (1)
desc: Laboratory consists of preparing second-year AFROTC cadets with the skills needed to successfully complete AFROTC Field Training. Students will learn basic military skills, Field Training skills, and participate in physical fitness training. CR/NC only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Evolution of USAF Air and Space Power (2)
desc: Study of Air Force heritage, Quality Air Force principles, ethics, and an introduction to leadership and group leadership problems. Application of written and verbal communication skills is included. A-F only.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Initial Military Training II (1)
desc: Laboratory consists of activities that focus and promote the Air Force way of life. Instruction will include leadership and followership development, teamwork, physical fitness training, and activities designed to build camaraderie and esprit de corps. Course is open to all majors. CR/NC only.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Foundations of the United States Air Force (1)
desc: Continuation of 101. A-F only
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Initial Military Training I (1)
desc: Laboratory consists of activities that focus and promote the Air Force way of life. Instruction will include leadership and followership development, teamwork, physical fitness training, and activities designed to build camaraderie and esprit de corps. Course is open to all majors. CR/NC only.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: AS
title: Foundations of the United States Air Force (1)
desc:
Study of the total force structure, strategic offensive and defensive, general purpose, and 
aerospace support forces of the Air Force in the contemporary world. A-F only.
metadata: Aerospace Studies (AS) ROTC

subject: ACC
title: Directed Reading and Research (V)
desc: Reading and research in an area of accounting under the direction of faculty member(s). Repeatable two times, up to 12 credits. A-F only. Pre: PhD students in Business Administration only.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Research in Auditing and International Accounting (3)
desc:
Provides an overview of accounting research in Auditing and International Accounting 
topics. Specific research studies are examined as to their theoretical basis, design, implications, methodology, relevance, etc. A-F only. Pre: PhD student status in business administration or consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Research in Accounting Information Systems (3)
desc: Provides an overview of accounting research in accounting information systems topics. Specific research studies are examined as to their theoretical basis, design, implications, methodology, relevance, etc. PhD students in Business Administration only. A-F only.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Research in Behavioral Accounting (3)
desc: Provides an overview of accounting research in behavioral accounting topics. Specific research studies are examined as to their theoretical basis, design, implications, methodology, relevance, etc. PhD students in Business Administration only. A-F only.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Managerial Accounting Research (3)
desc: Provides an overview of managerial accounting research. Specific research studies are examined as to their theoretical basis, design, implications, methodology, relevance, etc. A-F only. PhD students in Business Administration only. A-F only.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Financial Accounting Research (3)
desc: Provides an overview of financial accounting research. Specific research studies are examined as to their theoretical basis, design, implications, methodology, relevance, etc. Repeatable one time. A-F only. PhD students in Business Administration only. A-F only.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Thesis Research (V)
desc: Required for Plan A candidates only; six credit hours required, one must be taken during semester that degree is being awarded. Repeatable up to six credits. ACC majors only. Satisfactory/Unsatisfactory only. Pre: MAcc student and School of Accountancy Director approval.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Accounting Internship (V)
desc: On-the-job experience in the accounting community. Necessary evaluation reports and meetings with faculty advisor required. ACC majors only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Current Topics in Accounting (V)
desc: Concentration on current issues impacting the accounting profession. Topics vary each semester. Repeatable two times, up to nine credits.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Analysis and Decision-Making (2)
desc: Integrates learning through analysis and communication of comprehensive business problems. Stresses research, critical thinking, and analytical and communication skills applied to contemporary accounting and tax issues. Pre: 625 with C- or better (or concurrent), no waiver. Co-requisite: 648.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Data Analytics for Accountants (V)
desc: Introduction to visual analytics. Tableau and Power BI for Excel. Introduction to data processing and blending, data visualization and other visualization techniques. Introduction to PowerQuery, PowerPivot, PowerView, and PowerMap. Repeatable two times, up to three credits.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Financial Statements Analysis (1)
desc: Analyses of a firm’s profitability, liquidity, and solvency using ratios and common size financial statements. Students are expected to find strengths and weaknesses of the firm based on their analysis. A-F only. Pre:  323 . Co-requisite:  660 .
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Multijurisdictional Taxation (2)
desc: Examines international, state, and local tax issues. Topics include U.S. International taxation of in- and out-bound transactions, sourcing of income and deductions and nexus. Pre: 401 with C- or better.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Estate and Gift Taxation and Planning (2)
desc: Examines estate and gift tax provisions and basic estate planning techniques to save taxes and avoid probate. Overviews generation-skipping transfer taxes and income taxes on estates and trusts. Pre: 401 with C- or better, or consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Advanced Public Sector Accounting (3)
desc: Provides the tools necessary for understanding the principles of fiscal accountability and reporting in governmental and not-for-profit organizations. ACC majors only. Pre: 415 with C- or better, or consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Tax of Partners/Partnerships (2)
desc: Examines advanced topics in federal taxation of partners and partnerships regarding the contribution, operation, and distribution from partnerships and transfers of partnership interests. Pre: 407 with C- or better, or consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Accounting and Tax Research (3)
desc: In depth examination of tax and accounting research, IRC, and SEC procedures. Extensive practice in issue identification, reading and analyzing primary authority, and communicating results. Credit not given for both 606 and 625. Pre: 401 or 584 with C- or better, orientation program, or consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Global Accounting (3)
desc: Theory and fundamental causes of international variations in accounting. Special emphasis on problems such variations create for financial reporting, control, and decision-making within multinational business enterprises. Pre: 323 with C- or better, or consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Information and Assurance and Analytics (3)
desc: Focus on auditing processes, standards, and guidance specific to IT risks. Exposure to advanced IT audit software and its practical application and real world IT audit issues. Pre: 418 with C- or better, or consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Accounting Theory and Development (3)
desc: History and theoretical background of accounting standards. Including accounting theories, formulating and testing theories; scientific, pragmatic, syntactic and semantic theories; normative and positive theories. Literature supportive and critical of accounting theories and standards. Pre: 323 with C- or better, or consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: International Corporate Governance (3)
desc: Understanding of complex and critical issues of international corporate governance, financial reporting, and ethical conduct. Includes corporate governance in the U.S., major European markets, and Asia. Emphasis on internal and external stakeholders, regulators, and gatekeepers. Graduate students only. A-F only.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: CPA Review-The Regulation (1)
desc: The Regulation section focuses on federal taxation, especially taxation of business entities; individuals, and property taxation, but also tests on business law, business ethics, and professional and legal responsibilities. Repeatable one time. CR/NC only. Co-requisite: 407.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: CPA Review-The Financial Accounting and Reporting (1)
desc: The (FAR) section focuses on U.S. GAAP, including concepts and standards for financial statements, typical items in financial statements, specific types of transactions and events, accounting and reporting for governmental and other entities. CR/NC only. Pre: 323.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: CPA Review-The Business Environment and Concepts (1)
desc: The Business Environment and Concepts (BEC) section focuses on business concepts and the significance of a CPA’s professional duties and responsibilities within the larger context of the business environment. CR/NC only.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: CPA Review-Audit and Attestation (1)
desc: Auditing and Attestation (AUD) section covers the entire auditing process, including auditing procedures, generally accepted auditing standards, standards related to attest engagements, and the AICPA Code of Professional Conduct. CR/NC only. Pre: 418 (or concurrent).
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Forensic Accounting (1)
desc: Theoretical and real life aspects of forensic accounting. Includes discussions of the legal environment, types of forensic engagements such as, lost earnings, business valuations, fraud, and real world forensic cases. Repeatable one time, but credit earned one time only. A-F only. Pre: 418.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Auditing (3)
desc: Auditing concepts including standards, objectives and ethics for external auditors. Emphasis on reporting standards, internal control, evidence, statistical sampling, IT audits and assurance. Development of professional writing skills is an integral part of this course. Pre: 323 and 409, both with C- or better.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Special Topics in Accounting (V)
desc: Addresses current issues impacting the accounting profession. Topics vary each semester. Repeatable two times, up to nine credits. Pre: consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Introduction to Accounting I (3)
desc: Introduction to managerial and financial accounting and methods used to record and report managerial and financial information to decision makers internal and external to the firm. Part I. A-F only. Sophomore standing or higher.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: CINE
title: Independent Group Project (V)
desc: Participation in a group research or creative project under supervision of a faculty member. Only six credits of 399/499 in any combination can be applied to meet requirements for the major. A-F only. Repeatable up to six credits. SCA majors only. Pre: 350 and consent; and 310 or (215 and 216).
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Cinematic Arts Internship (V)
desc: Internship in professional cinematic, television, animation and/or digital media production company under professional and faculty supervision. Repeatable up to six credits. SCA majors only. CR/NC only. Pre: 310 or (215 and 216); and 350.
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Global Media (3)
desc: Close textual analysis and strategic analysis of global media dynamics with an emphasis on transnational media corporations. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 255 or consent.
metadata: DH ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Video Game Design and Development (3)
desc: Students will team design, build, and demonstrate video games or related interactive entertainment environments and applications. Topics will include emerging computer science techniques relevant to the development of these types of environments. Junior standing or higher. Pre: any 215 or ICS 110(Alpha) or ICS 111. (Cross-listed as ICS 485)
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Seminar in Cinematic Arts (3)
desc: Intellectual issues in cinematic arts. Conducted by regular and visiting faculty with extensive student participation and scholarly presentation. Repeatable one time on different topics. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 255 and junior standing, or consent.
metadata: DH ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Data Visualization (3)
desc: Introduction to data visualization through practical techniques for turning data into images to produce insight. Topics include: information visualization, geospatial visualization, scientific visualization, social network visualization, and medical visualization. Junior standing or higher. Pre: 215 or ICS 110(Alpha) or ICS 111. (Cross-listed as DATA 484 and ICS 484)
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Documentary Studies (3)
desc: In-depth study of the nature, history, and impact of documentary filmmaking traditions around the world, focusing on the interplay between filmmaker, subject, and audience. A-F only. Pre: 255 or consent.
metadata: DH ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Oceanic Media and Culture (3)
desc: Involves close textual analysis of film, TV and multimedia content. The course includes cinematic and television screenings. Junior standing or higher. A-F only. Pre: 255 or consent.
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Ethics and Film (3)
desc: Ethical theory and dilemmas as reflected in film and filmmaking. Social responsibility for filmmakers. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: junior standing and 255.
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Indigenous Filmmaking (3)
desc: Theories and studies of indigenous films and creation of a cinematic project based in indigenous cultural and value systems. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 310, 350, and one of the following; 312, 330, 370, 372, or 374.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Advanced Screenwriting (3)
desc: Application of narrative principles of character development, story structure, and thematic spine to screenplays for live action and animated short films, television, or transmedia projects. ACM majors only. A-F only. Pre: 350.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Animation Production II (3)
desc: Student teams produce a short, animated film. Prior knowledge of 2D and 3D media authoring tools and animation techniques is necessary. Repeatable one time. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 317 or (321, 322, and 323); and 350.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Advanced Cinematography (3)
desc: Applies the basic foundations, techniques, and theory of cinematography (covered in CINE 312) to a more informed and crafted practice with Camera and Lighting Scene study workshops, and research exercises and film projects. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 310 and 312.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Advanced Cinematic Production (3)
desc: Production of a major cinematic/digital narrative project. Working in groups, each student takes on creative and technical role and responsibilities of a principle crew position. Emphasis on artistic form in narrative development; timely execution from pre- to post-production. Repeatable one time. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 310; 350; and one of 312, 330, 370, 372, or 374.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Documentary Production (3)
desc: Analysis and practical knowledge of the documentary process including, but not limited to, research, organization and story structure, shooting, camera coverage, and editing. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 310, 350, and one of the following: 312, 330, 370, 372, or 374.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Workshop in Cinematic Arts (V)
desc: Intensive workshop in focused area of cinematic arts production. Repeatable up to six credits. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 310, or 215 and 216.
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Techniques in Cinematic Arts (3)
desc: Specialized techniques in the creation of digital media: taught by regular and *visiting faculty. Repeatable one time on different topics. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 310, or 215 and 216.
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Topics in Cinematic Arts (3)
desc: Topics of study and critical inquiry in a variety of areas in the cinematic arts. Taught by regular and visiting faculty. Repeatable one time on different topics. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 255 or consent.
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Study Abroad (3)
desc: Intensive study of selected topics, genres, filmmakers, or digital media production in the host country in a UH Manoa-approved study abroad location. Repeatable one time. A-F only.
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Authors in Cinematic Arts (3)
desc: In-depth study of the auteur theory and specific application to authors in cinematic arts, such as film directors, animators, screenwriters, or game designers. A-F only. Pre: 255 or consent.
metadata: DH ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Genre and Narrative Theory in Cinematic Arts (3)
desc: Focus on the concept of genre, genre films, genre film criticism, and popular genres such as the Western, film noir, documentary, and Chinese martial arts. A-F only. Pre: 255 or consent.
metadata: DH ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Directing the Camera for the Screen (3)
desc: Detailed analysis of cinematic grammar, placement, movement, focus, and effects of the camera to create the mise-en-scene. Practical exercises to apply theory to individual creative work and in collaboration with actors from the Theatre program. ACM majors only. A-F only. Pre: (310, or 215 and 216), and 350, and 370.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Post Production Sound (3)
desc: Practical course on the theory, art, and techniques of sound recording, editing, and design for cinema. Students work on projects involving dialogue and sound effects in post-production. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 372 (or concurrent).
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Editing for Cinema (3)
desc: Advanced course examining the theory, techniques, and practices of motion picture editing; use of non-linear digital editing systems; and practical experience in digital editing projects. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 310; or 215 and 216.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Directing the Actor on Screen (3)
desc: Introduction of the screen-director to the craft of acting for the camera. Students will develop communication skills and learn practical techniques to elicit spontaneous and relaxed performances with actors from the Theatre program. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 310 or (215 and 216); and 350 (or concurrent).
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Indigenous Aesthetics (3)
desc: Aesthetic theories and practices of indigenous cultures of the Pacific and their adaptation to the screen in cinematic storytelling. A-F only. Pre: 255 or consent.
metadata: DH ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Oral Tradition to Screenplay (3)
desc: Adapting the stories, styles, and cultural values of oral tradition storytelling to cinematic narratives. A-F only. Pre: 350.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Screenwriting (3)
desc: Introduction to the basics of writing a short narrative screenplay for film or animation. Students learn the fundamentals and format of screenwriting as well as basic elements of storytelling and character development. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 255 (or concurrent).
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Independent Producing (3)
desc: Fundamentals of producing for independent filmmaking, focusing on business acumen and role of the producer through various stages of production. Topics include proposal writing, script breakdowns, budgeting, scheduling, legal issues, festival strategy, and distribution. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 255; and 310 or (215 and 216).
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Motion Graphics (3)
desc: A project-based introduction to motion graphics using Adobe After Effects. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 215 and 216; or 310.
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Animation Production I (3)
desc: Students work independently to produce a short, animated film. Emphasis on visual storytelling and character animation. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 317 or (321, 322, and 323); and 350.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE/ACM
title: Classical 2D Full Animation (3)
desc: Hand drawn full animation techniques; rough animation, inbetweening, clean up animation and digital color processes. Digital line testing, sync dialog and other advanced skills for classical 2D full animation. ACM majors only. A-F only. Pre: 216 and 255 and ART 113, or consent.
metadata: ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: 3D Lighting, Camera, and Rendering (3)
desc: Students develop the ability to manipulate light, shadow, and color within a virtual 3D space. Rendering and cinematography for 3D animation. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 316.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: 3D Animation (3)
desc: Creating the illusion of life through the principles of animation. Repeatable one time for different alphas. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 315.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: 3D Modeling (3)
desc: Essential principles of 3D modeling in order to create both organic character models and hard surface models. Students will create high-quality, animation-ready 3D models with textures and poses. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 215.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Cinematography (3)
desc: Comprehensive course in visual styles supporting screen narratives through a study of principles of camera elements, operations, lighting, color and composition. Professional role and responsibilities of cinematographer. Project-oriented. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 310
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Cinematic Narrative Production (3)
desc: Production-intensive course with collaborative as well as individual projects. Theories and application of basic digital cinema productions, including camera, lighting, sound, and editing. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 255 (or concurrent).
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Introduction to Cinematic Digital Production (3)
desc: Introduction to the basic techniques of cinematic digital production and allows them to explore their personal voice in this process. A-F only.
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ACC
title: Introduction to Accounting II (3)
desc: Introduction to managerial and financial accounting and methods used to record and report managerial and financial information to decision makers internal and external to the firm. Part II. Pre: 200 (with a C- or better).
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: CINE
title: Introduction to 3D Computer Animation (3)
desc: A basic overview of the 3D animation production process, including modeling, texturing, rigging, animation, lighting, and rendering. A-F only. Pre: 255 (or concurrent).
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: CINE
title: Introduction to 2D Animation (3)
desc: Introduction to traditional styles and methods of hand drawn 2D, digital, and stop motion animation through theory and practice. SCA majors only. A-F only. Pre: 255 (or concurrent) and ART 113 (or concurrent).
metadata: DA ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ACC
title: Intermediate Financial Accounting I (3)
desc: Accounting process and the application of GAAP to the recognition and measurement of cash, receivables, inventories, property plant and equipment, depreciation and depletion, intangibles, and current liabilities. Pre: 200 and 210, or BUS 624 (with a minimum grade of C- or better).
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Intermediate Financial Accounting II (3)
desc: Application of GAAP to the recognition and measurement of long-term liabilities, investments, contributed capital, retained earnings, accounting changes and errors, income recognition, accounting for income taxes, pensions, leases, and statement of cash flows. Pre: 321 with C- or better.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: CINE
title: Introduction to Cinema and Digital Media (3)
desc: Introduction to the study of cinema: history, aesthetics, and cultural impact. A-F only.
metadata: DH ACM: The School of Cinematic Arts (CINE) College of Arts, Languages & Letters

subject: ACC
title: Accounting Internship (V)
desc: On-the-job experience in the accounting community. Term paper and meetings with faculty advisor required. CR/NC only. Pre: consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Directed Reading and Research (V)
desc: Reading and research of a special area in major under direction of faculty member(s). Project must include statement of objectives, outline of activities planned, results expected, and how they are to be reported and evaluated. Must be approved in advance by the department chair and faculty advisor.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Federal Individual Income Taxation (3)
desc:
Examines federal income tax concepts, such as gross income, exclusions, deductions, exemptions, and tax credits, especially for sole proprietors. Introduces taxation of property transactions. Development of professional writing skills is integral to this course. Pre: 200 and 210, or BUS 624 (with a minimum grade of 
C- or better).
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Taxation of Business Entities (3)
desc: A survey of the general concepts, rules, and practices involved in the taxation of sole-proprietorships, corporations, partnerships, and subchapter S corporations. Pre: 401 with C- or better.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Accounting Information Systems (3)
desc: Accounting systems analysis, control and design in manual and computerized environments. Knowledge and skills of information technology for auditing AIS systems. Hands-on experience with microcomputers and a computerized accounting system. A-F only. Pre: 323 (with C- or better or concurrent) and BUS 311 (with C or better).
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Law for the Accountant (3)
desc: Intensive study of areas of law of importance to accountants. Particular attention is given to principles of law relating to contracts, sales, commercial paper, secured transactions, property, legal entities, agency, securities, and accountant’s legal liability. Pre: BLAW 200 or consent.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business

subject: ACC
title: Advanced Financial Accounting (3)
desc: Accounting topics relating to consolidation requirements and introduction to the fundamentals of fund accounting, including the general fund, restricted funds, debt service funds, enterprise funds, general long-term account group, general fixed assets accounting group, and accounting entries for encumbrances. Pre: 323 with C- or better.
metadata: Accounting (ACC) Shidler College of Business
